Title: 5 ways blockchain is changing business‚Ä¶
Subtitle: Written by William Tien
Author: William Tien
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in William Tien Follow -- 3 Listen Share Most media outlets advocating for or against blockchain focus primarily on the case of cryptocurrencies. Over the past couple of years, cryptocurrencies have made more headlines than ever before. This is particularly due to the volatility in the price of the most popularly known cryptocurrency, Bitcoin. However, to pin Bitcoin or cryptocurrencies as the embodiment of blockchain technology is akin to pinning email as the sole use case for the Internet. An alternative to mainstream fiat currencies is merely a single implementation of the potential for integrating a blockchain system. Below are 5 game-changing implementations of blockchain that most people wouldn‚Äôt immediately consider. IT and Cybersecurity Beyond just a currency, blockchain is a security protocol. It is a digital ledger that is immutable and essentially unhackable. Even big-name companies like Equifax, Target, and Yahoo have had data breaches in recent years that have led to the public dissemination of private information from millions of their users. The evolution of technology affects both sides of the spectrum; as security measures are refined, so too are the methods of hacking becoming more and more specialized to breach these security walls. Blockchain-backed security provides a way of recording transactions, or any digital interaction, in a way that is secure, transparent, highly resistant to outages, auditable, and efficient. Organizations like Kodak, Lockheed Martin, and even the US Department of Defense are studying the advantages that blockchain offers in protecting critical intellectual property. Social Networking Possibly one of the most critical needs for greater security is in our networking applications. Messaging platforms are now the primary means of communication for most users. Calls and SMS messages are now a secondary alternative. By default, messages are usually sent through platforms like WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, Line, Telegram, WeChat, Instagram, or other such platforms. Occasionally, these messages may include private or sensitive documents, pictures, or recordings that the user trusts won‚Äôt be released to the general public. As such, it is imperative to implement encryption algorithms on top of higher security layers, like a blockchain, so that even in the event of a security breach the data is impossible to decrypt. Finance and Accounting Accounting is the textbook case study for a business field that can benefit significantly from blockchain technology. Tax codes are overwhelmingly complex and need the utmost precision and accuracy. Blockchain‚Äôs transparency allows for visibility to all transactions for approved users. This may decrease auditors‚Äô work with sampling and validating transactions, allowing them to focus on controls and investigating anomalies. Further, blockchain is having a significant effect on finance. Cross-border payments are complex with today‚Äôs banking infrastructure. The use of a shared digital ledger to record and verify transactions simplifies the entire process. The benefits for this model are numerous, including faster processing speeds (transferring money between countries in seconds, not days) and immensely lower transaction fees. Similarly, blockchain is an effective tool for identity verification and management. The technology decreases the incidence of money laundering and other such criminal financial activities. Healthcare The healthcare system, particularly in the US, has been the subject of a lot of controversy in recent years. Blockchain could be the solution to this, as it provides a more efficient method for maintaining the integrity of medical records. These records include the basic information of the patient as well as their medical history. Once these have been created and signed, by both the patient and their doctor, the information can be written into the blockchain to guarantee it cannot be tampered with. The authenticity of medical records is pivotal in caring for patients and upholding justice in legal cases that involve health care services. Blockchain can facilitate the process of consent management. The medical procedures a patient has consented to can be put on the blockchain where it can be accessed by anyone with the necessary permissions. The blockchain can also be used to track and reward patients who keep their appointments, stay healthy, and contribute their data to further clinical research. Advertising and Marketing Blockchain technology boosts credibility in marketing and public relations. It can aid PR firms in determining whether clicks and mentions on social media are from humans or bots. Companies that receive genuine human engagement are better positioned to improve customer loyalty and provide improved products and services. Companies that do not use blockchain technology in their marketing efforts may have less valid statistics. Juniper Research anticipates advertisers will lose an estimated $19 billion to fraudulent activities in 2019. This figure represents advertising on online and mobile devices. These losses are projected to reach as high as $44 billion by 2022. Blockchain systems can help dramatically reduce ‚Äúclick fraud,‚Äù ensuring marketing and advertising executives can reach their target markets. The principles of blockchain, historically developed as a prevention to banking fraud, can be applied to programmatic media buying by using the system to monitor and govern budget spend. Advertisers can track investment from the initial transfer of the media budget to the final publication of creative with the media owner. This preventative measure can help in reducing the risk of overcharging and underperformance. Blockchain technology can serve as a validator for PR firms to guarantee the originality of their press releases and social media posts. It also helps companies to publish their content across social media platforms and having a digital ledger with unreleased content may also improve content management. Companies can track all changes made to their records as well as the people who make them. These 5 examples of alternative blockchain implementation are only the beginning. Countless other cases are arising and ongoing projects are helping to pave the way towards a wider adoption. The next few years will form the foundation for the future of this novel technology and with further advancements in other tech sectors the possibilities for more efficient and reliable systems are limitless. -- -- 3 Futurist and advocate of time travel Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: How the b2b and b2c cloud gaming platforms work. Solutions for excellent image quality and tackling the ‚Äúlast mile‚Äù challenge effectively.
Subtitle: Streamer defeats opponents through Playkey
Author: Playkey Team
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Playkey Team Follow -- Listen Share Cloud gaming has been hailed as one of the new technology changes to be excited about for 2019. Over the next 6 years, the cloud gaming market is expected to grow by 10 times ‚Äî from $45 million USD in 2018 to $450 million USD in 2024. Tech giants are already rushing in to develop the niche: Google and Nvidia have launched beta versions of their cloud gaming services, and Microsoft, EA, Ubisoft, Amazon, and Verizon are preparing to storm the market. This is great news for gamers. Very soon, they will no longer need to sink ridiculous sums of money into the bottomless pit of hardware upgrades. They will finally be able to play the most power-hungry games on low-spec machines and achieve the same performance they would get from a super expensive system. But what about the other players in the ecosystem? Do publishers, developers, TV manufacturers, and telecom operators have anything to gain from this revolution? The answer is yes, and in this article, we‚Äôll be revealing a powerful tool that will allow them to penetrate this promising market and boost their revenue with minimal investment and negligible risk. Game publishers and developers are interested in delivering their product to as many players and as quickly as possible. But our data shows that currently, games are failing to reach up to 70% of their potential buyers. Players simply do not want to wait for a client and installation file weighing tens of gigabytes to download. Additionally, from the results of this survey, 60% of users do not have a computer that can handle demanding games (AAA level) at acceptable quality. Cloud gaming will be able to solve this problem. More importantly, it will not reduce the revenue of publishers and developers. On the contrary, it will help them build up a wider paying audience. The field of cloud gaming is now becoming attractive to TV and set-top box manufacturers. In the era of smart homes and voice assistants, they have to increasingly compete for the user‚Äôs attention. Offering game functionality is a key way to attract this attention. With integrated cloud gaming, they can offer their customers the ability to run modern games directly on their TV by paying a subscription fee for the service directly to the manufacturer. Another potentially active member of the ecosystem is a telecoms operator. Operators increase revenue by providing additional services ‚Äî gaming being one of these. Rostelecom has launched the ‚ÄúGame‚Äù tariff, while Akado sells access to our Playkey service. It is not just about broadband Internet operators. In connection with the active spread of 5G, mobile operators will also be able to take advantage of cloud gaming as an additional revenue stream. Despite the bright prospects, it‚Äôs not that easy to enter the market. All existing services, including products by tech giants, have not yet managed to completely overcome the ‚Äúlast mile‚Äù problem. This means that due to the imperfection of the network, specifically in the house or apartment, the Internet speed of the user is not enough for cloud gaming to work correctly. Stakeholders who have been on the market for a long time and possess powerful resources are gradually moving towards solving this problem. But starting your cloud gaming service from scratch in 2019, means a massive investment, both financially and in opportunity cost. More importantly, there‚Äôs no guarantee of creating a working solution. But now, you have the opportunity of penetrating this rapidly-growing market, thanks to our new technology that allows you to launch your cloud gaming service quickly and at a fraction of the expense. Playkey began to develop its cloud gaming technology back in 2012. In 2014, the product was launched commercially, and by 2016, 2.5 million players had made use of the service at least once. Throughout the development, we have seen interest not only from gamers but also from TV set-top box manufacturers and telecom operators. We have even launched several pilot projects with NetByNet and Er-Telecom. In 2018, we decided that our product may have a B2B future. Developing a bespoke cloud gaming integration (as we did in pilot projects) for each company, poses a real challenge. Each such implementation takes from three months to six months. Why? Because every company has different hardware, operating systems, and requirements. One might need cloud gaming on an Android console, while someone like iFrame needs it in the web interface of a personal account for streaming to computers. Additionally, companies have different design and billing requirements, and other feature demands. It became clear that it was necessary either to increase the development team tenfold or to build the ultimate out-of-the-box B2B solution. In March 2019, we launched Remote Click ‚Äî a software that companies can install on their servers, which gives them a working cloud gaming service. On the client side, users will see a button on the familiar website, allowing them to launch a game in the cloud. When the button is clicked, the game will start on the company‚Äôs server, the user will receive the audio and video stream, and will be able to play remotely. That is what it might look like in popular digital game distribution services. Remote Click overcomes numerous technical barriers. The first generation of cloud gaming (such as OnLive) was destroyed by the poor quality of the Internet among its users. At the time, in 2010, the average Internet connection speed in the USA was only 4.7 Mbit/s. But by 2017, it had grown to 18.7 Mbit/s, and 5G is set to usher in a new era. But despite the fact that ‚Äî in general ‚Äî the infrastructure is ready for cloud gaming, the above mentioned ‚Äúlast mile‚Äù problem remains. First, there‚Äôs the ‚Äúexternal‚Äù element, where the user has problems with the network itself. For instance, the operator might not actually be providing the advertised maximum speed. Another case is where 2.4 GHz WiFi is being used, which might be receiving interference from a microwave oven or a wireless mouse. Then there‚Äôs the ‚Äúinternal‚Äù element, where the user doesn‚Äôt even suspect that there might be a problem with the network (they don‚Äôt know that they don‚Äôt know)! At best, he or she is sure that if the operator is selling a connection of 100 Mbit/s, then the Internet connection is 100 Mbit/s. At worst, he or she has no idea what a router is, and thinks there‚Äôs such a thing as ‚Äúblue internet‚Äù and ‚Äúcolored internet‚Äù. This is an actual case from client development. But both parts of this ‚Äúlast mile‚Äù problem can be overcome. Remote Click uses active and passive mechanisms to achieve that. Here‚Äôs how those mechanisms work. 1. Effective Forward Error Correction (FEC) of transmitted data a.k.a redundancy When transmitting video data from the server to the client, we use forward error correction. This allows us to restore the original data in cases where it is partially lost due to network problems. What makes our solution effective? 2. Data reforwarding An alternative method to deal with losses is to request data again. For example, if the server and the user are in Moscow, the delay in transmission will not exceed 5 ms. With this value, the client application will have time to request and receive the lost part of the data from the server out of the sight of the user. Our system decides by itself when to apply redundancy, and when to apply reforwarding. 3. Customized data transfer To choose the best way to deal with losses, our algorithm analyzes the user‚Äôs network connection and sets up the data transmission system individually in each case. It looks at: If you rank the connections by losses and delays, then the cable is obviously the most reliable. Through Ethernet, losses are rare, and delays in the ‚Äúlast mile‚Äù are extremely unlikely. Next comes WiFi 5 GHz and finally WiFi 2.4 GHz. Mobile connections are very poor quality, which is why we are waiting for 5G. When using WiFi, the system automatically configures the user‚Äôs adapter, putting it into the most suitable mode for use in the cloud (for example, turning off power saving). 4. Customized encoding Video streaming exists thanks to codecs ‚Äî programs for video compression and recovery. In the uncompressed form, one second of video easily exceeds one hundred megabytes, and the codec reduces this value by an order of magnitude. We are armed with H264 and H265 codecs. H264 is the most popular one. All major video card manufacturers have been supporting it at the hardware level over the past decade. H265 is a daring newcomer. It became supported by hardware five years ago. Encoding and decoding in H265 requires more resources, but the quality of the compressed frame is much higher than in H264. And without increasing the volume! But the big dilemma is, which codec should be chosen, and which encoding parameters should be set for a specific user, based on their hardware? It is a sophisticated problem that we solve automatically. The smart system analyzes the capabilities of the equipment, sets the optimal parameters of the encoder and selects a decoder on the client side. 5. Loss compensation Though it‚Äôs hard to admit, even our system is not perfect. Some of the data lost in the depths of the network cannot be recovered and we do not have time to reforward it. But in cases like this, there are still solutions. One method is by adjusting the bitrate. Our algorithm constantly controls the amount of data transmitted from the server to the client. It records every shortcoming and even predicts possible future losses. Its task is to monitor over time and, ideally, to predict when losses will reach a critical value that could result in flaws on the screen that are noticeable to the user, and control this by adjusting the amount of data transmitted (bitrate) at that moment. Additionally, we use the invalidation of unpicked frames and the mechanism of reference frames in the video stream. Both tools reduce the number of noticeable artifacts. That is, even with serious disruptions in data transmission, the image on the screen remains acceptable, and the game is playable. 6. Distributed transmission Data transmission distributed over time also improves the quality of streaming. The way in which it is distributed depends on specific indicators in the network, for example, the presence of losses, ping, and other factors. Our algorithm analyzes them and selects the best option. Sometimes distribution within a few milliseconds reduces losses by several times. 7. Reducing delay One of the key characteristics when playing through the cloud is a delay. A smaller delay results in a better gaming experience. The delay can be provisionally divided into two parts: The network delay depends on the infrastructure and it is problematic to deal with. If the wire is gnawed by a mouse, waving a dead chicken over it will not help. On the other hand, the system delay can be reduced by several times and the quality of cloud gaming for the player will change dramatically. In addition to the above mentioned forward error correction and personalized settings, we use two more mechanisms. With the use of our technology, with a network delay of 0 ms and working with a video stream of 60 FPS, the delay of the entire system does not exceed 35 ms. In our experience, many users have little idea of how their devices connect to the Internet. In an interview with players, it was discovered that some people do not know what a router is. And that‚Äôs fine! You do not have to know the structure of an internal combustion engine to drive a car. You should not require the user to have the knowledge of a system administrator to play a game. However, some technical points are still important to convey, so that players can independently remove barriers on their side. And we help them with this. 1. Indication of WiFi 5 GHz support Above, we wrote that we can see the Wi-Fi standard ‚Äî 5 GHz or 2.4 GHz. And we also know whether the network adapter of the user device supports the ability to operate at 5 GHz. If that‚Äôs the case, we recommend using this range. We cannot change the frequency on our own yet, as we are unable to see the characteristics of the router. 2. Indication of WiFi signal strength Some users can have a weak WiFi signal, even if the Internet works well and it seems that the speed is acceptable. The problem will be revealed particularly during cloud gaming, which puts the network under real test. Signal intensity is affected by obstacles ‚Äî for example, walls ‚Äî and interference from other devices. Microwave ovens are a common source of this. As a result, there are losses that are imperceptible when working on the Internet, but critical to cloud gaming. In such cases, we warn the user about the interference, we suggest finding a position closer to the router and turning off ‚Äúnoisy‚Äù devices. 3. Indication of traffic leeches Even if everything is fine with the network, other applications might be consuming too much traffic, for instance, if a video is running on Youtube while running a game in the cloud or downloading torrents. Our application calculates these traffic leeches and warns the player about them. Cloud games as a fundamentally new way of consuming game content, have been trying to break through to the market for almost a decade. And as in the case of any innovation, their story is a series of small victories and resounding defeats. It is not surprising that over the years cloud gaming has become overgrown with myths and prejudices. At the dawn of the technology, they were reasonable, but today they are completely groundless. Myth 1. The image in the cloud is worse than in the original ‚Äî as if playing on YouTube Today, in the technically advanced cloud solution, the images of the original and that of the cloud are almost identical ‚Äî there is no difference evident to the naked eye. Encoder customization based on the player‚Äôs equipment, in addition to a complex of mechanisms for dealing with losses, takes this issue off the table. There is no blurring of frames or graphics artifacts in a high-quality network. We even take resolution into account. It makes no sense to stream the picture in 1080p if the player uses 720p. Below are two Apex Legends videos from our channel. One video shows the game being played on a PC. The other shows the game being played in the cloud on Playkey. Apex Legends on PC Apex Legends on Playkey Myth 2. Unstable quality Network status is indeed inconsistent, but this problem has been resolved. We dynamically change the settings of the encoder based on the quality of the user‚Äôs network. We support a constantly acceptable level of FPS by special methods of image capture. How does it work? The game has a 3D engine that is used to build a 3D world. But the user is shown a flat image. In order to make the user see it, a picture of memory is created for each frame ‚Äî a kind of photograph of how this 3D world is seen from a certain point. This picture is stored in encoded form in the video memory buffer. We capture it from the video memory and transfer it to the encoder, which then decrypts it. And so on with each frame, one after another. Our technology allows you to capture and decode the image in one stream, which increases the FPS. And if these processes are conducted in parallel (a solution that is quite popular in the cloud gaming market), the encoder will constantly engage capture, take new frames with a delay and, accordingly, transfer them with a delay. Myth 3. Due to lags in the controls, I will be a ‚Äúsnail‚Äù in multiplayer Normal delay in control amounts to a few milliseconds and is usually imperceptible to the end user. But sometimes there is a tiny delay between the movement of the mouse and the resulting cursor movement. This does not affect anything but creates a negative impression. The technique mentioned earlier, of rendering the cursor directly on the user‚Äôs device, eliminates this disadvantage. Other than that, the total system delay of 30‚Äì35 ms is so small that neither the player nor his/her rivals in the match will notice anything. The outcome of the battle is purely dependent on skill. Here‚Äôs a clear example of this. vk.com Cloud gaming is already a reality. Playkey, PlayStation Now, and Shadow are working services with their own audience and market place. And like many young markets, cloud gaming will grow rapidly in the coming years. One of the scenarios that seems most likely to us is the emergence of private services owned by game publishers and telecom operators. Some of them will develop their own solutions, others will use ready-made out-of-the-box solutions like RemoteClick.net. The more players on the market, the faster the cloud-based way of consuming game content will become the mainstream. P.S. Hey, if you liked the article, please, give us a dozen or so of claps for the good luck! -- -- Playkey is a working cloud gaming platform, invented to make all hardcore games available on any device without requirements to high productivity CPU and GPU. Title: Wi-Fi: A Poem
Subtitle: Published in The Partnered Pen
Author: Nadia Davidson
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Member-only story Nadia Davidson Follow The Partnered Pen -- Share Invisible, everywhere, Unseen, it can be harmful ‚Äì It‚Äôs so new, we don‚Äôt know yet, Some think it affects brain waves. We move within fields of it That criss-cross buildings; Inside houses, outside, Over vast distances it falters. Each area has one. If not there is no window Upon the world Within the hand. Towers in woodland glades, Monstrosities within Nature, Stand stark sentinels, To project its power. Each one is different and They cost us. We compare prices And haggle over deals. They are a business. We travel and still the vast, Expanding network of connection Follows us to enable Instantaneous knowledge. -- -- MPP friends writing about life, love, and everything else in between together. My name is Nadia Davidson. I am an artist who enjoys writing about the process of making art, bullet journaling and self improvement www.moltenimaginings.com Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Fixed Wireless Access (FWA): On a massive scale with 5G
Subtitle: Written by Animesh Jain
Author: Animesh Jain
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Animesh Jain Follow -- Listen Share Fixed wireless access, or FWA, is not a new industry term or service. There have been multiple approaches to building FWA; WiMAX can be considered as a fixed wireless access solution. Even LTE can serve as a foundation for FWA. The key difference between a 5G FWA solution and any other FWA solution is their performance. WiMAX is the widely accepted wireless solution providing 10 Mbps download speeds; an LTE solution supports 10‚Äì100 Mbps speeds. A 5G solution can deliver speeds per second in gigabits, which means 10 to 20 times faster than 4G. Multiple 5G test trails have been conducted by different vendors across the world, and they have reported the downlink speeds of up to 25 Gbps. Thus, owing to faster speeds and low latency, this technology directly competes with fiber-like or high-speed broadband access networks 5G, as a fixed wireless solution, was not in focus until companies such as Verizon and AT&T started discussing the possible impact of 5G FWA on mobile phones, smart homes, connected cars, and smart cities, among various other applications. These companies also plan to launch 5G FWA solutions for end users much before the commercial launch of 5G services. In October 2018, Verizon launched a 5G FWA service in 4 US cities, namely, Houston, Indianapolis, Sacramento, and Los Angeles. The company is offering typical speeds of 300 Mbps with peaks of 940 Mbps in the price range of USD 50‚Äì70. The market potential for 5G FWA is massive. The discussion of 5G FWA started with providing internet access solutions to rural areas where it is not possible to have a fiber connection, as well as to semi-urban areas that have limited access to a fiber connection. This market has the potential to target nearly 1,100 million subscribers by 2021 in terms of a number of subscribers.The growth and future opportunities of the 5G fixed wireless access market is driven by the factors such as surging demand for high-speed internet connectivity and broad network coverage with reduced latency and power consumption, increasing adoption of advanced technologies such as machine-to-machine (M2M)/lnternet of Things (IoT), growing use of millimeter-wave technology in 5G FWA, rising demand for 5G FWA networks from varied industries, remarkable progress in telecommunications and networking technologies, escalating requirement for IoT and cloud-based services, development of 5G network, and strategic partnerships with system integrators in emerging economies. The government will play a significant role in the success of the 5G FWA. First, the government can provide operators with the spectrum they need to support high-speed wireless services. Second, governments should create regulations that facilitate deployments, such as making laws that speed up the ability of an operator to install small outdoor cells. Governments can take a proactive stand and even encourage investments for both suburban and rural areas in new high-speed infrastructure. The US telecom regulator made a new rule opening up 11GHz of spectrum for 5G deployments above the 24GHz band. The newly released spectrum includes 3.85GHz (27.5‚Äì28.35GHz), 37GHz (37‚Äì38.6GHz), 39GHz (38.6‚Äì40GHz) and 64‚Äì71GHz (7GHz) unlicensed spectrum.North America is considered as the most advanced region in terms of well-established infrastructure and the adoption of advanced technologies. The wide presence of key industry players offering 5G FWA solutions is the main factor responsible for the dominance of North America in the 5G fixed wireless access market. For instance, Qualcomm Technologies (US), Mimosa Networks, Inc. (US), Cohere Technologies, Inc. (US), Cellular South, Inc. (C Spire) (US), TELUS Corporation (Canada), United States Cellular Corporation (LIS), AT&T Inc. (US), Verizon Communications Inc. (US), Cisco (LIS) are a few major companies from the region that are actively participating in the development of 5G FWA solutions. In June 2017, AT&T launched the second trial using millimeter wave (mmWave) technology in Austin, Texas. The second trial delivered a connection to residential consumers, small businesses, and enterprises using Ericsson‚Äôs 5G RAN and the Intel 5G Mobile Trial Platform. The trial participants streamed premium live TV via DIRECTV NOW and experienced faster broadband services ‚Äî all over a fixed wireless 5G signal. Also, in Ericsson‚Äôs 5G RAN and the Intel 5G Mobile Trial Platform. The trial participants streamed premium live TV via DIRECTV NOW and experienced faster broadband services ‚Äî all over a fixed wireless 5G signal. Also, in June 2018, Samsung (South Korea) and Cisco (LIS) entered into a partnership agreement with Verizon (US) to deploy the 5G trial network in the LIS. In this network implementation, Cisco (US) provided a virtualized ultra-services platform with advanced services, while Samsung provided the virtual RAN in connection with Samsung‚Äôs 5G radio base stations and 5G home routers. This would strengthen the position of North America in the 5G fixed wireless access market. Following are some of the major 5G FWA test trials ‚Äî Samsung (South Korea) and Arqiva (UK) Completed Trial Test of 5G FWA Technology in the UK and Europe‚Ä¢ AT&T Inc. (US), together with Ericsson and Intel, completed a trial test of 5G FWA Technology in the US‚Ä¢ C Spire (US) completed a trial test of 5G FWA Technology in Mississippi (US)‚Ä¢ Orange Romania completed a trial test of 5G FWA Technology with Cisco and Samsung‚Ä¢ U.S. Cellular completed a trial test of 5G FWA Technology with Ericsson‚Ä¢ Huawei completed a trial test of 5G FWA Technology with Telus‚Ä¢ Telefonica completed a trial test of 5G FWA Technology with Cohere Technologies and 5tonic Labs‚Ä¢ MTN Completed Trial Test of 5G FWA Technology with Huawei‚Ä¢ Swisscom Completed Trial Test of 5G FWA Technology with Hrvatski Telekom‚Ä¢ LG U+ Completed Trial Test of 5G FWA Technology with Huawei Qualcomm Technologies (US), Nokia Corporation (Finland), Samsung Electronics (South Korea), Huawei (China), Ericsson (Sweden), Mimosa Networks, Inc. (US), Cohere Technologies, Inc. (US), Siklu Communication, Ltd. (Israel), AT&T Inc. (US), Verizon Communications Inc. (LIS), Cisco (US), Arqiva (Hampshire), Cellular South, Inc. (C Spire) (US), Orange SA (France), United States Cellular Corporation (US ).We believe that 5G will drive innovative services and could transform telco operators in multiple industries from simple connectivity providers into broad service and solution providers. At the same time, 5G opens up opportunities for non-telco players, especially businesses and neutral urban infrastructure providers, to enter the mobile arena to participate directly in shaping the future digital ecosystem of other businesses, cities and countries as a whole. Governments seeking to improve the stature of their countries must accelerate processes of spectrum allocation at attractive costs so that operators and companies within their jurisdictions can join the 5G race. They will make it possible for their countries to become leading 5 G markets, with all the benefits that imply.The 5G leadership competition will increase dramatically in 2019/2020, with major commercial network launches expected worldwide, enabled by new spectrum allocations and driven by increased business demand. -- -- Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Blockchain meets the Automotive Industry and it‚Äôs disruptive Implications
Subtitle: Published in HackerNoon.com
Author: Petro Wallace
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Petro Wallace Follow HackerNoon.com -- Listen Share According to a report by IBM institute for business value, it‚Äôs estimated that 62% of the automotive industry is set to utilize blockchain technology for various use-cases by 2021. Some of the most renowned and beloved car brands are tapping into DLT, as Blockchain writes a new chapter for the industry with evangelist confident that the Automotive industry will be next in line to be disrupted by this new nascent technology. Even more so, 95% of Automotive manufacturers are planning on making ‚Äò‚Äômoderate to significant‚Äù investments in the technology with Enterprise through endowing startups to aid the development of potential blockchain-based solutions. What‚Äôs driving ‚Äò‚ÄôConnected car‚Äô‚Äô services will be the marriage of Automotive technologies & Blockchain. The technology is set to provide a ‚Äò‚Äômuch-needed‚Äô‚Äô change that‚Äôs capable of addressing key issues faced by the struggling automotive industry. At the moment, enterprises are busy testing out blockchain-pilots with the clear intention of driving innovation and solutions across the entire ecosystem, or where it‚Äôs most applicable. To get a better idea of the disruptive impact of DLT, here are several use-cases in which Blockchain will reshape the automobile industry: Commerce: Since data integrity plays a vital role in modern finance where problems can arise when an error occurs as the result of manual data entry, facilitating trade, and data management. Distributed Ledger technology (DLT) is meant to streamline these processes, allowing independent parties to keep an accurate record of a vehicle‚Äôs lifetime. Supply Chain: Thousands of parts are needed to manufacture a car, a process which involves an extensive network of individuals, organizations, resources & activities. Due to the complexity of managing large supply chains, parts are essentially at risk of being damaged, stolen, and replaced. By Implementing DLT to further manage the supply chain, companies will have an effective & efficient means of tracking all the components from the day it‚Äôs produced, to it being shipped as the final product. Mobility: The involvement of Third-parties such as insurance, maintenance, and even cleaning services requires vehicle owner to disclose confidential information. The use of Blockchain allows customers to manage personal data and share that information with third-party service providers. On-demand mobility services (MaaS) through integration of Blockchain, allows various forms of transport services into a single mobility services that‚Äôs made accessible on demand. MaaS is often used to describe a shift away from personally-owned modes of transportation and towards mobility solutions, solutions consumed as a service such as Ride-sharing is a good example. However, there‚Äôs one area in which Blockchain will have the biggest impact and is set to disrupt, which has to do with Connected Car Technologies. The next digital revolution to have a deep impact on the automotive industry will be all about communication and autonomous vehicle. For now, there are several trends that seem to be shaping the future of Connected Cars. The term ‚Äò‚Äôconnected car‚Äô‚Äô is used to describe the digitization of IoT-compatible cars and advances in technology that allow vehicles to communicate & connect with one another over a Network. It‚Äôs true that Connectivity will be one of the main factors driving the connected cars development, and Blockchain is set to play a vital role when it comes to improving the quality and speed of vehicle communications. DLT has the ability to store asset ownership rights, settle transactions as part of a globalized payment system, and allow for greater transparent Supply-chain management Hyundai Motor Group‚Äôs subsidiary, Hyundai AutoEver, has announced a formal partnership with Blocko, a South Korean firm that specializes as a Blockchain-as-a-Service (BaaS) provider. Blocko has signed a MoU with Hyundai Motor Group‚Äôs ICT platform, with the intention of teaming up to develop an in-house platform for the Automotive giant. With the help of Blocko, Hyundai is applying Blockchain to safeguarding vehicle‚Äôs ownership, allowing the tracking of confidential vehicle information such as mileage, service history and age. The BaaS provider also specializes in open-source solutions, introducing Aergo, Blocko‚Äôs latest undertaking that is set to allow Enterprises to make greater use of decentralized technology without having to comprise, by introducing a unique Hybrid Blockchain. Hyundai has announced that its platform will be migrating to Aergo Mainnet, giving us a glimpse of a future where Automotive giants are keen to utilize a more open and public blockchain of choice. For now, Hyundai intends to use a blockchain-powered platform for vehicle lifecycle management, Mobility-as-a-Service (MaaS) and insurance. The Hyundai affiliate company that manages the IT for all 54 of Hyundai Motors Group‚Äôs systems. You can read more about it here. The german car brand has been supportive of Blockchain back in 2018, publicly announcing that it will use the technology as a way to share self-driving car data among Network participants. In an attempt to utilize valuable data collected by self-driving vehicles, BMW plans to use Blockchain to overcome one of the biggest barriers hindering the mass adoption of autonomous by essentially unlocking data that is being kept in silos. In the past, BMW has collaborated with Blockchain-based startups such as Vechain to work on the firm‚Äôs VerifyCar app which designed to entitle each owner, a digital passport of their vehicle. The firm also plans to use the technology to combat manipulated odometers, which is estimated to cost $6.78 billion annually in Germany alone. BMW has also joined the ‚Äò‚ÄôMobility open Blockchain initiative‚Äô‚Äô, a group that was formed with the goal of implementing blockchain to make mobility safer, greener, cheaper and more accessible. In the coming years, BMW will be one of the pioneers in the automotive industry to implement DLT for a number of concepts ranging from supply-chain management, to interconnected autonomous vehicles. An automobile manufacturer that specializes in high-performance luxury sports cars has partnered up with the Berlin-based startup, XAIN, to test blockchain applications to be integrated in Porsche vehicles. Porsche is said to be the first car manufacturer to implement and successfully test Blockchain according to statements made by company. Over the years, Porsche is said to be piloting the technology for the application of locking and unlocking a vehicle, with the grand idea of letting car owners temporarily give someone access to their car In addition to testing, in the past Porsche has finalized a $170 Million loan using Blockchain, by completing a deal with Banco Bilboa Vizcaya Argentaria‚Äôs (BBVA), a Spanish bank known for being a Blockchain advocate and issuing out syndicated corporate loans. Porsche has officially become the first non-Spanish company to complete an acquisition term loan that has been entirely arranged through distributed ledger Industrializing the Blockchain for the Automotive Industry It‚Äôs expected that Automotive Industry will benefit from new technological advancements throughout the years and perhaps even write a new chapter for the sector. With the introduction of electric cars, full autonomy and ride sharing services, there is the possibility of a seismic shift that could lead to a future where Blockchain is the ideal solution for the management of data. Leave it to automotive companies to refine and redefine existing technologiesby introducing new, exciting concepts like artificial intelligence and connected cars with the end-goal of giving us a driving experience that will be like nothing we‚Äôve ever known before. A tipping point can be expected within the next five years, as there are several factors such as the impact of changes inautomotive ownerships, the release of sales models and the greater acceptance & adoption of Blockchain. For now, DLT is finding its way to apply concrete applications within the automotive sector offering a wide-range of viable solutions. This is a period of pilots and trials, prior to the wholesale adoption of technology since we‚Äôre at an early stage. -- -- Elijah McClain, George Floyd, Eric Garner, Breonna Taylor, Ahmaud Arbery, Michael Brown, Oscar Grant, Atatiana Jefferson, Tamir Rice, Bettie Jones, Botham Jean Blockchain Developer in the making, who has embarked on a journey to deploy his own dApps! Fan of Enterprise Blockchain, Crowdfunding and Digital Payments Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: ‚ÄúHas Apple lost its magic?‚Äù- stop this already.
Subtitle: Written by Dhanush
Author: Dhanush
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Member-only story Dhanush Follow -- Share are you bored of people bashing Apple with the use of clickbait title?, Then you have come to the right place. Recently the trend has become more towards bashing Apple for not being like what they used to be before. Let me start by explaining why content creators love creating stuff about Apple. Apple is the most polarizing company in the world. It has a devout following of fans like no other corporations for its products and a callous group for hating anything Apple. If you are into technology then surely you must be in one of the two groups, and you are most likely to click anything related to Apple for praising or bashing it and, content creators are using this phenomenon to lure people. Recently the trend has become more towards bashing Apple for not being like what they used to be before. No company is like what they were a decade ago, and they cannot be because of the ever-changing climate at Silicon Valley. Apple with Steve Jobs at the helm has radically transformed many industries just in the last decade or so, and it is what every company hope to do in their lifetime. They achieved this mainly because the climate was right for Apple and Steve Jobs to make the products they imagine. The processor technology, display technology, battery‚Ä¶ -- -- Technology. Gaming. Title: The Rise of Roybi Robot and Personalized Learning
Subtitle: Written by Elnaz Sarraf
Author: Elnaz Sarraf
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Member-only story Elnaz Sarraf Follow -- Share As a child, I was fortunate that my parents paid a lot of attention to my education especially in language learning and development. However, I realized that not many children have the same opportunity. My early childhood education and the skills I learned along the way made a significant difference in my life ‚Äî even more so than college ‚Äî setting the foundation for my entrepreneurial journey. The creation of Roybi Robot is personal to my own learning experiences, and that every child deserves to get quality education at a young age. At an early age, children learn primarily through conversations. Language development is the building block for a child‚Äôs education. If they can communicate, they can learn about anything or ask for help. These interactions help them develop vocabulary, social skills, and understand their emotions. The more often your child verbalizes their ideas, feelings, and experience, the more confidence they will gain. Parents these days are busier than ever and may not have the opportunity to spend as much time communicating with their children. It‚Äôs vital that children outside of school continue to practice these skills, which is why Roybi Robot‚Ä¶ -- -- Founder & CEO @roybirobot @roybiverse | TIME Best Invention | Metaverse, NFTs & Web 3.0 Enthusiast & Investor| Forbes Technology Council Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Designing for the other 50 %: Femme-Forward Technology Design
Subtitle: Written by Joselyn McDonald
Author: Joselyn McDonald
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Joselyn McDonald Follow -- Listen Share ‚ÄúYou are not your user‚Äù is a common expression in design thinking circles. Meaning that you shouldn‚Äôt focus on your own needs when designing for others, which is sage advice ‚Ä¶ that I‚Äôve chosen to completely ignore. I‚Äôm designing exclusively for myself now. I‚Äôm making femme-forward technologies that meet my needs, challenging expectations of how technology is developed by centering identity and putting the holistic human back into the design process. For context, I‚Äôm a product designer, inventor, and design-researcher and my medium is technology. I work with all of it ‚Äî hardware, software, fabrication tools, etc. ‚Äî which makes me more of breadth designer than a depth designer (which is my sweet spot). Before starting my own R&D lab ‚Äî Digital Culture Club ‚Äî I was in academia (both as student and teacher) for a long time ‚Äî hi Parsons and Carnegie Mellon and Dartmouth College! And while I was in academia, I studied the history of technology design. When studying the history of tech two things become readily apparent: I don‚Äôt know about you, but these two tenets of technology make me sad. I identify as a woman, as does over 50% of the world, yet my lived experience in the world is rarely taken into account when technologies are designed still to this day. A memorable example of designing without women in mind is this first iteration of the Oculus Rift which produced profound motion sickness in women users ‚Äî who process motion distinctly from men, yet their experience with the Rift was not properly vetted before release. The arguments about gender imbalance and being left out may be obvious, but my frustration over #2 ‚Äî that computing technologies prioritize workplace optimization issues ‚Äî may be more subtle. My point is this, while yes humans value work and being efficient, we‚Äôre also complex beings, who can be profoundly funny and silly, we feel emotions, our decisions can make no sense to others, we love one another, and grieve those we lose, and the technologies we use should allow us to be fully expressive ‚Äî not just tools for making us work harder/better/faster. Our technologies should allow us to be more human, instead of making us more like the logical systems that run technologies. As a designer/inventor, the obvious reaction for my frustrations with the current state of technology production is to make things that suggest the world I want to live in. I‚Äôve developed design frameworks that center humor, play, and femme-forward experiences in the tech prototypes that I‚Äôve been developing in my new R&D lab called Digital Culture Club (post about DCC soon!). We‚Äôve produced a lot of work that‚Äôs challenging the current state of modern computing and the tropes we‚Äôve come to accept as ‚Äúthat‚Äôs just how tech is‚Äù, such as endless notifications, invasions of privacy, addictive and dark patterns. One body of work I‚Äôm especially proud of is the line of Digits Nails Technologies we‚Äôve produced. Digits Nails Technologies are press-on nails that incorporate interactive technologies that are playful, often humorous, and forward the feminine experience in designing the affordances of the interactions. My next post will discuss the design process for the nails, including the problems they solve and how observation was a key design research method that led to their creation. In the meanwhile, I hope you enjoy the video of our RFID ‚ÄòTap and Go‚Äô bus pass nails allowing me to pay my bus fare with the tap of a nail. I‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts about what aspects of your life ‚Äî femme-forward or holistically human ‚Äî you‚Äôd like to see technology designers pay more attention to. If you‚Äôre not sure where to begin, observe a day in your life and ask ‚Äî what could be addressed to make my life better? -- -- Technologist & Researcher. Currently thinking about: Surveillance Resistance + FemmeTech. Sr.Analyst and Instructor at Duke University. @gucci_bagel Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: `let` me be a `const`(ant), not a `var`(iable)
Subtitle: Change of value in future
Author: Srishti Gupta
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Srishti Gupta Follow We‚Äôve moved to freeCodeCamp.org/news -- Listen Share var, let and const are the keywords which are used to declare variables in JavaScript. var comes under the ECMAScript 5th edition (aka ES5) whereas let and const fall under the category of ECMAScript 6th edition (aka ES6 and ES2015). Since JavaScript does not have any type-checking, either of these keywords can be used to declare a variable of any type (datatype) in JavaScript. Though all the three keywords are used for the same purpose, they are different. Variables declared using the let keyword can change their values in the future. Consider the example given below: Output: On the first line, the variable iChange is declared using the let keyword and is initialized with value 11. When you come down to the next line, the variable iChange is again assigned a new value, which is 12. Changing the values of variables declared using the let keyword is allowed. When, on the last line, you try to print the value of the variable iChange, you correctly get the updated value 12. Variables declared using the const keyword cannot change their values in future. This is why you must always initialize the variables declared with the const keyword. Output: Here, the variable PI is declared using the const keyword and is initialized with value 3.14 on the first line. When you come down to the next line, the variable PI is updated with a new value 22/7. Changing values of variables declared using the const keyword is not allowed. This is why the second line throws the error shown in the output because you are trying to assign a new value to a constant variable. Therefore, remember that variables declared using the const keyword are read-only & cannot be reassigned any value. As mentioned earlier, it is mandatory to initialize a constant when declaring it. Let‚Äôs see the following statement of code: Output: You know that you cannot update a constant in future. If you do not initialize a constant during its declaration, you will not be able to assign any value to it EVER! This is why you get a SyntaxError when you leave a constant uninitialized. What do you think will be the output of the code given below? Do you think an error will be thrown? Let‚Äôs check the output. Here we go. Output: The objects (including arrays & functions) declared using the const keyword are mutable. So far, you‚Äôve learned that variables declared using the const keyword cannot be assigned any other value. While this is true, there‚Äôs another side of the story too. Undoubtedly, you cannot assign a new value to a constant but you can manipulate the existing value if it is an object or an array. In the code given above, you are not changing the entire value assigned to the constant passengerBus but you are manipulating a property inside it. You can add/delete/update a property inside an object declared using the const keyword. Similar can be done with arrays too. You can add add/delete/update an element inside an array declared using a const keyword. Output: Now, considering that the keywords let and const belong to the same category, the following points enlist the differences between the variables declared using the let/const keywords and the variables declared using the var keyword: Variables declared using the let/const keywords are block-scoped. Consider the following example: Output: The variable i is declared using the let keyword inside the for-loop block. This means that when the for-loop block ends, the variable i loses its scope and is no longer accessible outside the curly braces of the for-loop block. Thus, when you try to access the variable i and print its value on statement 2, you get a ReferenceError: i is not defined, as shown in the output. Consider another example of declaring a variable using the const keyword: Output: The variable message is declared using the const keyword inside the if-block. This means that when the if-block ends, the variable message loses its scope and is no longer accessible outside the curly braces of the if-block. This is why, when you try to access variable message and print its value on statement 2, you get a ReferenceError: message is not defined, as shown in the output. Variables declared using the var keyword are function-scoped. Consider the example which we‚Äôve discussed earlier where instead of using let, you use the var keyword to declare the variable i: Output: The variable i is declared using the var keyword inside the for-loop-block. Because the variables declared using the var keyword are function-scoped, the variable i does not go out of scope when the for-loop-block ends and is accessible anywhere inside the scope of the function foo. Thus, on statement 2, when you try to access the variable i and print its value, you get the correct output as 3 (incremented value of variable i after the for-loop‚Äôs increment statement is executed) as shown in the output. Variables declared using the let/const keywords cannot be redeclared in the same scope. What do you think will be the output of the following code? Output: In the above code, you declared a variable with the name avengers using the let keyword and then you declared it again on the next line. Thus, the second line throws an SyntaxError as mentioned in the output. Variables declared using the var keyword can be redeclared in the same scope. Let‚Äôs now declare a variable already declared earlier in the same scope using the var keyword. Output: As evident from the output , you can redeclare variables having the same name in the same scope using the var keyword. The value contained in the variable will be the final value that you have assigned to it. Variables declared using the let/const keywords are NOT hoisted. This is an important point which is forgotten by many and you won‚Äôt find it in all articles. To understand what this point means, consider the example given below: Output: Notice that on the first line in the code given above, you are trying to access a variable x, which is declared and assigned a value on the next line. Essentially, you are trying to access a variable, which has not yet been allocated memory (declared). Since the variable x is declared using the let keyword and the variables declared using the let/const keywords are not hoisted, this throws a ReferenceError: x is not defined, as shown in the output. Variables declared using the var keyword are hoisted to the top of their scope. Output: All the declarations are moved to the top of the scope. Notice that on the first line, you are trying to access a variable x, which is declared and assigned a value on the next line. Now, since the variable x is declared using the var keyword and the variables declared using the var keyword are hoisted to the top of their scope in JavaScript, the code gets converted to the one given below: Here, the variable x is declared on line 1 and is not assigned any value. All the variables in JavaScript are initialized with the default value undefined, if no other value is assigned explicitly by the user. Thus, x is assigned the value undefined, which is what is printed on the second line (before x is updated to 10). ES6 (aka ES2015) is supported by almost all the browsers today. If you can follow this syntax, it is recommended to use the let and const keywords for declaring all the variables in your code. Now, which one to choose amongst let and const? The title says it all. -- -- We‚Äôve moved to https://freecodecamp.org/news and publish tons of tutorials each week. See you there. Title: Ethereum the Neutral: What We Talk About When We Talk About New Money
Subtitle: Written by William M. Peaster
Author: William M. Peaster
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in William M. Peaster Follow -- Listen Share What unified values should unite the Ethereum community, at least generally speaking? It‚Äôs a question that many stakeholders around the project have been grappling with. For example, Gnosis team member Eric Conner recently asked the Ethfinance forum to offer some ideas on the most exciting things about Ethereum. Why? Because Conner wanted to use the answers to inform the creation of a new page on the EthHub, a popular information portal in the space. The idea was to help the Ethereum community move toward a more coherent set of values to make the project more approachable, as Conner explained: ‚ÄúBitcoin stands for a set of fairly clear things (‚Äúsound money‚Äù, anti-hyperinflation, anti-statism, censorship resistance, digital gold‚Ä¶), but ethereum generally lacks those clear things.‚Äù I humbly agree with Conner ‚Äî making it easier to articulate what Ethereum is about and what it can do will only help the platform reach new users of all stripes. But what are the most important things to articulate? I can‚Äôt speak for anyone else or for all the values that Ethereum might have, but I do think neutrality is a value worth further honing in on going forward. That‚Äôs not to say it‚Äôs the only value or even the most important value of Ethereum, or that it hasn‚Äôt been stressed as a key aspect of Ethereum before; rather, while the community is grappling with values, I think it‚Äôs worthwhile to raise a banner here. Neutrality is simple, highly memeable (e.g. think Switzerland), and relates to other key themes, like Open Finance, decentralization, and beyond. I‚Äôm far from the first person to harp on neutrality. Indeed, Bitcoin and Ethereum are as popular as they currently are in no small part thanks to their structural neutrality. In its ‚ÄúPhilosophy‚Äù section, the Ethereum whitepaper itself reads: ‚ÄúNon-discrimination and non-censorship: the protocol should not attempt to actively restrict or prevent specific categories of usage. All regulatory mechanisms in the protocol should be designed to directly regulate the harm and not attempt to oppose specific undesirable applications. A programmer can even run an infinite loop script on top of Ethereum for as long as they are willing to keep paying the per-computational-step transaction fee.‚Äù In other words? Ethereum is a new kind of public infrastructure that is totally neutral. Accordingly, with this post I‚Äôm just highlighting the potential usefulness of ‚Äúneutrality‚Äù in a rhetorical sense. It condenses ‚Äî or provides an approachable gateway to ‚Äî some of the more jargon-y memes about the promises of blockchain. It‚Äôs a lot easier to immediately understand than ‚Äúcensorship-resistance,‚Äù ‚Äúsound money,‚Äù and even ‚Äúdecentralization.‚Äù Again, I‚Äôm not reinventing the wheel here. I thought I‚Äôd just put my two gwei in after thinking about Conner‚Äôs call to action. The thing is, people don‚Äôt have to be neutral to use Ethereum. It‚Äôs because Ethereum is neutral that it can be home to anyone. A reminder of that neutrality in action is the SpankChain project, which has become a redoubt for some deplatformed sex workers that have been kicked off of mainstream payments portals like PayPal and its ilk. Ethereum is not similarly moralistic to the point of restricting freedoms; pay your fees, and the world computer will handle the rest. Neutral, programmable money is an unprecedented development in civilization. Whenever a newcomer asks about Ethereum, neutrality is a concept that can quickly bring them up to speed on why the platform is unique and valuable. Ethereum is for individuals and for enterprises. It‚Äôs for activists and bureaucrats, developers and artists, states and non-state actors. It‚Äôs a new kind of public infrastructure that‚Äôs for anyone, anywhere. And in a world where globalization is rapidly accelerating, that may just be a winning argument. In fact, it‚Äôs an argument that‚Äôs already proven relatively popular. *** William M. Peaster is a writer and editor tracking the Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dai beats. -- -- Professional writer and editor. On the Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dai beats. Title: Personalized food technology innovations
Subtitle: Written by PreScouter
Author: PreScouter
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Member-only story PreScouter Follow -- Share In line with the increasing industrial shift from mass production to mass personalization, technologies such as home testing kits and wearable fitness trackers are providing new levels of understanding one‚Äôs health. The detailed insights into one‚Äôs eating habits and nutrition requirements provided by such devices are helping to drive the growth of the personalized nutrition space. This, combined with sustainable food packaging, illustrates how packaged food companies are moving toward holistic products that are healthier for both individuals and the planet. In parallel, enabled by advances in IoT devices and novel manufacturing methods, interesting devices and ideas for personalized food storage and preparation are emerging in the CPG industry. Below, we highlight a few interesting examples. Reheating food in a place outside the kitchen can be a challenge. However, Inductive Intelligence, a company founded in 2017, has developed a system that uses highly controlled inductive power that enables the user to heat food and drinks through the application of IoT. By placing the food or drink on a coaster-sized appliance, it can be heated in a matter of minutes. -- -- Custom Intelligence from a Global Network of Experts Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Making sense of technology-related change processes in education settings- it‚Äôs not easy!
Subtitle: Predict
Author: Carmel: CMT Accessible Research
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Home Newsletter About  where the future is written  Member-only story Carmel: CMT Accessible Research Follow Predict -- 1 Share It is hard to keep up with change and yet so easy to get caught up in change for change sake. Everywhere you look, it is evident that engagement with change is demanded of us on a daily basis- we frequently are challenged to change the way we do banking, change the way we go about our work, change the way we teach and learn, the way we communicate, the way we exercise and generally just change the way we go about our everyday lives! And in our quest to remain relevant and current, we sometimes embark on change without giving meaningful thought to the reason for, and merits of, the change. Sometimes our fear of missing out, and of being left behind drives blind trust in change. As long as you are keeping up, then don‚Äôt look back‚Ä¶ right? If you stop and think about it though, it is not surprising that change often is associated with increased levels of stress and anxiety, particularly if the person who is engaging with, or impacted by, the change does not feel supported and if there are limited structures in place to facilitate the change process. Education is one setting where reforms are regularly introduced and where change plays out in many different ways, often with far-reaching‚Ä¶ -- -- 1 where the future is written PhD. Passionate about ethical use of technology to achieve meaningful change, progress & positive life outcomes. Books & writing are my escape. Title: 5 Alasan Bisnis Travel Menjadi Bisnis yang Menggiurkan
Subtitle: Gomodo Technologies
Author: Irma Indah Sinarwulan
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Home About  Gomodo is an all-in-one online booking and payments system for micro, small and medium-sized‚Ä¶  Irma Indah Sinarwulan Follow Gomodo Technologies -- Share Ditulis oleh Irma Indah Sinarwulan Banyak faktor yang menyebabkan seseorang membutuhkan waktu liburan, salah satunya adalah untuk menghilangkan stres. Banyaknya fasilitas yang disediakan oleh pemerintah seperti jalan tol semakin memudahkan seseorang untuk berlibur ke luar kota. Melihat kemudahan itu, pelaku bisnis travel mengambil peluang tersebut untuk mengembangkan bisnis travel. Bicara tentang bisnis travel, simak 5 alasan kenapa bisnis travel menjadi bisnis yang menggiurkan saat ini. 1. Segmentasi Pasar yang Sangat Luas Berapapun usia seseorang, traveling sudah menjadi kebutuhan yang tak terelakkan. Tidak hanya kaum yang super-duper sibuk saja yang membutuhkan traveling, bahkan seorang ibu rumah tangga saja butuh traveling untuk menghilangkan lelah melakukan pekerjaan rumah, begitupun anak remaja atau kaum milenial yang hobi berwisata yang bertujuan untuk mempercantik Instagram Feed mereka. Banyaknya iklan wisata yang tertera di sosial media maupun di televisi membuat seseorang cepat-cepat ingin memutuskan jadwal liburan mereka. Peluang ini bisa kamu manfaatkan untuk meraih pundi-pundi rupiah yang sangat menggiurkan. 2. Dapat Dirintis Dari Mana Saja Dengan kemudahan teknologi informasi saat ini, travel agent dapat dengan mudah memulai bisnis travel mereka melalui sosial media seperti Instagram, facebook, dan twitter yang digunakan oleh orang banyak. Membuat website bisnis pun sangat mudah, sudah banyak startup yang menyediakan website gratis dengan tools yang bermanfaat untuk penyedia jasa dan wisata. Sangat mudah kan? 3. Dapat Bekerjasama Dengan Banyak Orang Bisnis travel tidak mesti harus indepent dan bergerak sendiri. Untuk memudahkan, Anda dapat bekerjasama dengan berbagai vendor seperti hotel, restoran, bis, pemandu wisata, dan lain-lain. Semakin banyak relasi Anda, semakin sedikit pula yang perlu difikirkan. 4. Dibayar di Muka Dengan sistem bayar dimuka, Anda akan lebih mudah mengalokasikan dana Anda untuk memutar uang untuk keperluan bisnis Anda dan tak perlu khawatir pelanggan Anda akan lari begitu saja saat liburan telah usai. 5. Mengubah Hobi Menjadi Keuntungan Saat awal merintis bisnis travel, mau tak mau Anda harus ikut andil dalam melayani pelanggan Anda ke tempat wisata yang Anda tawarkan. Meskipun sedang bekerja, dengan ikut mengantarkan pelanggan Anda ke tempat wisata Anda juga bisa merasakan liburan. Title: 5 Product Innovations from Asia
Subtitle: Published in Intertrend
Author: Yu Rankin
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Yu Rankin Follow Intertrend -- Listen Share Today, technology in Asia is innovating at an exponential rate and this not only applies to digital, but physical products as well. In this article, we highlight five product innovations from Asia in 2019. Toyota: Solar Panel Electric Vehicles In July 2019, Toyota announced test trials of a new version of their plug-in hybrid Prius equipped with Sharp solar panels on the roof, hood, and rear hatch door. These solar panels have an astounding efficiency of 34 percent-plus and generates an output of around 860W, almost five times more than the standard Prius model. Sony: Personal A/C In July 2019, the hottest month ever recorded in history, Sony unveiled the Reon Pocket. It‚Äôs a personal, wallet sized thermoelectric powered A/C that is inserted into the back of a shirt. The device is controlled by an app, and can lower the user‚Äôs body temperature by 23F or raise it by 14F. It is expected to be released in Japan in March 2020 at a cost of about $117 USD. Smoking Cabin SG: Outdoor Smoking Cabin In May 2019, in Singapore, Smoking Cabin SG launched an outdoor smoking cabin that converts 99.5% of cigarette smoke into clean air. The air filtration system is activated by motion sensors when a smoker enters the cabin, and can house up to 10 smokers at a time. The company plans to have 60 cabins nationwide by the end of 2019. Vincross: Robot Plant In May 2019, a six-legged robot plant, Hexa, was nominated for a DRIVENxDESIGN‚Äôs NOW Award. Hexa can carry a small succulent plant on its back and automatically moves around to find sunlight and shade as needed for the plant. It can also sense when the plant needs water and will dance to alert the owner. It can be purchased for about $949 USD. Mitsubishi: Premium Toaster In April 2019, Mitsubishi Electric launched the Bread Oven. This premium toaster heats one slice of bread at a time to perfection by trapping in moisture. This makes the toast taste like freshly baked bread. The toaster can also be used to make French toast, cheese toast, or an egg on top. It can be purchased for about $270 USD. Sources: Trendwatching, Popular Mechanics -- -- Creating conversations and building thought leadership about the Asian American voice, experience and influence in the global context.
