Title: New Cloud Technology Challenging Blockchain and all Cryptocurrencies
Subtitle: Written by VL IV
Author: VL IV
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in VL IV Follow -- Listen Share A new technology called RAIDA (Redundant Array of Independent Detection Agents), used to detect the authenticity of a new cloud-based digital currency ‚Äî CloudCoin, aims to challenge the technology (Blockchain) standing behind Bitcoin. The name of the challenger is CloudCoin‚Ñ¢ CloudCoin‚Ñ¢ is a cloud-based digital currency that makes some substantial claims. It claims that it cannot be counterfeited, controlled, or tracked. That it cannot be double-spent, mined or lost. That it is 100% private and requires no public ledgers, accounts, or encryption. And that it is a completely fair and ethical monetary system. CloudCoin and its underlying technology named RAIDA has ambitious plans.At this point, even if the claims are true, it sounds like David and Goliath ‚Ä¶ but we all know how that story ended, could this be the same?And even if it‚Äôs a new mouse trap with improvements ‚Ä¶ does it matter? CloudCoin and RAIDA aim to challenge Bitcoin and Blockchain technology. Let‚Äôs look at how it claims to challenge Bitcoin and Blockchain technology in multiple areas. Actually, let‚Äôs take a close lookBased upon my understanding, these are not just surface changes. The term paradigm-changing probably has been used more often than it should, but if simultaneous changes in speed, security, anonymity, cost, ecological footprint, and impenetrability can be (or may already have been,) accomplished by CloudCoin, then the world has actually changed and it‚Äôs only a matter of time for people to recognize it and catch up.So, lots of big aims and big claims. Let‚Äôs peek beneath the hood. RAIDA History The RAIDA project was created by Sean H. Worthington, a professor who was working on a PhD (Computer Information Systems) dissertation on an artificial intelligent object recognition system that could recognize and identify money for vending machines. The system used Worthington‚Äôs ‚ÄúMagic Neuron‚Äù design that required many computes to act like neurons. The data store could be taught and could memorize the notes. He understood that he could create a brain in the cloud that could identify millions of individual notes and even be taught to recognize changes. In August 2016, Worthington minted 16,777,216 CloudCoin notes and registered them with the RAIDA ‚Äî then in experimental development.After filing a provisional patent, he set out to create the RAIDA. The provisional patent was granted (#62354022). Because he realized the potential scope of what he was trying to accomplish, and that monetary systems are information systems, Worthington first needed to recruit world-class Systems Administrators throughout the world. This has been completed. System Administrators and Programmers joined the ‚ÄúCloudCoin Consortium‚Äù from numerous countries including Taiwan, Philippines, Japan, India, Serbia, Russia, Germany, UK, Macedonia, Venezuela, Columbia, USA, Italy and others. Once the extensive network was in place the proof of concept tests were conducted in January 2017. These tests showed conclusively that the CloudCoin invention worked in practice as it did in theory. RAIDAtech This is the development company for the RAIDA technology, who is pioneering new uses of the patented RAIDA technology, the first and foremost being CloudCoin. RAIDA is an acronym for the * Redundant* Array of* Independent* Detection* Agents What makes it up? How does it work? What makes it safer? What are the benefits?First, let‚Äôs address ‚Äúwhat is RAIDA?‚Äù https://cloudcoin.global/raida.htmlhttp://www.cloudcoinwiki.com/RAIDA In short, RAIDA is a decentralized cloud-based technology consisting of 25 of 25 independent clouds of servers. The clouds store and process CloudCoin files.These Clouds are hidden in different countries around the planet: Australia, Macedonia, Philippines, Serbia, Switzerland, South Korea, Japan, UK, India, Germany, USA, Taiwan, Russia, France, Singapore, Argentina and Canada. Each of these clouds consist of a Sentinel and 32 Detection Agents. The RAIDA is a new authentication protocol that is the first of its kind and the first true Cloud-based authentication system. Most authentication protocols require one password to be given to one server that is checked against one database. The RAIDA uses many passwords against many different servers each with a no-share database. This allows to have decentralized authentication, fault tolerance, high availability and tamper proof data. CONSTANT MONITORING https://raida.cloudcoinconsortium.com/The status of the RAIDA network is always monitored and can be observed by anyone. The RAIDA continually updates about every 30 seconds. A key difference between Bitcoin and CloudCoin‚Ñ¢ is that all the coding is contained within the CloudCoin‚Ñ¢ itself. NO PUBLIC KEY A public key provides a route for the unlikely, but not impossible, hacking of Bitcoin. This is especially true for a number of super computers working in tandem, let alone a quantum computer. Being public, it also provides information on the values of what is being transmitted, and to a thief this could look like an armoured car transporting a large amount of money and therefore being a difficult, but tempting target. Thinking of the hacker being part of a well-funded crime syndicate, huge competitor or unfriendly government, the target must be tempting enough for the thieves to even consider investing a considerable amount of their time, energy and resources. Here‚Äôs a quote that was attributed to an infamous American bank robber named Willie Sutton when asked a question of why he robbed banks. His reply was: ‚ÄúBecause that‚Äôs where the money is.‚Äù CloudCoin TRANSMISSIONS ARE INDIVIDUAL They are not batched. With CloudCoin you do not have an ‚Äúarmoured truck‚Äù carrying a big load of money. Additionally, there isn‚Äôt any kind of value indicator to let anyone know whether there are only a few CloudCoins being sent to a friend, or millions that are being transmitted in business. But what if there is some hacker who has access to huge computing power, but isn‚Äôt very practical, or has a lot of time to waste? Not likely. But perhaps a team of hackers who are part of a crime syndicate, an unscrupulous banking organization, or some corrupt government? HERE‚ÄôS FEW THINGS THE HACKERS WOULD NEED TO CONFRONT! - Each line of the authenticity code consists of a 16-byte password that is 100% random. - Most authentication protocols require one password to be given to one server that is checked against one database. The RAIDA uses many passwords against many different servers, each with a no-share database. - Presuming that a hacker were able to find one of the hidden detection agents and capture it, and then break its code, the hacker would only have 1/32 of 1/25th of the authentication data. So, even if a hacker could decrypt it, doing that would not provide ownership of any coins. - In order to crack a CloudCoin, a hacker would nearly simultaneously need to guess the Authenticity Numbers of a majority of the RAIDA located around the world. - The RAIDA also has a bottleneck of how many codes can be guessed at each second. This is like when you forget or mistype a passcode three times and you get locked out. The public ledger does not have a bottleneck. With a public ledger, a hacker could make as many guesses as they have servers. If a hacker has a football field full of supercomputers (like the NSA), then they could guess trillions of combinations per second. With quantum computers, a hacker could guess all combinations within two minutes and crack the Blockchain. - With RAIDA, a hacker is limited to only guess 8 million guesses per second, per RAIDA. If one were to take the time to run the math, it would clearly show that it would take more guesses than there is the time in the Universe to crack a CloudCoin. Therefore, the RAIDA is also quantum safe. HOW IS THE SYSTEM ITSELF SAFE FROM ATTACK OR HARM? - The clouds are scattered all around the world in secret locations. - RAIDA servers do not require large computer facilities which are easy to spot. - CloudCoin has a very small electrical footprint. This not only ensures its financial and ecological viability, but also eliminates the possibility of locating one of the RAIDA servers through the monitoring of electrical consumption. - RAIDA has data redundancy for instantaneous backup and is self-healing. If one of the detection agents gets knocked out, it is automatically replaced by a new one. WHAT ARE CloudCoin‚Äôs MAJOR BENEFITS? 1. Users can remain completely anonymous. Not pseudo anonymous as with Bitcoin. In this regard CloudCoins are like paper money. Naturally, you would keep your own records, and have accounts with businesses, and handle your responsibilities, but anonymity is your decision and there is no ledger tracking your business or who you transact with. 2. Cannot be manipulated. Governments and banks publicize horrible things to manipulate people into agreeing to give up their freedom. They use emotionally charged things like drugs, child pornography, sex trafficking, terrorism and others as a justification, or a reason, for you to give up your anonymity, your freedom and the control of your finances. These ‚Äúwe have to protect you‚Äù justifications all seem reasonable to well-intentioned people, but when you look behind the curtain you can see that they are being used by unscrupulous powers to justify their efforts to take control of your finances. Restricting your freedom and taking away your rights is not the correct solution to handle these problems. 3. Your money or wealth is not limited to, or controlled by one economic system. It‚Äôs not restricted by borders. With CloudCoin you could think of your money as invisible and international. 4. Because the file sizes are very small, they require very little storage and transmit quickly. On the server level, there is no need for large, expensive and energy consuming storage. 5. On a personal level, CloudCoin wallets are under 5 MB and download in a few minutes compared with a huge Bitcoin wallet that may take days to download. 6. CloudCoin transaction speeds are blazingly fast, with authentications measured in milliseconds. 8 000 000 TPS 7. Utility value: In a practical sense, a currency is only as valuable as it makes trade safer and easier. With CloudCoin it only takes a few seconds for a retail merchant, who has people waiting in line at a checkout counter, to check authenticity, and be paid. 8. Transaction costs are pennies, making small purchases like a cup of coffee viable. 9. CloudCoin wallets are free and can be downloaded by anyone. 10. You can send a CloudCoin to anyone on earth who has a computer, smartphone or tablet, and an internet connection in seconds. This makes Peer-to-Peer transactions super-fast, free and confidential. 11. Since CloudCoins use simple integers, like paper money, the values are easy to understand. 12. CloudCoins are limited. Only a fixed amount have been minted and no more will ever be added. This eliminates the possibility of inflation. Your money will not lose value because some government or entity creates more in order to manipulate the economy. 13. CloudCoins cannot be taken from your account by anyone. 14. The money in you CloudCoin account is not visible. 15. Your account cannot be frozen. 16. CloudCoins cannot be copied or double spent. This is because with each transaction the authentication code is changed and the ownership is transferred to the receiver. 17. CloudCoins cannot be permanently lost. Procedures are in place that can immediately find lost coins, but if for some reason the coins are lost without having copies of the serial numbers, there still exists a way that lost coins can be recovered after two years. It is the first digital currency that can be found if lost. 18. The CloudCoin RAIDA system is completely scalable. Because of its small file sizes, very small electrical requirements, and the small size of the computers necessary, the system can be expanded indefinitely while remaining financially and ecologically viable. It has the capability of serving a global economy. THE PURPOSE OF CloudCoin. The purpose of having a currency like CloudCoin is simply to enhance free trade.We believe that trade is simultaneously; (a) the glue that binds peoples and nations together, and (b) the lubricant that smooths out the frictions born out of the differences between them. Where free trade prospers, wars cease. Free trade acknowledges and rewards true value. It‚Äôs independent and outside of beliefs or political ideologies. We therefore hold that the basic purpose of a true currency is simply, and only, its ability to quickly, safely and easily facilitate free trade anywhere in the world. WHY RAIDA AND CLOUDCOIN? THE PROBLEM The person or persons known as ‚ÄúSatoshi Nakamoto‚Äù introduced a revolutionary advancement affecting technology, finance, sociology and other fields with the advent of distributed ledger technology in 2008. Nakamoto was the first to solve what computer scientists call ‚Äòthe physical integrity problem‚Äô, allowing for the creation of the first widely-accepted digital currencies that could not be copied or double-spent. That was over a decade ago. For over a decade, distributed ledger technology (DLT, also known as blockchain) has promised to provide solutions for every problem from currency inflation to world hunger to global warming. The hype has not been the reality. Blockchain technology has been hampered by the inability to efficiently scale, unreasonable transactional times, and overly complex and dangerous consensus paradigms. Blockchain applications are immensely harmful to the environment, consuming more electricity each day than used by most nations. There has been progress in the application of distributed ledger technology, but improvements have not come close to solving its fundamental weaknesses. DLT has failed to deliver on its promise to become a transformative innovation. Continuous advances in quantum computing, meanwhile, threaten to completely nullify the centerpiece of DLT: asymmetric elliptic curve cryptography. The Quantum Era is near, if not already upon us, as many experts believe. Quantum computers rely on quantum mechanical phenomena like entanglement and superposition to operate on quantum bits of data (qubits). Traditional bits are binary: they are either ones or they are zeros. Qubits, essentially, can be ones, zeros or both at the same time. A quantum computer is able to process data twenty million or more times faster than a traditional one. The simple reality is that by the time DLT/blockchain technology reaches anything near critical mass, it will already be obsolete! The next generation of technology to provide immersive customer engagement, shield data transmission, stop counterfeiting, ensure privacy, safeguard financial security and protect intellectual property will be effective only if it is quantum-safe and provides solutions to blockchain‚Äôs problems with scalability, speed, privacy efficiency, governance and ecological harm. NOW CloudCoin‚Ñ¢ is in the process of finalizing its new ‚ÄúClient Wallet‚Äù and will be inviting a limited number of public to take part in the second stage of Beta Testing. No technical knowledge is required. As mentioned above, the wallet is only about 5 MG in size and downloads quickly. People participating in the Beta Test will be provided with CloudCoins to use during the testing, and upon completion will be rewarded for participating.If you are interested in participating, and possibly be part of building a new world, contact the person who sent you this and ask to be added to the list of beta-testers. ‚ÄúCloudCoin Wallet.‚Äù This program will change many things and make CloudCoin much more usable. CloudCoin Wallet can automatically make change and it can send CloudCoins from one person to another with a click of a button. Its transfer time maybe the fastest of any payment system in the world. We are able to send coins to the change maker, and get them back within four seconds. This means that a user can send the two transactions of sending money, making sure it is authentic, sending change and making sure that is authentic (two transactions) happen in less time than it takes to approve a Visa payment. People get to have their own username. In a few days we will have Merchant software that allows anyone to accept CloudCoins as payment. The exchange is well underway. We will focus all effort on Liquidity and it will be a fast effort. CloudCoin Wallet, has been released to the public and can be found at: https://cloudcoinconsortium.com/use.html The Consortium expect to have the final version done within few weeks. The new Wallet can fix 400 fracked coins at a time instead of one at a time, track your deposits and transfers. The Wallet allow you to encrypt your coins, allow you to embed email hash for recovering lost coins by email. It can fix coins in the case that they RAIDA does not answer, It can also all you to keep your coins in the Cloud and transfer them to another person instantly without using email or other forms of file transfer. The new version also comes in a high contrast version.The final version will have the ability to process 1000 coins at one time instead of 400, will be able to transfer from one Skywallet account to another, will have multi fix and hopefully can recover lost coins by email. It will also fix any bugs that we find in the Beta version. Lastly, I hope to include a way for a user to get one free CloudCoin if they sign up for out news letter. This will help them create a Skywallet to receive CloudCoins. CloudCoin Consortium states that they are officially in the Liquidity phase. This is when they works to make it so their coin to be changed into goods, services and other currencies very quickly. Projects include own P2P Exchange, The Escrowed Exchange, The Craigs-List type Store, the Merchant software, APIs and Video games. The Peer To Peer Exchange. The backend and front-end business layer are 95% done. The GUI for the P2P exchange is 50% done. Then payments systems will be added. An P2P exchange ready for testing in just a few weeks. The Merchant Software: Creates a ‚ÄúPay With CloudCoin‚Äù button. It is completed and now in testing‚Ä¶. Also you can find more information here. https://www.publish0x.com/cloudcoin -- -- Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Image Fusion the science of image Enhancement
Subtitle: Written by dawood shahid
Author: dawood shahid
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in dawood shahid Follow -- Listen Share ‚Äò‚ÄôAI is taking over the Humans in the race of technology ‚Äù There is no doubt that the world is made a heaven by the development of the technology and the advancements that are made in it. Computer vision is a branch of computer science which deals with the processing of the images. We see Computer vision all around us in every walk of the life and no one in modern age can expect a life full of joys and ease without the presence of computer vision and its applications. Imagine the world without computer vision now, imagine you don‚Äôt have access to any cameras and you can‚Äôt watch your favorite movies and drams any more. Imagine the world without playing games and taking selfies on your cameras? Well this is the power of Computer vision. Now let's talk about the main topic which is the image Fusion, basically we talked all about computer vision just to make the mind of our audience to know the importance of Image Fusion in the field of image processing. Image Fusion is a sub branch of Computer vision in which we fuse multiple images and make a single image which possess more rich and enhanced details of the image which we have fused. This is the best thing which we can do to increase the productivity of the images that we have captured from multiple sensors at different levels of exposure and luminance. The concept of Image fusion is very clear, we will have to enhance the particular amount of images and fuse them into a single image. Now lets talk about the different types of image Fusion which we can achieve. This type of image fusion is achieved by Fusing Multiple images of the same scene but present at different focuses, the multi focus image fusion is a type of image fusion which is most widely used in the image processing industry, in this type of image fusion we take multiple images which are taken at different focuses. The multi Focused images are then Fused by using different kind of algorithms which may involve weight maps and spatial frequency techniques. The practical implementations of multi focus image fusion techniques are in mobile phone cameras and also in Aero Research where researchers take multiple images of multi focus objects and fuse them using multi focus image fusion techniques. The next major image fusion technique which we apply is the Multi Sensor image fusion, the multi focus image fusion involves fusing multiple images taken from the different sensors(Cameras) and fusing them in a way that they compose a single resultant image. The sensors may be different like we may use a camera of Sony and the second one of Canon to capture an image of the same scene, the image fusion will collect all the images taken by the multiple sensors and fuse them into one image by using the image fusion Algorithm. -- -- Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Abusing FaceID augmentation feature to circumvent Apple FaceID security
Subtitle: Written by Shubham Raj
Author: Shubham Raj
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Shubham Raj Follow -- Listen Share Security concern doesn‚Äôt need to always arise from a technical ground, well, very often ‚Äî you can abuse logic and business functionalities for the gain. Earlier this year, I noticed an interesting security concern with Apple Face ID which allows a non-enrolled user to unlock the iPhone X (including other products which support Face ID) using their face, even though their face is not set up for Face ID on that phone. This abuses a functional feature of Face ID known as Face ID augmentation which as described by Apple is to improve unlock performance and keep pace with the natural changes of your face and look. Tested Product, OS, & Settings:The test was conducted on iPhone X (IOS 12.1.4 ‚Äî most updated version at the time of testing) having a single Face ID setup without any alternate appearance settings and ‚ÄúTrue‚Äù for ‚ÄòRequire Attention for Face ID‚Äô which claims to provide additional security. Consider two users named owner and non-owner.  ‚Äî Owner‚Äôs face is enrolled/setup for FaceID on the phone and should be able to unlock the device using his face. ‚Äî Non-owner‚Äôs face is not enrolled/setup for FaceID on the same phone and should not be able to unlock the device using his face. Steps:1. Non-owner tries to unlock the device using his face and fails, which is then followed by the owner entering the correct passcode or non-owner entering the correct passcode (i.e., non-owner knows the correct passcode of the owner) to unlock the phone. 2. This continues for several times (~25‚Äì30*) periodically in both day-light and the low-light environment ‚Äî between which the owner can continue using the phone or unlocking the device using his face. 3. The iPhone after a while will start accepting both non-owner and owner face now as valid. And both of them would be able to unlock the device using their face. Note: The phone still only have owner‚Äôs face enrolled. Therefore, after ensuring the behavior was not previously reported (e.g., on blogs, news, forums, etc) and extended testing for some times, this was reported to Apple at the end of February 2019 with a POC video. *Number of times required would differ from person to person (based on facial features, etc). As read in Face ID security guide ‚ÄúTo improve unlock performance and keep pace with the natural changes of your face and look, Face ID augments its stored mathematical representation over time.‚Äù [1] For this post, we are particularly interested in this section of How Face ID unlocks an iOS device: If Face ID fails to recognize you, but the match quality is higher than a certain threshold and you immediately follow the failure by entering your passcode, Face ID takes another capture and augments its enrolled Face ID data with the newly calculated mathematical representation. Though, the guide mentions that the system is only augmented if the match quality is higher than a certain threshold, but, during our testing ‚Äî I perceive the lack of proper enforcement or possibility to bypass with repetition given the facial features/shape of the owner and non-owner‚Äôs face are significantly different (Fig 2, at the time of testing). The major problem here is the ineffectiveness of the system to distinguish between two completely different faces. More precisely, if the system keeps repetitively trained for a new face (i.e., following the failure to unlock a device using non-owner face by entering correct passcode) for several times, the system is unable to distinguish between non-owner and owner‚Äôs faces and hence poses a significant security risk. It should also be noted that even if the passcode gets later changed by the owner to stop the non-owner from accessing the device, the Face ID remains trained for the non-owner face, such that non-owner would still be able to unlock the device using his face and subsequently other apps which use Face ID protection (e.g., WhatsApp). The overall attack requires some sort of social engineering to execute and to later retain control of the device using Face ID. Feb 29, 2019: Report submittedMar 05, 2019: Apple asked for additional infoMar 05, 2019: Additional information sharedMar 06, 2019: We agreed on Face ID augmentation functionality to be relevant for the security concern, Apple submitted details to the relevant team for further investigation. ‚Ä¶Follow up emails were sent seeking an update.‚Ä¶Jul 18, 2019: Apple says the behavior is expected.Jul 19, 2019: Explained possible scenarios for how this can be used by an attacker. Seek permission for the post. Jul 26, 2019: Apple maintains they don‚Äôt see any security risk. Permission was given for post.Aug 14, 2019: Details published. [1] Face ID Security: https://www.apple.com/kr/business-docs/FaceID_Security_Guide.pdf -- -- Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: No Title
Subtitle: Here is the introduction to the architecture of GGBTC Exchange:
Author: Global Gravitation
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Global Gravitation Follow -- Listen Share GGBTC is a global integrated trading platform that provides diversified system functions such as currency trading, futures contracts, margin trading and over-the-counter trading to meet the trading needs of various investors. GGBTC trading system has a complete security mechanism and a strong underlying architecture to provide investors with the ultimate trading experience. GGBTC‚Äôs goal is to create a digital technology ecological community around blockchain technology, adopting weak centralized distributed management. Currently, there are 10 global concessionaires and 200 global community shareholders. The decision is decided by all shareholders.GGBTC treats shareholders as participants and co-owners of the GGBTC eco-community, and 80% of the platform‚Äôs revenue will be returned in the form of shareholder dividends.The platform provides weekly, monthly, quarterly, semi-annual, and annual profit reports to shareholders. For real-time full order book data, it can be provided to invited shareholders to increase the transparency of the invited shareholders in the market information, which will become a tool for investment institutions to fully grasp market information.For historical data, it is paid to quantitative trading institutions for retesting. It has become an important way to test trading algorithms. Therefore, quantitative trading can be used with more confidence. -- -- GGBTC is a globally integrated trading platform. Title: How the Internet and Now Blockchain Enable New Models of Participation
Subtitle: Unpacking the concept of decentralization and how to get the most from it.
Author: Minima
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Minima Follow Minima -- Listen Share Greater Control Over One‚Äôs Destiny Despite our modern definitions of centralization and decentralization dating back to the French Revolution, the structure of everything is either centered around some form of central control mechanism or not. In politics, the concepts are relatively easy to spot, especially during times of revolution. In society, it wasn‚Äôt until the Internet became accessible by many, that democratized information-enabled people became aware of the opportunities outside of a centralized, command and control hierarchy. The 1999 United Nations Development Programme working paper entitled ‚ÄòDecentralization: A Sampling of Definitions‚Äô, analyzed the significance of this. The paper concludes that ‚Äúthe movement toward local accountability and greater control over one‚Äôs destiny‚Äù is ‚Äúprincipally being driven by a strong desire for greater participation of citizens‚Äù. A Level Playing Field for All In and around the early 2000s, sharing economy models emerged, based on systems of trust, open-source data, and crowdfunding. These models enabled each component to freely operate within structures and provide a more level playing field where static hierarchies were less effective. The Internet has facilitated these and other innovations due to its ability to enable decentralization. Blockchain technology is such an innovation, but there is often confusion over what its true utility is and some misunderstanding as to its decentralized nature. Blockchains Ability to Create Resilience Through Decentralisation The most current accepted thinking is that Blockchains, despite being logically centralized in terms of a common framework that links everything together, are politically decentralized (because nobody is in complete control) and architecturally decentralized (because there isn‚Äôt a central failure point). This provides several benefits such as fault tolerance (due to the reliance on many components), attack resistance (due to the lack of central points of failure), and collusion resistance (due to the low or no ability for actors to collude towards selfish goals). The Application of Decentralisation Determines its Efficiency Critics of decentralization argue that the potential downsides of decentralisation include the risk of duplication of work, lack of singular focus, and low speed of action. However, those downsides depend on the context of decentralization. If the context is, for example, making a consensus decision, then indeed, it is more efficient for only one person or small team to form an opinion and for others to follow. Conversely, if the context is a transactional network where each individual actor can make their own decisions, the downside risk of inefficiency is removed. In other words, the way decentralization is applied, determines the value that can be created. Realizing the True Potential of Decentralisation The objective determines the outcome, therefore the biggest downside of decentralization is when the original objective intentionally (or unintentionally) allows the network to be rigged or gamed. The fastest way to damage a decentralized network is to add an element of centralization (such as greed or collusion) to how it operates. The best opportunities, however, come from a pure and holistically beneficial objective in the architectural design of a decentralized network. Only then will the true power of decentralization be realized. Author: Jonathan MacDonald Reference: Decentralization: A Sampling Of Definitions -- -- Minima is a cooperative network that enables everyone to freely connect. The completely decentralized network for value and information transfer, enabling people to exchange anything with anyone. Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: A Comparison of Gold ETFs and Gold-Backed Cryptocurrencies
Subtitle: What is a Gold ETF?
Author: Igor
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Member-only story Igor Follow The Startup -- Share A gold exchange-traded fund (ETF) is a commodity ETF that consists of only one principal asset: gold. ETFs are similar to individual stocks and trade on exchanges in the same manner.[1] The main aspect that complicates gold ETFs more than traditional stocks is the derivative underlying the investment. A derivative is a ‚Äúcontract between two or more parties whose value is based on an agreed-upon underlying financial asset.‚Äù An example of an underlying asset would be a security or commodity.[2] Gold ETFs hold gold derivative contracts that are backed by gold. So when someone invests in a gold ETF, they don‚Äôt actually own any of the gold, instead they are purchasing a share that represents the physical gold. In addition, most ETFs, upon redemption, do not pay out by providing the precious metal; they instead provide an investor with a cash equivalent. The goal of an ETF is to give an investor exposure to the price movements and/or performance of gold. Examples of Gold ETFs and How Redemption Works GLD ‚Äî SPDR Gold Trust ETF This is the world‚Äôs largest gold ETF. Each GLD share represents 0.095599 ounces of gold and trades at roughly $144 a share. Redemption of the physical gold is usually not available to the average investor. Title: Fintek 2020
Subtitle: Written by Altuƒü Demirden
Author: Altuƒü Demirden
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Altuƒü Demirden Follow -- Share Fintek (fintech), finansal ve teknolojik ge√ßi≈ü alanƒ±ndaki yeniliklere atƒ±fta bulunmak i√ßin kullanƒ±lan bir terimdir. Genellikle i≈ületmelere veya t√ºketicilere finansal hizmetler saƒülamak i√ßin teknolojiyi kullanan ≈üirketleri veya hizmetleri ifade eder. Teknoloji uzmanlarƒ± olarak, sekt√∂r baƒüƒ±msƒ±z pek √ßok kurulu≈üta √ºstteki karikat√ºrde dramatize edilen diren√ß ile mutlaka kar≈üƒ±la≈üƒ±yoruz. Mevcut hedefleri ile boƒüu≈üan i≈ü birimleri ve y√∂neticileri, √ßoƒüunlukla yeni teknolojileri denemeye, hatta dinlemeye bile yana≈ümayabiliyorlar. Bu denklemi √ß√∂zmeye √ßabalarken, √ºzerine bir de b√ºt√ße kƒ±sƒ±tlamalarƒ± eklendiƒüi anda durum i√ßinden √ßƒ±kƒ±lamaz bir h√¢l alabiliyor. Bu durumu a≈üabilmek adƒ±na teknolojiyi doƒürudan i≈ü birimlerine sunmak yerine, genellikle mevcut i≈ü biriminin fonksiyonlarƒ±nƒ±, g√ºnl√ºk uƒüra≈ülarƒ±nƒ±, sorunlarƒ±nƒ± dinleyerek asƒ±l kilit noktayƒ± yakalamalƒ±, sonrasƒ±nda da sunacaƒüƒ±mƒ±z teknolojinin aslƒ±nda bu problemleri √ß√∂zeceƒüini adreslemeyi tercih etmeliyiz. 2020 ‚Äòye yakla≈ütƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±z ≈üu g√ºnlerde, Finans teknolojilerinde de benzer bir yakla≈üƒ±m kullanƒ±ldƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± g√∂r√ºyoruz. B√ºy√ºk bankalar inovasyona geri d√∂n√ºyor! Son birka√ß yƒ±ldƒ±r trend haline gelen Agile (√áevik) yakla≈üƒ±mlarƒ±n, evrilerek de olsa, s√ºrmeye devam ettiƒüini s√∂yleyebiliriz. ƒ∞≈ü birimleri ile yakƒ±n √ßalƒ±≈üma ve ≈üeffaflƒ±k felsefesinin √∂n√ºm√ºzdeki yƒ±llarda, farklƒ± isimler ile olsa da, ilerleyeceƒüi √∂ng√∂r√ºl√ºyor. Yanƒ± sƒ±ra, bir√ßok ara≈ütƒ±rma firmasƒ±nƒ±n analizlerinde de, stratejik IT kavramƒ±nƒ±n tekrar g√ºndeme gelmeye ba≈üladƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± g√∂r√ºyoruz. √ñzetle, i≈ü birimleri ile IT ekiplerinin i√ß i√ße √ßalƒ±≈ütƒ±ƒüƒ± organizasyonel modellere ge√ßi≈üin olduƒüunu ifade ediliyor. Stratejik IT yapƒ±lanmasƒ±na ge√ßen √∂rneklerden bir tanesi de ABD‚Äôden JPMorgan Chase. JPMorgan‚Äôƒ±n global CIO‚Äôsu Lori Beer, Reuters‚Äôe verdiƒüi r√∂portajda bankanƒ±n iki yƒ±llƒ±k yol haritasƒ±nda teknik yeteneklere odaklanma ve deneyimli personellerin i≈ü alƒ±mƒ± ile birlikte daha zorlayƒ±cƒ± projelere kaynak saƒülama hedefi bulunduƒüunu ifade ediyor. Yeni i≈üe alƒ±nan kaynaklarƒ±n teknik deƒüerlendirme ve eƒüitim s√ºre√ßlerine tabi olacaƒüƒ±, sonrasƒ±nda da kariyer danƒ±≈ümanƒ± ≈üeklinde g√∂rev yapacak y√∂neticilere atanacaƒüƒ±nƒ± ve inovasyon projelerinde yer alacaklarƒ±nƒ± ifade ediyor. Her yƒ±l d√ºnya genelinde b√ºnyesine 1.000 civarƒ± giri≈ü seviyesi m√ºhendis katan JPMorgan, toplamda 50.000 teknoloji uzmanƒ± istihdam etmektedir. Inovasyon konusunda atƒ±lƒ±ma ge√ßen b√ºy√ºk firmalardan bir tanesi de Bank Of America. D√ºnyanƒ±n en b√ºy√ºk bankalarƒ±ndan biri olan Bank Of America, bug√ºn blockchain alanƒ±nda sahip olduƒüu 50 ‚Äòye yakƒ±n patent ile lider konumda yer almaktadƒ±r. Western Union gibi kurulu≈ülarƒ±n, hen√ºz blockchain teknolojisinin faydalarƒ±nƒ± anlayabilmek i√ßin maliyeti ve zaman kazancƒ±nƒ± bir s√ºre daha izlemeleri gerektiƒüini belirtse de, teknolojik olarak geride kalmamak adƒ±na Bank of America bu alanda atƒ±lƒ±mlarƒ±nƒ± s√ºrd√ºrmektedir. D√ºnya genelinde b√ºy√ºk bankalar m√º≈üteri deneyimi etrafƒ±nda yenilikler sunmaya devam ettik√ße, k√º√ß√ºk ve orta √∂l√ßekli bankalarƒ±n da rekabet saƒülamalarƒ± adƒ±na m√º≈üterilerinin geli≈üen beklentilerini kar≈üƒ±lamalarƒ± gerekecektir. Fintek ≈üirketleri Y ku≈üaƒüƒ±na daha √ßok hizmet verecek. Bir√ßok ara≈ütƒ±rmada yer aldƒ±ƒüƒ± ≈üekilde d√ºnyada 23‚Äì38 ya≈ü arasƒ±ndaki ku≈üak en b√ºy√ºk √ßalƒ±≈üma g√ºc√ºn√º olu≈üturmaktadƒ±r. Bir √ºst nesilden daha az giri≈üimci olmalarƒ±na raƒümen, √ßoƒüunlukla Y ku≈üaƒüƒ± kendi i≈ülerini yapmak istiyorlar. Y ku≈üaƒüƒ±nƒ±n bu beklentilerini g√∂ren √ße≈üitli fintek kurulu≈ülarƒ±, Y ku≈üaƒüƒ±na y√∂nelik hizmetler sunmaya y√∂nelmektedir. √ñrneƒüin; Flyhomes, mortgage‚Äôa rakip olarak, sƒ±radan ev alƒ±cƒ±larƒ±nƒ±n tamamƒ± nakit tekliflerde bulunmalarƒ±nƒ± saƒülamaktadƒ±r. Divvy, ev alƒ±cƒ±larƒ±nƒ±n √∂nce kiralama yaparak m√ºlk edinmelerine olanak saƒülar. Goodly i≈üverenlerin, √ßalƒ±≈üanlarƒ±nƒ±n √∂ƒürenci kredilerine katkƒ±da bulunmalarƒ±nƒ± saƒülamaktadƒ±r. Fintek kurulu≈ülarƒ± Y ku≈üaƒüƒ±nƒ±n hedeflerini finanse etmelerine yardƒ±mcƒ± olmalarƒ±nƒ±n, m√º≈üteri sadakati ve artan gelir saƒülayacaƒüƒ±nƒ± d√º≈ü√ºnerek ilerlemektedir. Fintek‚Äôe yatƒ±rƒ±m katlanarak artƒ±yor. Fintech‚Äôte risk sermayesi destekli ≈üirketler 2018'de yakla≈üƒ±k 40 milyar dolar hacme ula≈ütƒ±. 2017'den bu yana % 120'lik bir artƒ±≈ü g√∂sterdi. Amazon, m√º≈üteri deneyimini geli≈ütirmek ve i≈ületmelerin platformlarƒ±nda satƒ±≈ü yapma kapasitelerini artƒ±rmalarƒ±na yardƒ±mcƒ± olmak i√ßin k√º√ß√ºk i≈ületmelere finansman saƒülƒ±yor. Apple, sƒ±nƒ±fƒ±ndaki en iyi m√º≈üteri deneyimini finansal bir √ºr√ºne getirerek, m√º≈üteri g√ºvenlik kaygƒ±larƒ±nƒ± gidermeyi hedefleyen Apple kredi kartƒ±nƒ± ba≈ülatƒ±yor. Facebook kendi kripto para birimini ba≈ülatmayƒ± hedefliyor. RPA botlarƒ±, uygulamalara giri≈ü yapmak, formlarƒ± doldurmak, belgeleri klas√∂rlere ta≈üƒ±mak, ƒ∞K, BT ve diƒüer hizmet departmanlarƒ±na faydalƒ± bilgi ve analitik saƒülamak gibi bir√ßok insan eylemini dijital olarak kopyalayarak icra etme yeteneƒüine sahiptir. RPA teknolojisi 2020'de baskƒ±n halde devam edeceƒüi √∂ng√∂r√ºlen trendlerden biri olarak nitelendiriliyor. Kripto para birimleri son yƒ±llarda olduk√ßa pop√ºler hale geldi ve bunlara yatƒ±rƒ±m yapan ≈üirketler beklenmeyen oranlarda k√¢r ettiler. Investing.com‚Äôa g√∂re, ≈üu anda 2.681 farklƒ± kripto para birimi var. Bir√ßoƒüu, bitcoin‚Äôi, 2009‚Äôda Satoshi Nakamoto takma adƒ± altƒ±nda biri tarafƒ±ndan yaratƒ±lan ilk orijinal kripto para birimi olarak g√∂r√ºyor. Facebook son iki yƒ±ldƒ±r kripto parasƒ± olacak ‚ÄúLibra‚Äù adlƒ± projeyi y√ºr√ºt√ºyor. Yeni dijital para birimi Facebook, Messenger, WhatsApp ve Instagram‚Äôda √∂deme yapmak i√ßin kullanƒ±lacak ve ayrƒ±ca genel e-ticaret, √∂demeler vb. i√ßin de eri≈üilebilir olacak. Temassƒ±z banka / kredi kartlarƒ±, Revolut, Apple Pay, Google Pay gibi uygulamalar / hizmetler ile paranƒ±n elektronizasyonu sayesinde √∂deme alƒ±≈ükanlarƒ± deƒüi≈ümektedir. Citi ve Imperial College Business School‚Äôun 2019‚Äôdaki K√ºresel Finans ve Teknoloji Merkezi‚Äônin Dijital Para Endeksi‚Äônde yayƒ±nlanan verilere g√∂re, 2018‚Äôde dijital olarak yakla≈üƒ±k 225 milyar dolar tutarƒ±nda ki≈üisel √∂deme yapƒ±ldƒ±. Dijital Para Endeksi web sitesinde, resmi olarak ‚Äúnakit yok‚Äù d√ºzenlemesine uyum saƒülamak i√ßin hangi a≈üamada olduklarƒ±nƒ± g√∂steren 84 √ºlkenin listesi de bulunmaktadƒ±r. Yapay Zeka ile ƒ∞leti≈üim AI teknolojisi uygulamalarƒ± bankacƒ±lƒ±k dahil bir√ßok farklƒ± sekt√∂rde geli≈ümeye devam ediyor. Yeni nesil √ßaƒürƒ± merkezlerinde artƒ±k sadece birka√ß ki≈üiyi dinlerken 10‚Äì15 dakika kayƒ±p ya≈üamadan, kullanƒ±cƒ±lar doƒürudan yapay zeka ile etkile≈üime girebilir ve (neredeyse) t√ºm bankacƒ±lƒ±k sorunlarƒ±nƒ± √ß√∂zebilir hale geldiler. Abe, Slack veya SMS yoluyla √ßalƒ±≈üabilen ChatBot‚Äôlarda trend uygulamalar arasƒ±nda yer almaya devam etmektedir. Accenture‚Äôun raporu, t√ºketicilerin% 64‚Äô√ºn√ºn e-posta yazmak veya aramak yerine basit bir mesaj g√∂ndermeyi tercih ettiƒüini s√∂yl√ºyor. Baƒülantƒ±lƒ± Ara√ßlar ‚Äòda √ñdeme Sistemleri Digital Drive Report 2019 ‚Äòa g√∂re, ara√ß s√ºr√ºc√ºlerinin %73‚Äô√º s√ºr√º≈ü esnasƒ±nda internete baƒülƒ± durumdalar. Bu baƒülantƒ± markalar i√ßin m√º≈üterileri ile yeni bir temas noktasƒ± olu≈üturmaktadƒ±r. Ara√ß √ºreticileri ve 3. parti ≈üirketler tarafƒ±ndan geli≈ütirilen uygulamalar ile Yakƒ±t √ñdemesi, Park √ñdemesi, Akƒ±llƒ± Park Rezervasyon Sistemleri, Bakƒ±m/Onarƒ±m √ñdemeleri, Otomatik √ñdeme Sistemleri, Otoyol Gi≈üe √ñdemeleri vb. senaryolar i√ßin baƒülantƒ±lƒ± √∂deme sistemleri tasarlanmaktadƒ±r. RFID, Bluetooth, 3.parti API ‚Äòler aracƒ±lƒ±ƒüƒ± ile entegre sistemler tasarlanmaktadƒ±r. Yakƒ±n gelecekte Ara√ß i√ßi c√ºzdan uygulamalarƒ± ve kripto paralar ile √∂deme imkanƒ± sunulabilecektir. DataCanvas (www.zetyun.com)DataCanvas‚Äôƒ±n anahtar deƒüer teklifi, veri bilimi projelerini √ºretim modunda √ßalƒ±≈ütƒ±rabilen ger√ßek zamanlƒ±, tam otomatik ve √∂l√ßeklenebilir veri bilim platformudur. QARA (www.qara.ai)QARA, Asya‚Äôda robotik tavsiye saƒülayan birka√ß derin √∂ƒürenme (DL) biri. QARA‚Äônƒ±n roboadvisor √ºr√ºn√º KOSHO, finansal piyasalarƒ± ve varlƒ±k y√∂netimini √∂ng√∂rmek i√ßin DL kullanƒ±mƒ±nƒ± i√ßeriyor. QARA, finansal piyasalarƒ±n performansƒ±nƒ± modellemek i√ßin evri≈üimli sinir aƒülarƒ± varyasyonel otomatik kodlayƒ±cƒ±lar ve tekrarlayan sinir aƒülarƒ± ile birlikte olay tabanlƒ± analiz ve DL‚Äôyi kullanƒ±r. Synergies (www.synergies.com.tw)Robo-Danƒ±≈üman olarak adlandƒ±rƒ±lan bu AI √∂zellikli aktif portf√∂y aracƒ±, finansal hizmet saƒülayƒ±cƒ±larƒ±n hƒ±zlƒ±, basitle≈ütirilmi≈ü ve d√º≈ü√ºk maliyetli servet y√∂netimi sunmalarƒ±na yardƒ±mcƒ± olur. -- -- Computer Engineer & Technology Lead Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Electric Ethics- an Introduction
Subtitle: Written by Philip Hoover
Author: Philip Hoover
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Philip Hoover Follow -- Listen Share ‚ÄúWhat is real? How do you define real? If you‚Äôre talking about what you can feel, what you can smell, taste, and see, then real is simply electrical signals interpreted by your brain.‚Äù ‚Äî Morpheus, The Matrix ‚ÄúTo deny our own impulses is to deny the very thing that makes us human.‚Äù ‚Äî Guy who programmed the woman in the red dress, The Matrix We live in exciting but trying times. While technology has driven incredible advances in nearly every field of human knowledge and dramatically improved our access to information and increased our standards of living, it has also forever changed the way we think, move, and communicate; and it is fundamentally redefining every aspect of human ethics and morality with each passing second. We need a new paradigm for living our lives. In many ways, the perpetual conundrums of human nature have just assumed new form. In other cases, totally new problems have emerged from the nascent technological ethos. I intend to use this forum to address the modern human experience. By asking the tough questions and seeking out answers from every perspective, we will dive into human nature in the 21st century and assess how to live a rational, sustainable, healthy life by navigating the ever-expanding web of technology and consciousness. Climate change, mass surveillance, fake information, thinking machines, cybernetics, and data-driven decision making‚Ä¶ no stone will be left unturned in this investigation of the intersection of technology and philosophy. Join me on a journey into the future of mindfulness, a journey into the essence of invention, a journey that will reveal the nature of our souls. To create a better world, we must first learn how to create our best selves. Together we will make it so. A little bit about me- I believe in critical thinking. I believe in applying the scientific method; I feel that by using meticulous, analytical evaluation, we can reach logical conclusions that will lead to rational, sustainable solutions to problems. I believe that every person has their own inherent biases, but that by trying to understand and overcome these biases, we can eliminate prejudice, discrimination, and injustice in order to create an egalitarian society. Most importantly, I believe that knowledge lives, breathes, and evolves through informed conversation. I encourage the testing and challenging of my ideas. I know I am constantly questioning and challenging my own. I am a developer, a writer, a maker, and a concerned citizen that wants to use his skills and knowledge to make the world a better place so that our grandkids‚Äô grandkids will have the opportunity to continue explore this wonderful universe. This blog will delve into the esoteric aspects of technology, the unspoken effects that it has on our lives, brains, and spirits. Even though most of human philosophy thus far was born in a reality without this technology, many of its essential pillars can be applied to the new cyberverse we‚Äôve created to improve the way we interact with computers, phones, and each other. By looking to the past, we can prepare a better future. We are the first generation to ever have the tools we have at our disposal. We are still learning the best ways to use them. Sometimes the thoughts we have about why we‚Äôre doing something, how we might improve some seemingly innocuous routine or process, or why we might feel strange about something just flickers through in our brains for a split second and disappears like a bug. I hope this series will be a debugging exercise for all who read it. I hope I can offer some insight into how we can use ethics to leverage technology for the greater good of ourselves and society. And I hope you will be entertained. More than anything, I want this exercise to also be a conversation. If you find something in this blog you want to comment on, feel free to contact me via email (Philip.hoov@gmail.com) or twitter (@illPhilosopher). Let us begin. -- -- Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Internet of Things ‚Äî Rise of Automated Machines
Subtitle: Written by Nidhin Baby
Author: Nidhin Baby
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Nidhin Baby Follow -- Listen Share The kind of impact technology has in our day-to-day life is huge and like most entrepreneurs, I feel that in coming years, it is going to be gigantic and something which is going to make our lives exciting and easy. ‚ÄúA trendy technological revolution isn‚Äôt a fad, and companies, as well as brands, will start to take advantage of these technologies.‚Äù Among one of the latest technology you need to watch out for is the Internet of things (IoT). Is IoT something to be scared of? When someone refers to the Internet of Things (IoT), it means billions of physical devices present all around the world which are connected online, for sharing and collecting data. As there are various wireless networks and cheap processors, it is easy to turn anything from a small microchip to an airplane, making it a part of the IoT. Frankly, this will add a certain level of digital intelligence to devices which otherwise would be dumb, allowing them to communicate without having any human involvement, and merging the physical and digital worlds. Let‚Äôs think of the IoT scenario as a computer that knows everything it needs to be aware of, by utilizing data that they have gathered without taking any help from humans. So, here one can track and count all the things, thereby reducing loss, wastage and even cost. In addition, we can know when things have to be repaired, replaced or recalled, and if they are past their best or fresh. People assume IoT as being connected to tablets, smartphones, and computers. IoT defines a world where each and everything can be communicated and connected in an easy manner or intelligent fashion. So, in other words, with IoT, the physical world becomes one huge information system. Relationship of IoT and Devices The kind of relationship devices and IoT have can be summed up as ‚Äî any physical object can be converted into loT devices if they are connected to the Internet and easily controlled. For example, a lightbulb switched on by using a smartphone app is an IoT device. In the same way, a smart thermostat in your home or motion sensor or a connected streetlight in your community are the examples of IoT devices. ‚ÄúAn IoT device can be as soft as a kid‚Äôs toy or as serious as a driverless school bus or as complicated as a jet engine which is filled with hundreds of sensors that transmit and collect data back, for making sure the operation is efficient.‚Äù On a bigger scale, smart cities projects are filling various regions with sensors that assist in understanding and controlling the environment. Sometimes you can relate IoT to devices which don‚Äôt have an internet connection and communicates with various networks independently without any human action. So, for this reason, you can‚Äôt consider a PC as an IoT device and the same is the case with smartphones irrespective of whether it is crammed with sensors. But you can consider a fitness band or smartwatch or any other kind of wearable device as an IoT device. Role IoT can play in 2019 There are certain distinct roles that IoT can play in 2019 and the coming years. Some of them are - ‚ñ† IoT Architecture & Platform Cloud-related IoT architecture and platform will connect the virtual and real world. Also, these will assist companies to manage the IoT device security and connectivity and even collect device data, ensure IoT interoperability, and create as well as run the IoT applications. ‚ñ† Harness IoT Data Explosion Smart devices will generate a huge amount of IoT data, and this will need to be leveraged and analyzed in real time. Here is where Big Data and predictive analytics come into the picture. In addition, machine learning will be utilized for adding basic context to the data and trigger actions without the intervention of humans. ‚ñ† Industrial IoT (Internet of Things) And M2M In the manufacturing sector, there is a slight possibility that the IoT will become the IIoT (which is nothing but an Industrial Internet of Things) and this is also called as Industrial Internet. In the IIoT, machine to machine (M2M) technology will be used for supporting each and everything right from telemetry and remote monitoring to predictive maintenance. IoT ‚Äî Emerging Tech Since the prices of sensors and communication will drastically drop, it will be cost-effective to bring in more devices into the IoT. And in some cases, it will be beneficial to consumers too. With the increase in the number of connected devices, our working and living environment will be filled with various smart products, if we are really willing to take into account privacy and security trade-offs. There are chances that some might welcome the new era of smart things while others might pine for days when the table was just a normal table. -- -- Founder of a 2Base Technologies Pvt Ltd(Web and Mobile App Development Company). Finding trendy Tech innovations to implement in latest Business Deals. Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: No Title
Subtitle: Written by Elieverthon Martins
Author: Elieverthon Martins
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Elieverthon Martins Follow -- Share Retrocesso Arcaico Quando falo em tecnologia n√£o tem como n√£o pensar no Latim antigo, no per√≠odo arcaico e nos desenvolvimentos culturais, pol√≠ticos e sociais da Gr√©cia. No inicio de tudo √©ramos uma esp√©cie de homin√≠deos com o andar ‚Äúcorcunda‚Äù, uma comunica√ß√£o abomin√°vel e viv√≠amos em um mundo praticamente ‚Äúcru‚Äù. Ao decorrer dos s√©culos as coisas foram mudando, o ser humano foi evoluindo e demonstrando o porqu√™ de ser uma esp√©cie homo sapiens. Muitos seres humanos usaram sua criatividade e intelig√™ncia para criar coisas e facilitar nosso habitat, criaram os carros, avi√µes, energia el√©trica e uma infinidade de coisas extremamente importantes para a vida humana, ou seja, foram facilitando nossa vivencia ao longo dos anos. As duas guerras mundiais nos mostraram o quanto quer√≠amos e precis√°vamos de tecnologia, talvez voc√™ esteja pensando: ‚Äúmas tecnologia para matar?‚Äù Sim, foi preciso na √©poca, era uma luta por posses onde a morte gerava riqueza e a tecnologia ajudava no ataque e na defesa, logo ap√≥s a segunda guerra mundial surgiu √† corrida armamentista (Guerra Fria) onde os EUA e a URSS disputava acirradamente quem era mais desenvolvido em quest√£o tecnol√≥gica, isso acarretou muito desenvolvimento, mas tamb√©m houve in√∫meras fatalidades como (Chernobyl e Pripyat/ abril-1986). Criamos foguetes e a URSS mandou um animal para a Lua, os EUA em forma ret√≥rica mandou o homem, tivemos assim uma evolu√ß√£o ou talvez at√© uma revolu√ß√£o tecnol√≥gica espl√™ndida, tudo foi at√© a queda do muro de Berlin em 1989, onde ocorreu a ruptura na divis√£o da Alemanha capitalista (ocidental) com a socialista (oriental). No dia 1¬∫ de Janeiro de 2001 iniciamos o s√©culo XXI, junto veio √† internet, agora mais desenvolvida em rela√ß√£o a d√©cada de 1960. Essa gera√ß√£o apareceu com alguns aparelhos eletr√¥nicos da √©poca, tais como: celulares b√°sicos, videogames, computadores, eletr√¥nicos musicais e c√¢meras fotogr√°ficas ainda mais desenvolvidas. Nessa ocasi√£o para o ser humano usufruir de toda essa tecnologia era preciso adquirir todas de forma separada, ou seja, era muito incomum ter todos esses aparelhos, at√© porque o modo de divers√£o era outro muito mais simples, isso era apenas luxo. O problema/ solu√ß√£o come√ßou aparecer alguns anos mais tarde, quando a Apple em 2007 lan√ßou seu primeiro Smartphone que combinava tudo citado acima dentro de um √∫nico aparelho tang√≠vel. Vivenciando os dias atuais o ser humano n√£o consegue mais suprir suas necessidades di√°rias sem tecnologia, tudo ficou mais f√°cil, mais pr√°tico, mais lucrativo e mais superficial. Nossas crian√ßas est√£o extremamente proativas quando o assunto √© tecnologia, mas at√© que ponto isso √© bom para o desenvolvimento humano? O ego que enfatizamos por conta das redes sociais nos fazem sentir a ilus√£o de estarmos mais pr√≥ximos das pessoas, quando na verdade estamos mais longes. N√£o existe mais conquista carnal entre seres, eles n√£o sabem se comunicar pessoalmente. Antes do s√©culo XXI existia o ser humano racional e sentimental, ap√≥s o inicio do s√©culo XXI existe o ser humano racional e digital. O brasileiro passa cerca de 9 horas por dia online, seja por, celulares, tabletes e computadores, estamos em terceiro lugar no ranking dos pa√≠ses que mais ficam conectados, s√≥ nos encontramos atr√°s da Tail√¢ndia e da Filipinas. Com base √†s informa√ß√µes acima, podemos afirmar que o maior prejudicado com toda essa evolu√ß√£o tecnol√≥gica √© o corpo humano, o ser humano excede o tempo em que for√ßa partes do corpo para suprir suas necessidades digitais, o maior exemplo disso √© a coluna, passamos cerca de 4 horas usando o celular com o pesco√ßo dobrado para baixo, isso pode desencadear s√©rias les√µes cervicais. Outra parte do dia passamos sentados em cadeiras, cujo, ajuste nunca est√° de acordo com sua propor√ß√£o corporal, o que ocasionar√° les√µes na coluna vertebral e at√© mesmo na regi√£o lombar. Ilumina√ß√£o excessiva, causar√° problemas futuros de vista e fones de ouvidos n√£o utiliz√°veis na altura recomendada, que ocasionar√° perda auditiva. O pr√≥prio uso do celular em excesso est√° relacionado √† ansiedade, depress√£o e problemas do sono. As empresas de tecnologia, estudando os riscos, j√° se preparam para os pr√≥ximos anos com uma proposta de fabricar aparelhos, nos quais, ficar√£o presos a nossos membros superiores, est√° sendo estudada uma esp√©cie de √≥culos que n√£o contenha excesso de ilumina√ß√£o. Na futura ocasi√£o os dois v√™m para substituir o uso do aparelho celular, ou seja, tudo indica que estamos dando fim √† era celular. Um levantamento feito pela Itmidia concluiu que as doen√ßas do futuro relacionadas √† tecnologia ser√£o: depress√£o, problemas na coluna, perda auditiva, dem√™ncia, problemas de vista e ins√¥nia. Relacionando hist√≥ria, tecnologia e ergonomia, tudo segmenta a quest√£o de que a evolu√ß√£o nos levar√° a um retrocesso ao Arcaico, pelos seguintes motivos : o digital est√° cobrindo o som da voz, por quest√µes ergon√¥micas poderemos voltar a ser fisicamente igual aos homin√≠deos, e por consequ√™ncia social viveremos a ilus√£o da alegoria da caverna. A era digital tende a evoluir, e n√≥s seres humanos, temos que acompanhar a evolu√ß√£o, pois, o mundo econ√¥mico gira entorno disso, n√£o podemos mudar nossos padr√µes corporais para acompanhar a intera√ß√£o digital, mas podemos sim, nos regrarmos e reeducarmos em quest√µes ergon√¥micas para n√£o sofrermos do mal causado pela tecnologia contempor√¢nea. -- -- Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: 10 years from now
Subtitle: Written by Nick Root
Author: Nick Root
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Nick Root Follow -- 1 Listen Share My name is Dietmar and I am an entrepreneur in the year 2030. I run a fleet of autonomous taxis in Zurich, through a business called Fast Cabs. A lot has changed in the last decade, so I hope what you are about to read helps you understand the financial systems that are required to facilitate the businesses of tomorrow. I incorporated the business entirely on a Swiss government issued blockchain. My partners and I hold shares in the form of smart contracts, with built in voting rights and share issuance functionality. All shares on the Swiss stock market are now smart contracts. The only distinguishing factor making a company public (or not) is a Boolean database field called ‚ÄòPUBLIC_TRADABLE‚Äô. We are keeping ours to ‚ÄòFALSE‚Äô for now. It‚Äôs not that we are worried about the extra paperwork, in fact there is no paperwork in 2030, now that all our transactions are automatically classified by our bank‚Äôs AI and booked via API into the correct accounting fields. We currently run 30 driverless taxis as part of the city‚Äôs privatised transportation scheme. We funded 10 ourselves and lease the other 20. The leaser gets paid in real time based on a 50% split of all revenue made on those taxis. This is easy to do because each taxi has its own digital identity, wallet and corresponding wallet logic. The leaser therefore doesn‚Äôt need to trust us to pay on time or to pay the correct amount. Not that trust is really a problem anymore. After a series of high-profile fraud and corruption cases in the early 2020s, companies can now not be successful unless they build ‚Äòtrust by design‚Äô. It‚Äôs the first thing investors and lenders ask about. Let me give you an example of what I mean. All my company‚Äôs ‚Äòevents‚Äô are added to a Merkle Tree made up of quantum-resistant hash functions. Events can be financial transactions, accounting adjustments, taxi rides, recharges or maintenance trips. Our last audit took a nerve racking 30 seconds, which is the time it took for our auditors‚Äô algorithm to remotely check that our financial database balanced and that our corresponding event blockchain was valid. Financial audit algorithms are not the only algos we have to accommodate. The tech businesses of your era were borderless and became more powerful than most countries. They took full advantage of Western governments‚Äô haplessness, lobbying against increased anti-trust and social media responsibility and happily paying whatever regulatory fines were imposed against them. That all came to an end in the early 20‚Äôs, when regulators finally showed their teeth, imposing personal liability on tech executives for regulatory breaches and ordering the break-up of several tech giants, which were forced to sell off sections of their business to stimulate market competition. The authorities also now have a real time ‚Äòevent feed‚Äô that monitors our management systems. They have detection algorithms running for price manipulation, monopoly behaviour and any kind of foul play. It might sound a bit big brother I know, but it‚Äôs not all bad: tax returns are now a thing of the past, for example. Talking of tax, in the mid 2020s companies are viewed as social entities that need to support their people as much as they need to support their customers. Our tax rate is a function of the salary range between our lowest and highest earners. So if a company pays their CEO five hundred times as much as their lowest earning employee, they get hit with a very high tax rate to compensate the state for needing to care more for these low earners. It‚Äôs not just audits, tax and regulation that have sped up. The whole business runs at a pace that completely excludes humans from operational roles. Humans are just not fast enough in this world. We run the algorithms which in turn run the business. I‚Äôll explain what I mean. When a customer needs a ride, they use an aggregator app on their smartphone to post a lift request, including the details of the trip required. All licenced taxis in the area receive the request and prepare a quote. The quote is dependent not only on the distance and time required for the trip, but also the potential routes. In 2030 the roads have become economic players themselves, with wallets and their own price optimisation algorithms that price according to the traffic situation and road condition. The cab needs to take all this into account and quote the potential passenger a reasonable price in less than 3 seconds. The passenger has a choice of several leading aggregator apps, but it doesn‚Äôt really matter which one they use. What matters is the algorithm they choose to run within their app. Algorithms or ‚Äòalgos‚Äô as we call them, are now independent products just like apps of your day. Most apps are free but it‚Äôs the algos that people buy from independent stores to help them filter through the enormous amount of data they are now exposed to. All products: visual content, music, restaurants and of course taxis are filtered for humans by recommender algos. Taxi hailing algos can order by price, speed, customer review rating or perhaps a combination of everything. A taxi‚Äôs customer rating is particularly important for customers as they seek a safe, high quality ride. The most common method is to give heavier weighting to reviews from a customer‚Äôs friend or acquaintance. These ‚Äòweighted ratings‚Äô are possible because in 2030 all bots and people have digital identities, known as a ‚Äòseed‚Äô. These are government issued IDs that use cryptography to disclose only the things about you that you want known. For example, the app can query any of my taxis‚Äô public fields, like ‚ÄòLICENCE_NO‚Äô so they can cross check it to the official licence register, or ‚ÄòREG_NUMBER‚Äô to cross check with all friends‚Äô taxi histories and ratings. Right now, human drivers are making a comeback despite the reduced product quality, a little like the vinyl revival of your time. To facilitate this, hipsters would need to make sure that ‚ÄòIS_HUMAN‚Äô returns ‚ÄòTRUE‚Äô on the taxi‚Äôs ID. Once the passenger has chosen the taxi and is on their way, the taxi starts making continuous micro payments with various route wallets as it goes. It also continually communicates with the routes ahead. If the traffic situation changes, an alternative route is negotiated with the various economic players involved, not least the passenger, who will need to be notified. Cash is a distant memory in 2030, and so are cards. As soon as bank payments became instant there was no need for Visa or Mastercard to act as middlemen. The customer‚Äôs app initiates a wire straight from the customer‚Äôs wallet to the taxi wallet when the trip is complete. The problem of fraud and chargebacks was solved with ‚Äòfraud ratings‚Äô, facilitated by the above-mentioned digital identities. All economic actors, including the bots, are held to account using these ratings, so if you are about to wire money to a wallet with a shady history, the system will warn you up front. This strongly incentivises fair resolution of financial issues, just like Ebay in your time, who were the pioneers of this trust system. When the customer is in the cab, they can pick up whatever audio or visual content they feel like for the journey. As soon as they enter the cab, our smart screens detect their current subscriptions and automatically log them back into whatever VR filmscape they were last watching. The advertising in my cab uses smart screens that display targeted ads according to the customer‚Äôs purchasing profile, which is communicated to the cab from the customer‚Äôs personal device just like their content subscriptions. The screens can tell when a customer‚Äôs eyeballs actually look at the screen, just like impressions in old-school web advertising, so the advertiser fires us a real-time micropayment to my wallet every time a customer looks at the ad. My taxis are finished with solar paint and glass, so they are permanently recharging. However, when it‚Äôs a cloudy day they use more electricity than they can create. When their batteries are low, they automatically hook up to the city‚Äôs smart grid for a recharge. When plugged in and recharged they can even use their panels to contribute back to the grid. The grid is now ‚Äòsmart‚Äô which means traceability can be recorded using a public power blockchain to prove the amount of power used and produced. The wallets of the taxi and local charging units are debited or credited according to who powered whom. So as you can see, by 2030 some things have changed a lot and others not so much. People still need to run businesses and, thankfully for my business, people still need to hail taxis. It‚Äôs the methods and systems that facilitate those endeavours that have changed most. This facilitation has been enabled by infrastructure that enables complex interactions at huge scale. Just a simple taxi ride has involved thousands of actors collaborating and often competing at breath-taking speed using common web protocols. The World Wide Web is finally worthy of its name. -- -- 1 Enthusiast www.nickroot.co.uk Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: From West Africa to Bangladesh: Technology Key to Emerging Market Challenges
Subtitle: Published in kormo
Author: Meghan Butt
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Meghan Butt Follow kormo -- Listen Share I am a recent MBA graduate and management consultant passionate about building effective and scalable strategies. Currently, I am based in San Francisco, CA. In July 2017, I began my MBA journey at Simon Business School in Rochester, NY. I spent the three years prior in Burkina Faso, West Africa as a Peace Corps Volunteer. Those three years had a tremendous impact on my life and there‚Äôs not a day that goes by when I don‚Äôt think of my friends and family back in my village. Therefore, when I was enrolled in my Advanced Competitive Strategy course and a Bangladeshi classmate asked me if I wanted to spend the semester learning about a new app that would help individuals in emerging markets get jobs, I gave an immediate ‚Äúyes!‚Äù. Three classmates and I spent the Spring semester analyzing Kormo‚Äôs business value proposition and recommending a long-term strategy. For those unfamiliar with the app, Kormo was launched out of Google‚Äôs in-house incubator, Google 120. The idea was born after founder Bickey Russell saw firsthand the consequences of the unstructured job hiring process in Bangladesh. Kormo‚Äôs services target job seekers and employers operating within Bangladesh‚Äôs informal, gig economy and aim to improve the speed, quality, and experience of applicant-employer matching. My team and I spent a good portion of the semester familiarizing ourselves with the Bangladeshi job market. We kept our focus on the employers in Bangladesh and wanted to analyze the problems they currently face, hypothesized reasons for why these problems exist today, and identified what an ideal solution for hiring an applicant would look like. From here, we analyzed what Kormo is currently doing and made recommendations based on discrepancies between the two. After a semester-long research and analysis, we categorized the problems job-seekers in Bangladesh‚Äôs gig economy into the following three: 1. Small-and-medium businesses often have a limited applicant pool 2. Employees face uncertainty in applicants‚Äô accountability 3. Risk of unreliable employee once hired Here, I will take you through problem 2- the problem of uncertainty in applicant accountability. In doing our research, we discovered that a major problem employers face is that employees often don‚Äôt show up for interviews. My American teammates and I were in absolute shock to learn this. We couldn‚Äôt believe that interviewees in Dhaka (the capital of Bangladesh and where Kormo was initially launched) would land an interview then not show up! According to a Kaizen market research report, professionalism is a top quality employers look for in candidates so it seemed like identifying to root reason as to why applicants aren‚Äôt showing up to interviews would help improve the job-matching process. We identified the following three hypotheses as to why applicants may not be showing up for interviews: unenforceable attendance, limited contact capability, and poor planning by candidates. Unenforceable Attendance: Our first hypothesized reason as to why candidates are not showing up to interviews is that candidates see attendance as unenforceable with no repercussions for not showing up. Applicants may perceive jobs within the informal job market as undifferentiated and thus have little motivation for showing up, especially if there is no substantial consequence for unexcused absences. Therefore, Kormo could track candidates interview attendance rate and provide a warning notification of consequences, such as downgrading resume priority for future gigs, if the candidate drops below a certain level. Additionally, Kormo could also temporarily freeze accounts for unexcused absences to interviews. These could help increase the interview attendance rate of candidates. Limited Contact Capability: A second explanation as to why applicants aren‚Äôt showing up to interviews is that they may be limited in their capability of contacting their potential employer. If applicants are not provided with the employer‚Äôs direct contact information, then they may be at a loss when trying to cancel. Additionally, there may be unanticipated situations that may legitimately bar applicants from interviewing. For Kormo, this means that they could ensure in-app direct messaging capability between applicants and potential employers to prevent interview no-shows. By allowing instant messaging capability between candidates and employers and creating one-click functionality for 24+ hour cancellation without consequence could help decrease interview no-show rates. Poor Planning by Candidates: A final explanation as to why applicants aren‚Äôt showing up to interviews is poor planning by the candidates. They may be neglecting to check their schedule for upcoming events and conflicts before accepting interviews. Or, candidates may by overlooking a means of transportation for the interview or accounting for traffic. Kormo can leverage Google apps to help if this is the root cause of why interviews are not showing up for interviews. First, Kormo can leverage Google calendars by sending event reminders for upcoming interviews. Finally, Google maps could be integrated within Kormo to provide push notifications about departure time given projected traffic conditions. Travel and nudge notifications would be a way to potentially decrease interview no-show rates if the core reason is poor planning by the candidates themselves. We believe that improving the proportion of applicants who attend interviews would increase Kormo‚Äôs value. If you would like to see a more in-depth analysis of the aforementioned problems 1 and 3, please check out my classmate Shah Choudhury‚Äôs blog posts! -- -- The Kormo app helps people in Indonesia and Bangladesh build careers. Kormo means ‚ÄúWork‚Äù in Bangla. Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: The Gig is Up: Uber and Co. Should Embrace the Inevitable
Subtitle: How is the Gig Economy changing the future Jobs landscape | Data Driven Investor
Author: Clark Boyd
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Member-only story Clark Boyd Follow DataDrivenInvestor -- Share At an elemental level, the gig economy is nothing new. The newest thing about it is the name, which has been in use for about a decade now. For centuries, the same employer-employee dynamic has existed. www.datadriveninvestor.com In the 18th century, it was typical for a man to work in a range of industries to make ends meet. He might work as a barber by day, and an auctioneer by night. Many drove horse-drawn carriages, which were shared by a number of passengers. I‚Äôm calling that one ‚ÄòUber Pull‚Äô. It is technology that is the main driver of the 21st-century gig economy, coupled with an uncertain economic climate. Workers can sign up via an app and start accepting jobs right away. Businesses can access an on-demand, cost-effective workforce without the usual hassle of hiring new people. -- -- empowerment through data, knowledge, and expertise. subscribe to DDIntel at https://ddintel.datadriveninvestor.com Tech/business writer, CEO (Novela), lecturer (Columbia), and data analyst. >500k views on Medium. I used to be with it, but then they changed what ‚Äòit‚Äô was. Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

The U.S., China, and Japan are countries that have large vehicle populations, which require frequent tire changes, which makes them forerunners in the online tire market. Request for sample: https://www.marketsandmarkets.com/requestsampleNew.asp?id=50123881 North America holds the largest market share for E-commerce software platform market for 2016 North America is currently the largest market for e-commerce software platforms. The drivers for this growth are increased spending on e-commerce platforms by large retailers, who have invested in dedicated mobile platforms, and high internet penetration rate. In North America, the U.S. is the revenue hot spot for this market and would dominate throughout the overall forecast period. The major market players in the E-tailing market for automotive applications are Advance Auto Parts (U.S.A.), Alibaba Group Holding Limited (China), Amazon.com Inc. (U.S.A.), Delticom AG (Germany), O‚ÄôReilly Auto Parts (U.S.A.), Flipkart (India) and eBay Inc. (U.S.A.) etc. which have their presence in not only the domestic but in the international market as well. About MarketsandMarkets‚Ñ¢ MarketsandMarkets‚Ñ¢ provides quantified B2B research on 30,000 high growth niche opportunities/threats which will impact 70% to 80% of worldwide companies‚Äô revenues. Currently servicing 7500 customers worldwide including 80% of global Fortune 1000 companies as clients. The GEM aims at proactive collaboration with the clients to identify new opportunities, identify most important customers, write ‚ÄúAttack, avoid and defend‚Äù strategies, identify sources of incremental revenues for both the company and its competitors. MarketsandMarkets‚Ñ¢ now coming up with 1,500 MicroQuadrants (Positioning top players across leaders, emerging companies, innovators, strategic players) annually in high growth emerging segments. MarketsandMarkets‚Ñ¢ is determined to benefit more than 10,000 companies this year for their revenue planning and help them take their innovations/disruptions early to the market by providing them research ahead of the curve. Title: The Game plan
Subtitle: Written by Alex Leon
Author: Alex Leon
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Alex Leon Follow -- Listen Share $BYND Weekly notes & Levels (11/23/19) We closed at $77.54 yesterday on Friday, which leaves us on stand-by until one of my levels of interest are met with volume. I promise to up a post on specifically how I establish these levels of interests and the various timeframes I use to compile my charts. I‚Äôve tried every strategy at least once, and inevitably found what works for me through trial and error ‚Äî I like to make complex things simple, if you really know that‚Äôs kind of just what I do naturally. The Gray bars are pivot levels ‚Äî I‚Äôm not specifically trading at this level, but definitely watching to see how the stock reacts. On a side note, these are generally good places for me to start lock in profits and reduce some of my risk by letting off some size; live to trade another day there will be other opportunities. The Purple bars are trigger levels ‚Äî I‚Äôm not afraid to go balls deep here, I did all the previous work. This is where I would tackle on most of my size if the price action confirms the plan execution. The Red bars are overhead resistance levels ‚ÄîThese are areas that have historically shown to be met by supply where the sellers are looking to sell usually with size. The Green bars are underlying demand levels ‚Äî Expect buyers to jump in here or traps to begin setting up. Red bars: $81.35, $83.09 Gray bars: $80.13, $78.61, $77.79 Purple bars: $79.47, $78.09 Green bars: $76.22, $74.87 GROW OR DIE -- -- 6 years experience trading ‚Äî here to share my journey of mastering my craft and hoping to inspire others on the path to theirs.
