Title: An Aeroponic Greenhouse is Your Next Kitchen Appliance
Subtitle: Published in Predict
Author: Abbey
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Member-only story Abbey Follow Predict -- 3 Share Imagine having your own miniature greenhouse conveniently located right under your kitchen counter. There wouldn‚Äôt be any last-minute runs to get lettuce for the salad or grab that forgotten herb for the recipe. Not to mention, just seeing your flourishing veggies and herbs will likely boost your consumption of them. That‚Äôs exactly why you should leave a fruit bowl out in your kitchen instead of candy dish. Although this may sound too good to be true, the start-up Helioponix is already in the midst of manufacturing the first version of their personal greenhouse appliance called a GroPod. The company was founded by two Purdue University undergraduates who were collaborating on a research project that looked into different methods of growing food in space. The two students didn‚Äôt understand why the technology they were working on had to be reserved for missions to the moon or mars. Instead, they believed that the everyday consumer could benefit from their own aeroponics garden. With a mission to popularize growing fresh produce in the kitchen, the two began designing a small aeroponics appliance that would turn eating your veggies from an inconvenient chore to an easy, enjoyable, and sustainable experience. Their innovation, known as the GroPod, is about the size and shape of a dishwater and houses your‚Ä¶ -- -- 3 where the future is written I‚Äôm a food scientist by PhD, a science writer, and a YouTuber. I‚Äôm fascinated by food science and enjoy writing and sharing what I‚Äôve learn. Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Product Hunt Radio: The present and future of social media with Matt Navarra
Subtitle: Product Hunt
Author: Ryan Hoover
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Home About Follow publication The place to discover your next favorite thing. Follow publication Ryan Hoover Follow Product Hunt -- 1 Listen Share On this episode, Abadesi talks to Matt Navarra, a social media consultant from the UK and long-time Product Hunt community member. He is a self-described ‚ÄúFacebook geek‚Äù who has worked in digital communications for the UK government and was previously social media director at The Next Web. In this episode: We of course also talk about some of his favorite products to help up your social media game, tools that social media managers can‚Äôt live without, and the smart home devices he loves. We‚Äôll be back next week so be sure to subscribe on Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts, Spotify, Breaker, Overcast, or wherever you listen to your favorite podcasts. Also, big thanks to AngelList and FreshBooks for their support. üò∏ ‚ÄúIf we were to spin forwards 10‚Äì20 years from now, I think that social media will look completely different. We‚Äôve seen social media climb up the hill of ‚Äòoh, this is amazing, we can share everything, we can touch everyone with everything we do in our lives‚Ä¶‚Äô and now we‚Äôre on a downhill slide where people are saying actually this is not good. Having everyone able to talk to everyone openly with no censorship just doesn‚Äôt work.‚Äù ‚Äî Matt ‚ÄúOne of the big reasons that Facebook is pushing us towards Facebook Stories is to do with ad revenue growth. Within News Feed at the moment you probably see an ad every sixth or seventh post. If they try to increase that and you were getting an ad every third or fourth post, that really deteriorates the quality of the experience. So Stories is a whole new innovative format for brands to advertise on.‚Äù ‚Äî Matt ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry about trying to be on every single platform. Think about who is your audience in terms of location, age, their interests. How does that marry up with the product or service that you‚Äôre selling? Use that to guide you towards the most appropriate platform.‚Äù ‚Äî Matt -- -- 1 The place to discover your next favorite thing. Founder of Product Hunt. Weekend Fund investor. Follow at @rrhoover. Title: Here are Three Crypto Coins to Keep an Eye on in February
Subtitle: Published in Asgardia Space Nation
Author: Asgardia.space
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Asgardia.space Follow Asgardia Space Nation -- Listen Share With the bear market being felt deeply in the crypto industry, it‚Äôs reasonably understandable to see investors lose interest. But, on the other hand, a bear market often proves to be an opportune time for coins to develop, and grow, not only their community but their technological developments as well. Thus, here are the three coins to watch for February 2019. Zilliqa (ZIL) Being able to scale without sacrificing decentralization, is the primary objective for most cryptocurrencies. And for Zilliqa (ZIL), it‚Äôs the primary goal. Zilliqa is known as the high-throughput blockchain platform. It emerged from a growing need to scale. After watching scaling problems with existing blockchains like Ethereum and Bitcoin, the Zilliqa team decided to develop a platform which worked to address the scaling issue. They use on chain sharding to enable many transactions to be processed on a smaller scale along the network. This resulted in Zilliqa being able to handle almost 3000 (approx 2828) transactions per second (TPS). One of the reasons Zilliqa is a coin to keep an eye on in February is due to its upcoming mainnet launch. Though this is technically on the 31st of January, the repercussions of such a significant release will be felt during the following month. The mainnet will launch with many novel features, such as a Practical Byzantine Fault Tolerance (pBFT) based blockchain. Byzantine fault tolerance is a type of consensus model which address the Byzantine generals problem, a universal issue experienced by all distributed networks. In short, inconsistencies, result in catastrophe. Innovative solutions, like pBFT, fight this issue by reducing the influence of malicious actors, or discrepancies on a distributed network. Moreover, PBFT adds finality, which means there is no need for confirmations and this creates a faster transaction. Another feature that will be implemented upon launch is safe, smart contracts. This will make use of Zilliqa‚Äôs self-developed programing language called Scilla. The language is not Turing complete, because of this it won‚Äôt support all applications, but since it‚Äôs ‚Äòincomplete‚Äô it means that it can be verified, validating smart contracts and making them ‚Äúsafe.‚Äù Furthermore, dual & eco-friendly mining will go live with the mainnet. For mining, Zilliqa uses a special combination of Proof of work (POW) and pBFT. Using POW for approximately 1 minute, every 2‚Äì3 of any given mining cycle results in less energy cost. The combination of these two consensus mechanisms also allows for dual mining of any Ethash-powered POW blockchain. ZIL sits at a current price of $0.020373 TRON (TRX) Tron is positioning itself to become a global digital content entertainment system, competing with platforms like Ethereum to gain supremacy over the decentralized application market and eventually become a world leader in digital entertainment consumption. Justin Sun is TRON‚Äôs CEO, and a powerfully loyal community backs the company, TRX has become one of the most popular cryptocurrencies in the industry. Since the release of the Tron Virtual Machine (TVM), the company has gone from strength to strength citing a total of 142 Tron dapps, 6 of which are the top 10 dapps of all time. What‚Äôs more, the number of registered accounts continues to increase and currently stands at a whopping 1.42 million. Tron had a big year in 2018 with the launch of its mainnet, and the TVM, to the $140 million acquisition of peer to peer file sharing network BitTorrent, and the subsequent initiation of project Atlas. Sun claims that the purchase will eventually make Tron the ‚Äúlargest decentralized Internet ecosystem in the world.‚Äù The plan was to update BitTorrent for the crypto generation, tokenizing the platform through the sale of its token BTT. Tron benefitted from the migration of more than 100 million active of BitTorrent users over to Tron, and Vice versa. The project aims to incentivize file sharing on the BitTorrent platform through the integration of a new Tron based TRC-10 token BitTorrent (BTT). February will be a promising month for TRON, particularly with the recent BTT token sale. Using the rights to BitTorrent, Sun introduced a series of periodic airdrops of the newly minted BTT token for all TRX holders. The first of which will happen on February 11. The airdrop will be issued to any holder of TRX on a one to one ratio, i.e. for every TRX held, one BTT will be airdropped. A massive 10.1% of the current supply of the BTT token will be airdropped in varying degrees up until 2025. TRX sits at a current price of $0.027545 Binance Coin (BNB) BNB is the native cryptocurrency of the world‚Äôs leading crypto exchange Binance. BNB offered early funding for Binance via its distribution in the ICO back in July 2017. Based on the Ethereum network, BNB is an ERC-20 token, which is presently most widely used for paying fees on the exchange. BNB will most likely be implemented into the company‚Äôs upcoming public blockchain, Bianace chain. Announced back in March 2018, Binance Chain is as ambitious, as it is unprecedented, seeing the company acquire its own mainnet. Instead of running on the Ethereum network, BNB will function as a native token on its very own blockchain. Binance chain could launch in February, with the company pointing to initiation at some point in Q1. As per the firm, Binance chain will move from being a company to a community CEO of Binance, Changpeng Zhao aka CZ remarked that Binance Chain was both fast and less expensive than Ethereum. Zhao said that on Binance Chain users get one-second transaction confirmation and one confirmation is final, so it‚Äôs a much faster chain, and the transaction fees are less costly, there‚Äôs a lot of advantages for them to move to the Binance chain, which uses a native DEX. The exchange also has a highly anticipated decentralized exchange. Binance DEX is set to launch in early Q1 of this year with CZ announcing that he expected the DEX to be ready by late 2018/early 2019 (so every reason to watch out for it in Feb). The new exchange will boast a wallet where users can store any token they want to trade and will use BNB as a quasi ‚Äògas‚Äô for transactions. Being a decentralized exchange, the Binance DEX will provide a high level of security with data spread across multiple points. BNB sits at a current price of $6.11. Title: How Much Do Data Scientists Make Part 2
Subtitle: Digging Deeper Reveals 2 Underlying Trends
Author: Tony Yiu
Article:
The world‚Äôs leading publication for data science, AI, and ML professionals. 
			We Find Some Surprising Trends When We Dig Deeper		 Last time we used H1B salary data to explore general data scientist salary trends (please refer to my previous blog post for details on the data). Here is a quick refresher of what we found: Last time I didn‚Äôt have enough time to dig more deeply into the numbers. But after examining things in more detail, I discovered some surprising trends. First, the general stagnation in Data Science salaries on average over the past few years is really a tale of 2 trends: I realize that my list of "trendy" tech companies is completely subjective ‚Äì my criteria was, "Would the average grad of a top engineering school be excited to work there?" Regardless, check out the difference in trends: My guess is that there are two groups of companies ‚Äì ones that have the ability to produce, gather, and extract competitive edge from proprietary data and ones that do not have it. Because the "haves" can get more value out of their data scientists, they are willing to pay them more as well. Meanwhile the "have nots" are much more likely to get frustrated with the lack of value created by their data science teams resulting in a lower perceived worth (and higher turnover). Companies like Google and Facebook have demonstrated that gathering and exploiting unique data can create a massive competitive advantage (and this competitive advantage expands over time as more data is collected and insights are gleaned). Their success with using data science to generate massive profits creates a virtuous feedback loop where data and research creates profits which are then reinvested back into more data and research (resulting in even greater future profits). So the lesson for aspiring data scientists is to work for a company that owns the type of unique data that grants a competitive edge. And a company that knows how to properly use that data to create a virtuous loop of research and profits. Here is a recent (2018‚Äì19) look at median data scientist salary by company. Remember, we are looking at only the data scientist job title and I filtered out companies that hired 5 or fewer data scientists during the period. Wow, look at Stitch Fix! That is a pretty penny especially when we remember that the $190,000 median figure represents just base salary and does not include bonuses or stock. More generally, the companies at the top are all data driven and either have massive amounts of proprietary data (AirBnB, Lyft, Facebook) or are building towards it through unique interactions with their users (Stitch Fix, Opendoor). Lastly, when looking at these differences across companies, it is helpful to remember that they are driven not just by the relative sizes of each company‚Äôs bank account but also by differences in role and required expertise. Unsurprisingly, data scientist pay in the San Francisco Bay Area (Silicon Valley) is higher than in other parts of the country (many of the companies in my "trendy" tech group are located in Silicon Valley). The difference in median base salary shown in the chart below is probably understated as I focused primarily on the West Coast and other tech hubs ‚Äì many low cost cities in the Midwest and the South were left out of my analysis. The difference in salaries between data scientists working in Silicon Valley versus other regions looks pretty significant. But unfortunately, the differences in cost of living (driven by sky high home prices and rents) is even greater. Making big bucks is great but we need to remember that expenses matter just as much. If we make big bucks but then we end up paying even bigger bucks to Uncle Sam (taxes) and our landlord (rent), then we may still end up a net loser. First, let‚Äôs take a look at how data scientist salaries stack up by region (2018‚Äì19 salaries only): As expected, the San Francisco Bay Area comes out on top in terms of median base salary. New York salaries are less than I expected them to be ‚Äì the likely reason is that my dataset is not capturing some of the data scientists employed by the big banks (where they are probably called quantitative strategists, risk managers, or portfolio consultants). Also, using just base salary probably understates the earning power of data scientists employed by the big banks as their compensation is weighted heavily towards annual cash bonuses (100% bonuses are not out of the ordinary). The one that really jumps out to me is Seattle. As a data scientist there, you are earning almost as much as you would in Silicon Valley, but you pay no state income taxes and enjoy significantly lower housing costs. Let‚Äôs divide the median base salaries from the previous bar chart by median rents (multiplied by 12 to get annual rent) in each of those cities to get a rough proxy for how far your dollar goes (I left out the "Other" category as that includes multiple cities, but not enough to safely apply a national average). In case you are curious, here are the monthly median rents that I used (sourced from this article): And here are how the base salaries look when converted to units of rent-equivalents. Recall that I am taking the monthly rents and multiplying them by 12 in order to annualize them: Adjusted for rent, your data science salary goes a lot further in Seattle versus other tech hubs. And this is before we account for the fact that you pay lower taxes (no state income tax remember?) as well. So if you don‚Äôt mind the rain, consider dropping a resume or two with Amazon, Microsoft, and Starbucks. Finally, let‚Äôs check how the tech vs. no tech salary disparity looks across these regions (2018‚Äì19 salaries only). Seattle "trendy" tech companies on average pay more as well, just like the Bay Area (Silicon Valley). The disparity in New York is especially large ‚Äì my best guess is that non-tech NYC firms pay large annual bonuses, which would not show up in the H1B salary data. Before we call it a day, let‚Äôs recap some of the key findings from our data: Hopefully this was insightful and useful to you. Cheers! Read Part 1 of This Story Here: How Much Do Data Scientists Make? More Data Science and Analytics Related Posts By Me: What Do Data Scientists Do? Title: Uncomputable Numbers
Subtitle: The Turing Essays
Author: J√∏rgen Veisdal
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Member-only story J√∏rgen Veisdal Follow Cantor‚Äôs Paradise -- 10 Share We all remember learning that the decimals of pi are infinite in number, 3.14159265359‚Ä¶ Some of us even recall learning that you can approximate upper and lower bounds on the value of pi to as high of a degree as you want by measuring the sides of polygons. As the number of sides of the polygons approach infinity and the length of their sides approach zero, your approximation gets closer. Archimedes (c. 287- 212) invented this early ‚Äòpolygonal algorithm‚Äô, which dominated for over 1000 years as the most efficient way of computing pi to any desired precision. The very primitive and geometric algorithmic function serves the purpose of estimating a real number, pi, whose value must be computed, as it is not expressible as a rational number (fraction/ratio). The modern study of computability began around 1900 with the announcement of Hilbert‚Äôs ‚Äòfinitist‚Äô program to axiomatize the foundations of mathematics. This after Hilbert himself had showed in 1899 that the consistency of geometry reduced to that of the real numbers, which in turn, reduced to the arithmetic results of Dedekind (Soare, 2013). Hilbert‚Äôs program (1904), hence, was established to try to similarly exploit the finiteness of mathematical proofs to show that contradictions‚Ä¶ -- -- 10 Medium‚Äôs #1 Math Publication Editor-in-Chief at Cantor‚Äôs Paradise. Title: Announcing the Upworthy Research Archive
Subtitle: Help us advance human understanding by studying this massive dataset of headline A/B tests
Author: J. Nathan Matias
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in J. Nathan Matias Follow -- 1 Listen Share Remember these headlines? 2014 was the year that the digital media company Upworthy ‚Äúbroke the internet‚Äù in the words of cofounder Peter Koechley. By publishing positive, progressive news stories and optimizing them with A/B testing, Upworthy came to dominate online attention. What can we learn from all those A/B tests? Today, Good & Upworthy and our team of J. Nathan Matias (Cornell), Kevin Munger (Penn State), and Marianne Aubin Le Quere (Cornell) are announcing The Upworthy Research Archive, a dataset of 32,487 A/B tests conducted by Upworthy from January 2013 to April 2015. When released, we believe it will be the largest collection of randomized behavioral studies available for research and educational purposes. We believe Upworthy‚Äôs A/B tests can help us advance knowledge in many fields, including communication, political science, psychology, statistics, and computer science If you would like to do research with this dataset, we want to hear from you! Please complete this short form by November 30, 2019! Upworthy saw awesome, meaningful, and visual content as their sweet spot Upworthy‚Äôs traffic peaked in November 2013 when the company reached more people than the New York Times. In response, Facebook created one of its first widely-publicized algorithmic policies in 2014. Facebook‚Äôs algorithm attempts to re-balance the NewsFeed significantly affected Upworthy and set the stage for the company‚Äôs later algorithmic policies. Ever since, the quest for virality has been an adversarial competition between publishers and platforms. In 2017, Upworthy merged with Good Worldwide. Upworthy conducted its A/B tests on its own website, randomly varying different ‚Äúpackages‚Äù for a single story‚Äì a headline, subhead, social media summary, and thumbnail. While we‚Äôre still verifying the data, we can confirm that each A/B test in the archive will include: The whole dataset includes 32,487 valid deployed tests, including 150,817 total tested packages. We also have access to Upworthy‚Äôs Google Analytics data for this time period, allowing us to record average estimated demographic information about website viewers over time. We‚Äôre still investigating the best way to do this. We live in a society where companies and political campaigns test and influence the behavior of millions of people every day. Used wisely, these capabilities could advance human understanding and guide decisions for flourishing democracies. We also need to better understand this power to protect society from its misuses. Upworthy‚Äôs A/B tests can help us advance knowledge in many fields, including: This dataset will also support classes like Nathan‚Äôs class on The Design and Governance of Field Experiments, where students learn how to do experiments and think about ways to govern this kind of behavioral power. The Upworthy Research Archive will also help level the playing field for research and teaching about online behavior. Right now, only a few academic researchers can negotiate access to data from the thousands of A/B tests that companies conduct every year. Students never have a chance to get hands-on experience with this kind of knowledge. Our dataset will change that. Through an agreement been Good and Cornell University, we have been granted complete permission to publish the dataset openly. We‚Äôre still reviewing and cleaning the dataset, which will only include aggregate results and will not include any identifiable information about individuals. We also expect to have general demographic information about the kind of people who were viewing Upworthy during a given study. We plan to release the data in stages to increase the credibility of the initial scientific discoveries. Given a large enough dataset, it‚Äôs easy to fish for answers, even with good intentions. Inspired by lessons from the Fragile Families Challenge and the Psychological Science Accelerator, we are planning a multi-stage process for: To set up that process we need academics and educators to tell us what you would do with this data. Once we know what people from different fields want to do with the dataset, we will be able to design a process to ensure the broadest high quality contribution to knowledge from the Upworthy Archive. For more details, you can see our announcement slides and the short paper we shared at the MIT Conference on Digital Experimentation in November 2019. If you would like to work with this dataset, please complete this short form by November 30, 2019. If you have questions, consider reaching out to Nathan, Kevin, and Marianne on Twitter at @natematias, @kmmunger, and @marianneaubin to keep the conversation broad and open. We will also accept emails at nathan.matias@cornell.edu and <kmm7999@psu.edu>. Some rights reserved  -- -- 1 Citizen social science to improve digital life & hold tech accountable. Assistant Prof, Cornell. citizensandtech.org Prev: Princeton, MIT. Guatemalan-American Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Relevance of Soraix with Crypto Valley Switzerland
Subtitle: Written by Iman muda
Author: Iman muda
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Iman muda Follow -- Listen Share Each platform must have their respective principles which absolutely can not be changed by anyone. Because by implementing the principle consistently, this will indirectly bring more value in the eyes of the community. There are various kinds of platform principles that exist in this world. Did you know there is a platform that anonymizes all user accounts to process transactions. Where in general the current use of anonymous accounts to conduct financial activities is highly anticipated and avoided by other platforms, of course this is done to prevent undesirable things. However, with a strong determination and principles that the platform can carry out transaction activities safely and smoothly. This is because the platform always maintains its credibility and integrity for its loyal users. Did you know that currently Soraix is ‚Äã‚Äãalso doing the same thing but with a different principle. Currently Soraix is ‚Äã‚Äãpromoting the principle of equality in carrying out a number of buying and selling processes or exchanges. We can analogize this principle with a ratio of 1: 1, where 1 SRX can buy 1 equity token, even though the equity token has a much higher price than the SRX token price. For example SRX tokens have a value of $ 40, but can buy equity tokens that have a value of $ 100. This will certainly apply consistently because Soraix does have upheld the principle of equality. Nowadays technology can influence a person‚Äôs lifestyle from various sides, for example in fashion or investment. In terms of profitable investments, currently a number of companies are planning to adopt Blockchain technology. One way is to issue a number of equity tokens with a stable market value. This is done because over the years, the team of experts is increasingly convinced that Blockchain technology can answer various economic challenges going forward. It is the same as Soraix which receives a company‚Äôs equity token and trades it with its SRX token. It is not a taboo anymore if the Blockchain technology activists have now looked at Switzerland as a very potential and safe market. Of all the developed countries in the world, Switzerland was chosen as the country with the safest banking operating system in the world, which is very protective of the privacy data of its customers. Therefore, even though some Blockchain platforms are indeed vulnerable to various types of attacks. Title: The unusual place I found God
Subtitle: Written by Ravijot Singh Narang
Author: Ravijot Singh Narang
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Ravijot Singh Narang Follow -- Listen Share Have you ever been asked to perform some religious rituals? Or do you visit religious temples on important days of your life? Have you ever been curious as to why you have been asked to do this? Yes? Hang tight with me then. Growing up in a moderately religious Sikh family, I was constantly asked to visit Sikh temples or perform some religious rituals for some reason that I could never understand. Have you ever questioned the idea of God or the practices that have been put upon by moderately or extremely religious families? (Okay, I am not an atheist and won‚Äôt be asking you to become one by end of this article.) If you have questioned the presence of God or have found him or her somewhere other than where I found, please let me know in the comments section. Yes, my questions about the presence of God got affirmed as I was blessed to witness the divine presence, but not in the places where I was conditioned to look at(temples, churches, etc.) and I didn‚Äôt even ask any religious leader or saint to make me witness the divine through some rituals or mantras. I found the divine and its potential in the unlikeliest of place, where I probably never looked or maybe didn‚Äôt even think that it existed. My search for the divine was very similar to the drunken man in the below story: A police officer sees a drunken man intently searching the ground near a lamppost and asks him the goal of his quest. The inebriate replies that he is looking for his car keys, and the officer helps for a few minutes without success then he asks whether the man is certain that he dropped the keys near the lamppost. ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù is the reply, ‚ÄúI lost the keys somewhere across the street.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy look here?‚Äù asks the surprised and irritated officer. ‚ÄúThe light is much better here,‚Äù the intoxicated man responds with aplomb. Growing up in our culturescape we are sold the idea to look for the keys in the area with most light ‚Äî we spend years asking other people our doubts, reading books, visiting temples, etc. to find answers or the divinity, and then get upset when we don‚Äôt find it in the area which had the most light. While the keys to everything were always WITHIN. The divine that I was looking for in books, temples, oceans, etc. is always within me and in everyone. It is not an esoteric quality that only a few chosen ones will get to experience. If you want to experience it within yourself, observe within to the small hunches that ask you to alleviate the pain of some other being or animal. Observe the strong desire that you experience when you see some cruelty happening to any animal or a person, and you want to help or get those beings out of that pain. Or it can be a cause like ensuring people have safe data or electricity at home. These small hunches are where I found the divinity, the more I feed these hunches, the more the divine presence expand in my life. However, our culturescape gives a totally different view of reality. In our childhood, we are programmed with a kind of a self-image that propels us to always look outside or in other so-called by culture successful people for everything. This poor self-image unconsciously always makes us believe less in ourselves and more in others because when we see someone with social proof or with authority our mind unconsciously accepts them as the one with answers and we never search for the divine and answers within us. And from the kind of culture, I come from, God is the ultimate authority figure with an unbelievable amount of social proof. -- -- Founder @ Acify Technologies. Past: Product, Data Science & Creativity: @meQuilibrium, @Wayfair, @Personify, @Musigma. Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: 5 ways to draw consumers to your business
Subtitle: Written by MAZ
Author: MAZ
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in MAZ Follow -- Listen Share Tech There are several potential consequences of living in a technology-based world. In fact, some would argue that these effects are already appearing. That being said, people often fail to take into consideration how the world got to where it is. You guessed it, we as humans have not only allowed it to happen, but we have driven digitalization to where we see and feel the effects of it today. Sure, there are certain things to be wary of. But, it is also important to acknowledge all that technology can do for us. In terms of workplace efficiency, publicity, and communicative strategy, there is much to be gained from it. The use of technology has drastically altered how we go about our daily routines: our educations, professions, and even our personal lives now revolve around online networking, social media addictions, Netflix binges, and our heightened reliance on digital connection for human interaction. There is a way to balance our wariness with technology with its significant benefits, especially for marketers. Here are some of the top ways to use technology to attract consumers to your business: Linkedin Business Strategy Linkedin is one of the best ways for working professionals to connect with friends, coworkers, potential employers, and employees, and share their takes on trending news stories. What is highly undermined is its ability to help businesses gain traction and reach new audiences. You can track business analytics, including page visitors, update highlights, and followership growth. Use Linkedin to more frequently engage your audiences and to reach new potential customers. Content Marketing Content marketing refers to the creation and distribution of content through online platforms. This may include but is not limited to news, articles, videos, and photos to be shared on social networks including Linkedin, YouTube, Facebook, or Instagram. Developing and maintaining a consistent but updated content marketing strategy is crucial in improving the online presence of your business. It is more necessary than ever to be active on various social media platforms, showing consumers why your product will make their life better. Although it is often time-consuming and difficult to manage frequent posting on various platforms, it increases engagement and expands the potential consumer base drastically. Sure, people occasionally find ads to be irritating or distracting. But, ads are inevitable and consumers expect to see them online. Plus, in a world where people are now often able to get past a paywall for free by agreeing to see ads, having your product presented to people is a solid way to gain traction and new clicks to your website. Despite the occasional feelings of annoyance amongst people online, the successful results of advertisements for different companies and products are undeniable. After all, 93% of marketers use Facebook advertising regularly , and Instagram is said to be rapidly catching up; so it is safe to say that their ads are producing some sort of success. Web Design It is imperative that you make your website stand out. In this day and age, consumers are visiting countless websites on a daily basis. In order to truly grasp the attention of new viewers and make your site stand out, your web design should be attention-grabbing. Not only should it attract new visitors, but it should also make people want to stay and click around, exploring the intricacies of your product. Its design should be simple and easy to navigate while having enough layers to show potential consumers all that your product can do for them. Pragmatics are important, don‚Äôt get me wrong. But, remember that technology can easily strip a business of its personality and character. The person who is typing a company update to the blog might be full of excitement and joy, but that doesn‚Äôt mean that this is relayed into the post without a conscious effort. Authenticity and ethics are becoming very important in consumer choices; for example, if a company has a reputation for using product creation methods that harm animals in the process, many consumers will be turned away prior to even viewing the product. Of course, it is important to be ethical. Currently, however, it is even more important to elaborate on and advertise your ethical practices in order to increase consumer confidence and brand likability. Developing and maintaining a digital personality is extremely important when technology can often feel robotic and cold. Undoubtedly, there are many benefits to be had from living with and around technology. In many ways, it makes running a business much easier and more efficient. That being said, it is only beneficial if you are able to remain competitive with other companies in your industry. In this day and age, that is done by being technologically sound and innovative. If you use the 5 tips above while running your business, you will be right on your way to rapidly drawing new consumers and clients to your product. Originally published at https://www.mazsystems.com on July 12, 2019. -- -- The Content Logistics Company. Learn how MAZ can solve your content logistics problem at http://mazsystems.com Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: iPads in Bathroom Stalls: How to Create a Community
Subtitle: Written by Michelle Tan
Author: Michelle Tan
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Michelle Tan Follow -- Listen Share ‚ÄúSometimes the only person you can talk to about it is a few hundred strangers who may never know what you‚Äôre going through in real life.‚Äù I work for a company that prides itself in creating communities among strangers, yet nothing has taught me more about this topic than these iPads in bathroom stalls. As part of WeWork‚Äôs flagship design, in the bathrooms of our offices, there are three enclosed tablets in each bathroom stall. Normally, they would play some vintage video games or surfing footages, as a form of electronic art display. Very quickly, people figured out they are iPads, and you would see them showing their lock screens, awkwardly sitting on a bathroom stall wall. A few weeks in, I went into a bathroom stall, only to find the ‚ÄúNotes‚Äù App on, and someone had written a ‚ÄúHello‚Äù there. Then a conversation followed on: ‚ÄúThis is weird, I can think of three people on my team that would need iPads.‚Äù ‚Äú Happy new year!!! It‚Äôs going to be a great one!!!‚Äù ‚ÄúLol‚Äù ‚ÄúEwwwwe‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure about this‚Äù ‚ÄúBe the change you want to see in the world :)‚Äù Very quickly, the conversations evolved from random doodle board notes to something else. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs a crazy goal you have that you‚Äôre scared to start?‚Äù ‚ÄúBreak up with my boyfriend lol‚Äù ‚ÄúYASSSSSS‚Äù ‚ÄúDO ITTTTTTT‚Äù ‚ÄúDo it, girl. Happiness is key!!!‚Äù ‚ÄúNever be afraid of breaking up! It will feel so good after the awkward conversation.‚Äù Woah, this became real very quickly. ‚ÄúBroke up with husband recently‚Ä¶idk for me when I‚Äôm done there is no going back!‚Äù ‚ÄúWe deserve the bestÔ∏è‚Äù ‚ÄúTo the person who broke up with their husband, I am in a similar position and know your pain. No matter what the specific circumstances may be; I know you are so strong. Sometimes the only person you can talk to about it is a few hundred strangers who may never know what you‚Äôre going through in real life.‚Äù ‚Äúthank you! It can be so isolating for sure. It helps to hear words of support‚Ä¶even from a random bathroom stranger! I hope everyone has a great weekend. I‚Äôll be boxing his stuff up and taking it to storage!‚Äù I followed the daily updates of these women‚Äôs lives with curiosity and amazement. ‚ÄúMarried women ‚Äî is marriage what you thought it would be?‚Äù ‚ÄúLived with ex fianc√© for a year before my now husband and realized I couldn‚Äôt live with him. He just had the worst home habits that got worse the more I saw. FF to my husband and we were together for five years and lived together. We knew it would work then so we had a kid. That worked out so we then got married. Not saying people shouldnt work to make it what they want, but growing together and seeing you‚Äôre on the same path before committing to marriage can save the divorce issue. Marriage def doesn‚Äôt fix things that were wrong before.‚Äù ‚ÄúMarriage is awesome and fun for a few minutes. Making a commitment that the world can see is exciting but I think that if you two are actually in it for the right reasons then it should be more exciting for the two of you to be together as a team in your own way than to need to prove it to others. Divorce is as traumatizing as they say and 10x worse than getting married is fun. Commit but just keep the government out of it! It takes 6 months to get divorced in California!‚Äù More women responded with their thoughts on marriage and divorce. Someone asked if a wedding is necessary, to which other women also wrote lengthy paragraphs in response. This bathroom stall iPad has become a hidden treasure that never fails to bring me a warm feeling when I stop by. I secretly rejoiced in participating in this exclusive bathroom stall community. Among the 200 or so people sitting on this floor, there is someone sharing her deepest secrets and someone that is listening. I couldn‚Äôt find a way to share this in front of all the male coworkers without seeming inappropriate. When I finally had a chance to bring it up at a women‚Äôs event, everyone was equally amazed. At the same time, a question emerged in my mind: What does it take to create a community? Back in 1986, psychologists McMillan and Chavis proposed a theory that outlines the four key components of a community: This theory explains the bathroom stall community phenomenon quite well. There are five attributes to membership: boundaries, emotional safety, a sense of belonging and identification, personal investment, and a common symbol system. The bathroom stalls satisfy three of the five: Boundaries: Only female employees on this floor could access this bathroom stall, providing an exclusive environment. Emotional safety: The bathroom stalls provide the privacy and iPads provide the anonymity necessary to make people feel safe to share their feelings and emotions. Sense of belonging and identification: As employees of the same company, people have similar backgrounds and experiences and as a result can expect to be accepted. 2. Influence Members of the bathroom stall community write words of encouragement and share their own life experiences with other women, and have influence over their thoughts and understandings of the events they are going through. The ability to help others motivates women to write these ‚Äúpersonal essays‚Äù on the iPads. 3. Integration and Fulfillment of Needs The bathroom stall fulfills the women‚Äôs emotional needs to express themselves and get advice on events that they are going through in life. When I spoke with a coworker that‚Äôs about to get married in a few months about the paragraphs someone had written on marriage, she became intrigued and wanted to check it out. On the other hand, women who provide advice are rewarded by the gratefulness of other women and the feeling of being valued. 4. Shared Emotional Connection Among the many elements that encourage shared emotional connection in McMillan & Chavis‚Äôs theory, the most relevant one is the contact hypothesis. A bathroom stall is a place that everyone has to visit on a daily basis, and therefore, the frequency of interactions allow the women to develop a sense of emotional connection with each other. The sense of community is not a hard science, but as all of these conditions are met, a group of anonymous strangers comes together with a shared purpose, and a community is born. Historically, women have sought solidarity in each other in different environments. Women in feudal China who were restricted from outside activities, had bound feet and dedicated their lives to caring for their families had a strong supporting network among their siblings, mothers, daughters, and maids. That network is what provided them with support and strengths in a dark period of women‚Äôs history. The Seneca Falls Convention was only possible because a community of women (and men) came together and found their voice in speaking out about women‚Äôs rights. The power of communities could have an impact as small as a word of encouragement for a woman going through a breakup, or as big as starting a movement. In today‚Äôs world, online communities could have even wider influences for its ability to reach millions of people instantly. Humans of New York, Pantsuit Unions, and Subtle Asian Traits are some great examples. As we become more conscious of the power of communities, I hope to see more communities that empower us, more communities of women carrying each other, and more online communities using technology to connect instead of divide us, and sometimes, it‚Äôs really simple: Communities are born - one bathroom stall iPad at a time. -- -- Founder, startup operator Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: What is Bitcoin? A comprehensive report on Bitcoin Features and Market Assessment
Subtitle: Introduction
Author: Latest In Crypto
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Latest In Crypto Follow -- Listen Share Report word count: 5095 words Most people have heard of Bitcoin and cryptocurrency, but not many people truly understand it as it is a complicated and groundbreaking innovation that explores issues of economy, history, politics, technology, and finance. Bitcoin has a 10+ year history as the most resilient cryptocurrency, leading this ecosystem with the most adoption and development across its lifetime. This guide will provide you with the fundamental knowledge about what Bitcoin is and does, along with information and analysis on major developments and events to come in the Bitcoin ecosystem. This report also assesses Bitcoin‚Äôs fundamentals and history of success, along with an analysis of its market position and identification & assessment of long-term value and potential. Buy Bitcoin This article last updated Nov 19 Jump to Page Contents Introduction Who created Bitcoin? Transactional properties Bitcoin Token Economics Proof-of-Work Consensus Development Lightning Network Atomic Swaps SegWit Why is Bitcoin important? Established success Path to the future Market Opportunities Threats to Bitcoin Critical threats Obstacles to Mass Adoption Conclusion Bitcoin, also known by the ticker BTC, was originally created in 2008 to act as an alternative, decentralized payment method that allows users to be in charge of their own money. It envisions a monetary system that eliminates intermediaries, interest fees and other banking fees, and allows for transparent, verifiable, and secure digital transactions. The Bitcoin open-source protocol utilizes blockchain distributed network technology that maintains a public ledger of balances with each user that records all transactions on the network. This system allows for funds to be created and held electronically and allows for these digital payments to be stored and sent securely between users without passing through an intermediary such as a bank or payment gateway. What is a blockchain? Find out more here Verification of these transactions is based on utilizing computational power to solve cryptographic problems, and provides the Bitcoin network with a decentralized method of ensuring security and verification of transactions, and also the immutability of its transactions. This process ensures the integrity of Bitcoin transactions and is known as ‚Äúmining‚Äù Bitcoin, providing the ‚Äúminer‚Äù with rewards in Bitcoin. This ‚Äúmining‚Äù process is how Bitcoins are created and released into the market in a transparent way, with the Bitcoin protocol being fixed with a 21 million lifetime total Bitcoin supply. It is also the method to solving the ‚Äúdouble-spending‚Äù problem for digital currency using a peer-to-peer network, as a particular token cannot be spent more than once since it has to be verified by miners. More information on this mining process and the Proof-of-Work consensus below. A user gains access to their Bitcoin funds by a private key that is mathematically related to the Bitcoin addresses generated for a wallet, and this allows Bitcoins to be spent and transacted. Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are stored in wallets which secure your private keys, and these can come in the form of software mobile or desktop wallets, or hardware wallets. Anyone who has access to the private keys can control your funds so it is imperative that this is kept secret and secure. For more information on which wallet to use and why, please see our Cryptocurrency Wallet Guide Who created Bitcoin? Bitcoin was created by a pseudonymous software developer by the name of Satoshi Nakamoto, who proposed Bitcoin in a whitepaper on 31st Oct 2008. The code was released January 3, 2009 and the first Bitcoins appeared. To this day the identity of Satoshi Nakamoto is still unknown, and may very well be a group of developers rather than an individual. Nakamoto was active in the development of Bitcoin up until December 2010. The characteristics below are the main proponents to why Bitcoin has seen success as a means of exchange. Decentralization The blockchain distributed ledger technology allows for Bitcion to be decentralized with no single point of failure, making it more democratic and resilient. No single individual or corporation controls the bitcoin network, but each individual has the opportunity to become a processor of the network, further contributing to its security and integrity of the network. The development of the Bitcoin Core code is also open-source and committed code is verified by experienced developers. Limited Supply Bitcoin has a fixed lifetime supply of 21 million Bitcoin, being mined at a diminishing rate (mining rate being halved approximately every 4 years) until the maximum of 21 million has been reached. As of Sep 2019 18 million Bitcoin have been mined into existence. This transparent system allows for a reliable and mathematical money supply, as well as preventing the money printing flaw of traditional fiat currencies which leads to consistent inflation and long term devaluation. Pseudonymity Neither transactions nor accounts on the Bitcoin blockchain are connected to real-world identities or any personal information, however in practice each wallet address and historical blockchain transaction can be used to identify and track users. This allows for digital accountability of transactions and a permanent paper trail for regulation, but the analysis of the transaction flow will still be disconnected from the real world identity of users. Immutability The Bitcoin protocol provides an immutable ledger, so all transactions and records of transactions cannot be tampered with or reversed. This property is essential for a digital currency as it provides validation for transactions and values. Divisibility The Bitcoin currency can be divided up or tokenized into one hundred millionth of a Bitcoin (0.00000001 BTC) ‚Äî this denomination is also called one ‚Äòsatoshi‚Äô. This divisibility allows easier long-term use of the cryptocurrency, and allows for micro-transactions and precise values. Fast Global Transactions The Bitcoin system spans a global network of users and devices and therefore ignores our inherent transaction limitations with government owned fiat currencies. Bitcoin transactions are propagated nearly instantly in the network and confirmed in a few minutes regardless of user locations. Permission-less No permission is required to become part of and contribute to the Bitcoin blockchain network, which is a core property contributing to the decentralized public characteristics of Bitcoin. The Bitcoin system also allows for users to be in charge of their own money, with no third party or intermediary required to send or receive Bitcoins. From a supply perspective Bitcoin has a lifetime limit of 21 million total Bitcoins, and as at Sep 2019 18 million Bitcoins have been mined and released into the network. Inflation rate is currently at ~3.9% (Oct 19). It is estimated that 30% of all mined Bitcoins have been lost forever, as people have lost access to the private keys to access their Bitcoin. In addition to this, Satoshi Nakamoto is estimated to own roughly 600,000‚Äì1,000,000 BTC that have never been moved from their original wallet. Therefore Bitcoin is long-term inherently a deflationary currency. Transaction fees on the Bitcoin network average around $3.53 USD with an average confirmation time of 10.08 minutes (As Nov 19). There are several key technological breakthroughs that are in development at the moment (more information on SegWit, Lightning Network, or Atomic Swaps below) that will contribute to decreasing transaction confirmation times and fees. The Proof-of-Work consensus algorithm, the algorithm behind the Bitcoin ‚Äúmining‚Äù process, is the characteristic of the Bitcoin network that allows for secure, tamper-resistant consensus of transactions and blockchain ledgers. A pending transaction (or block) is chronologically added to the chain in a queue, and individual miners compete with each other using computational power to solve the cryptographic problems associated with the block and transaction. This problem is difficult to solve but easy to verify, and the answer is called a ‚Äúhash‚Äù. A finalized transaction has its block removed from this chain along with the exchange of funds and a reward for the miner ‚Äî providing a creative way to issue the currency and also an incentive for people to mine. For mining rewards a miner is issued a 12.5 BTC reward for each block mined, the rate of which halves every 210,000 blocks (approximately every four years). The next halving is expected during May 2020 and will cut the block mining reward to 6.25 BTC. The Bitcoin code is open-source and therefore any developer can contribute, although the commits are reviewed by experienced developers. There are currently over 100 volunteer contributors on Bitcoin GitHub with over 30 commits a week written in C++. Along with that, there is a vast ecosystem of solutions being developed that will add functionality and usability to Bitcoin, with the main blockchain improvements being: Lightning Network Lightning Network is a layer 2 protocol in development that will potentially vastly improve the blockchain payment process, aiming to increase transaction speeds to near-instant and decrease fees to almost non-existent, allowing Bitcoin to be exponentially more scalable and reducing the number of transactions that need to be stored on the blockchain. The Lightning Network will work by having funds held in smart contract ‚Äúpayment channels‚Äù between two users so transactions can be processed outside of the main blockchain. Only the final state of the transaction is broadcast to the Bitcoin network. This will enable users to create payment channels between any two parties on the 2nd Lightning Network layer, and allow additional security and anonymity as transactions are done on the 2nd layer. This technology has only been launched in 2018 for Bitcoin and faces issues with mainstream adoption, but with it being developed for other cryptocurrencies like Stellar (XLM), Litecoin (LTC), Zcash (ZEC), Ethereum (ETH), and Ripple (XRP) it will be growing rapidly in usage. The implementation of Lightning Network is also essential to pave the way for cross-chain Atomic Swaps that may lead to truly decentralized exchanges and inter-operability between crypto assets. Atomic Swaps Atomic Swaps, also known as cross-chain trading, is an innovation in development that will allow users to trade directly with one another wallet-to-wallet, eliminating the need for a third party service like a cryptocurrency exchange. Parties will have full ownership and control of their private keys throughout this whole process, and as the name suggests, atomic swaps can be executed between separate blockchains and coins. They can also be executed in 2nd Layer off-chain channels connected to the main blockchain such as Lightning Network. This allows for inter-operability between crypto assets as users can swap easily between each other across the cryptocurrency ecosystem, and also allows for the potential of fee-less decentralized exchanges that provides atomic swap services to users. This technology in late 2019 is still very early on, so functionality and execution still need to be worked on for mainstream adoption. Also there are currently a very low number of compatible wallets and exchanges as they need to have the correct hash algorithm to take part in atomic swaps. SegWit SegWit (short for segregated witness) is a protocol upgrade which aims to address Bitcoin‚Äôs scalability problem by changing the way data is stored. The maximum block size in the main Bitcoin protocol is 1MB which restricts the number of transactions to 7 transactions per second, which will severely limit the potential of Bitcoin for high volume mainstream adoption. The SegWit upgrade strips out the signature data from the transaction to allow a greater number of transactions in Bitcoin‚Äôs blocks from lighter transactions. Wallets still need to opt in for SegWit support and exchanges/wallet providers still need to roll out support for SegWit, so this upgrade still has a long way in terms of adoption. The SegWit protocol change also allowed for the development of 2nd layer protocols such as Lightning Network by fixing the transaction malleability flaw that allowed people to modify the transaction details but not the content. In this section i will try to explain the potential for Bitcoin and analyse the growth factors that will be the main reasons why Bitcoin will be successful moving forward. Established success Bitcoin has enjoyed consistent exponential long-term growth in trading price from its inception in late 2008 driven by fundamental strengths of the Bitcoin protocol as well as market and macro-economic trends. It is easy to purchase and to hold as an investment and provides the ability to transfer funds across borders cheaply and efficiently. Bitcoin has survived 10+ years without having any compromise in its core software lines, and has a long record of resilience against various obstacles. In spite of these obstacles Bitcoin has sustained consistent strength with an average of 235% annual return and the ecosystem has improved vastly on its weaknesses, remaining as the perennial number one cryptocurrency throughout its lifetime. It now maintains its position as the most decentralized and least volatile cryptocurrency, and has the clearest use case and path to success in the crypto ecosystem. Some major obstacles that Bitcoin has overcome or is currently enduring below: Bitcoin has consistently grown in network transaction volume regardless of market price, with transaction volume now surpassing PayPal and approaching MasterCard volume, which is a great indicator of its use and growing adoption. Bitcoin‚Äôs momentous growth has sparked disruption in strategic business and methodology for multiple industries: Its success so far can be attributed to a variety of factors, some of which are: Path to the future Bitcoin and the entire cryptocurrency ecosystem is poised to continue its unprecedented growth, as the factors that have led to its success are growing faster than ever before. Predicting the future is never clear, but there are a few clear variables and growth factors that should contribute to future success: Market Opportunities Whilst there are many factors that seem to show a very positive and inspiring future for Bitcoin, it is important to understand the risks and threats to create your own informed decision about Bitcoin‚Äôs future. We aim to cover as many threats as possible below and their what their potential is to impact Bitcoin‚Äôs success. Critical threats These are the major threats to the overall success and operation of Bitcoin, which have the potential to devastate to the long-term success of Bitcoin and the overall cryptocurrency industry. These threats are widely known and focused on by the developers and entrepreneurs in the Bitcoin community. 51% attack A 51% attack, also known as a majority attack, is a situation where a miner or group of miners controls more than 50% of the network‚Äôs mining hashrate and would therefore be able to gain control of the network. This would include monopolizing the generation and processing of new blocks to be able to prevent new transactions from gaining confirmations, and the ability to double-spend coins. However a 51% attack would still be limited in its exposure in the network, as it cannot reverse confirmed transactions, create new coins, or take funds from any addresses. A 51% attack would also require significant expenditure and little financial returns for the miners controlling the majority of mining power, There is a geographical concentration of mining farms in China due to their cheap labor costs and low electricity rates. There is also currently a centralization of mining power, as Bitcoin‚Äôs mining is centralized from its manufacturing and its consumers. Bitmain, the largest manufacturer of mining equipment, owns up to 75% of the market, and also controls a significant amount of network hashrate through several mining pools. However this would be a suicidal business move from Bitmain, as a 51% attack could compromise the Bitcoin network and lead to a sharp downturn in the whole Bitcoin ecosystem, from Bitcoin mining to the demand for Bitcoin mining equipment. Technical Vulnerability A possible critical flaw to Bitcoin would be the existence of a technical developer flaw in the coding, as a flaw could be taken advantage of to compromise the network by affecting the money supply, double-spending coins, or compromising past or pending transactions. For example, there was a threatening bug found Sep 2018 that could have been exploited to create new Bitcoins and inflate the total supply. This would have shaken the trust of the entire network, and was rapidly fixed. ‚ÄúIn order to encourage rapid upgrades, the decision was made to immediately patch and disclose the less serious denial of service vulnerability, concurrently with reaching out to miners, businesses and other affected systems, while delaying publication of the full issue to give time for systems to upgrade.‚Äù Consensus Flaw Bitcoin‚Äôs Proof-of-Work (PoW) consensus protocol is critical to the verification and security of transactions on the blockchain, however it is relatively inefficient as all the nodes in the blockchain must carry the same records and agree. There is potential for an alternate system or cryptocurrency with a more efficient or superior consensus algorithm (like Proof-of-Stake). However the PoW process is essential towards Bitcoin‚Äôs resilience and decentralized nature, as it is key to imposing limits on actions in the network to protect against DoS attacks, and doesn‚Äôt allow for users with money to be in charge of making decisions for the network Competing Technology It is very possible that a future competing technology overtakes Bitcoin, potentially due to easier use or stronger fundamental characteristics and functionality. It‚Äôs impossible to predict this scenario, but there is an opening for a competing cryptocurrency with future additional utility or a database technology to provide distributed database utility at a potentially lower price or easier adoption. However any additional features or utilities invented in the future can potentially be coded into Bitcoin or an additional layer protocol, with most of the ecosystem‚Äôs developer focus currently on Bitcoin and the Bitcoin network. Obstacles to Mass Adoption Whilst the below variables are not critical to the overall operation of Bitcoin, they have the potential to greatly impact the market sentiment towards Bitcoin and its overall influence and adoption. Security & Scams Although there has been no compromise of the core software lines of Bitcoin, there have been multiple major security breaches in the wider ecosystem including hacks on exchanges, ponzi schemes, and proliferation of scams (specific major examples have been covered earlier in the article). With the complexity in the cryptocurrency ecosystem, this will be a major obstacle to mainstream adoption, but security and education is a focus of developers and entrepreneurs and this can only get better in the future. Users must ensure they are knowledgeable and employ the best security practices, including storing their cryptocurrencies in the most security wallets and using reputable exchanges. To find out more about which wallet you should use, please read our Cryptocurrency Wallet Guide. To find out more about which exchange you should use, please read our Cryptocurrency Exchange Guide. Government regulation As Bitcoin draws monetary power and influence away from government regulated fiat currencies, there is major incentive for governments to take an opposing stance to Bitcoin to protect their own assets. It is likely that major governments imposing regulation and banning on-ramps or off-ramps for Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies would have a short-term negative impact on the market price. However Bitcoin is inherently built to be resilient to be resilient to government intervention so would grow a stronger more decentralized community around it. There have been multiple attempts at regulating and banning Bitcoin already, such as Bangladesh, Nepal, and Kyrgyzstan deeming digital asset transactions as illegal, as well as all Chinese trading platforms effectively banned from Sep 2017. Bitcoin has only felt short-term price implications from these regulations, and they have not affected the long-term outlook or growth trend. Illegal Activity For most of Bitcoin‚Äôs life, its use has been linked to fraudulent use and criminal activity by the media and mainstream public. It is thought that Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies had the anonymity and ability to circumvent governments and regulations to allow the empowerment of criminal activity. The most famous example of this was the creation of Silk Road in 2011, the first online drug marketplace which used Bitcoin as a primary payment method. However, the permanence of the Bitcoin blockchain actually allows for transactions to be clearly and transparently tracked between addresses, and with increasing regulation for the on-ramps for cryptocurrency (Know-Your-Customer and Anti-Money-Laundering identity verification regulations), it is easier than ever before to track criminal activity through the blockchain. Bitcoin‚Äôs blockchain trail has recently been essential to track a child pornography server in the largest takedown of its kind. Also whilst it is true that Bitcoin is used for ~95% of cyber crime, the volume of this is small compared to the volume of illicit activity through traditional financial services and fiat currencies. The blockchain trail is actually much better for tracking and keeping individuals accountable for criminal activity, as traditional paper cash transactions can potentially be impossible to trace. High volatility Consistent high price volatility will be a major obstacle to mainstream adoption and to Bitcoin being a reliable store of value, as it will require a certain appetite for risk that many people will not want to be involved in. Volatility is currently at a 60 day estimate of 2.79%. We are still very early in the bitcoin journey and higher levels of adoption would lead to lower variance in market sentiment and lower volatility in price overall. Also there are mechanisms in the market to reduce volatility and difference in pricing between geographical markets, including Complexity The introduction of Bitcoin and the cryptocurrency ecosystem comes with a whole industry of new terminology and complicated systems and processes, and the complexity of Bitcoin and the cryptocurrency industry has been difficult for the mainstream public to understand and embrace. The key to solving this issue will be for developers to minimize the barriers of entry for new users, with minimal disruption to their transaction processes and minimal knowledge required to utilize the new technology. Optimally the blockchain technology will be on the back-end of development, with interfaces developed so that mainstream users do not even know that they are using cryptocurrency tokens for transactions. Hoarding Speculation on higher future prices does encourage the hoarding of Bitcoin rather than the spending, which limits Bitcoin‚Äôs ability to serve as a medium of exchange. Nevertheless this is an indirect downside of a highly appreciating asset which is preferable to fiat currencies or other stores of wealth which are consistently debased over time. Also Bitcoin has evolved to also act as a store of value due to its ease in storage, transaction, and speculation. High Transaction Fees Sustained high transaction fees for transactions on the Bitcoin network would allow the use-case for cheaper and more efficient transaction systems. Fees currently average $3.53 USD on the Bitcoin network and increase in times of high transaction volume, and there are already alternatives in the cryptocurrency ecosystem with fee-less or near-zero fee structures. Developers on Bitcoin Core and the wider Bitcoin network are focusing on efficiency improvements, with SegWit, Lightning Network, and Atomic Swaps some of the developments that promise to vastly improve transaction efficiency and therefore transaction fees. Privacy concerns The Bitcoin blockchain has permanent and immutable records of all historical addresses and transactions, and there are concerns over the link between these addresses to real world identities. It could be possible in the future to easily link real world identities to their transactions and addresses on the network, alongside the negative implications of your private data being public. Governments and corporations could also potentially have wide visibility over individual and global spending data, so it is imperative that Bitcoin remains at least pseudonymous to prevent the exploitation of network data. Bitcoin is currently pseudonymous and 2nd layer Lightning Network transactions are even further removed from real world identities. Power consumption concerns There are also widespread electricity use concerns of the Bitcoin network, since the Proof-of-Work consensus protocol requires computational power to process transactions. The Bitcoin network does consume a lot of power; with current estimates saying that Bitcoin is using around 7.8 gigawatts of electricity, equal to 0.23% of the world‚Äôs supply. However it is the carbon footprint that is important, and bitcoin mining is trending towards areas and methods of cheap renewable power, such as hydropower and geothermal energy, so it can be said that the Bitcoin network is a catalyst for a shift towards global renewable energies. A concern is that there is a geographical concentration of mining in China, where coal still supplies ~72% of the nation‚Äôs electricity. Bitcoin has seen a hugely successful 10+ year run since its inception in 2008, and has inspired and educated millions around the world to the importance of decentralization and blockchain technology. It is currently poised to continue its cryptocurrency market dominance and to spearhead the growth of the industry as a whole, especially coming up on the halving of its block reward rate in 2020. Bitcoin could potentially be the largest wealth transfer event in human history, as it looks to disrupt the global payments, cash holdings, and store of value industries. There are well known obstacles and threats to its use case and influence, however Bitcoin‚Äôs developer and user community are able to help it overcome these obstacles as they have done for its lifetime. Bitcoin has shown strong resilience to obstacles so far, and there are no indications that it will fail to do so in the future. Buy Bitcoin Looking for a reputable exchange to purchase Bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies? Please read our Cryptocurrency Exchange Guide. Have you purchased Bitcion or other cryptocurrencies and need to store them in a wallet? Please read our Cryptocurrency Wallet Guide. This article latest updated Nov 19 -- -- Educating and informing users on cryptocurrency and blockchain assets and best practices. Title: HP Printer Offline: Follow These Simple Steps To Fix Them
Subtitle: Written by Gadgetsick
Author: Gadgetsick
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Gadgetsick Follow -- Listen Share HP printer offline is the most familiar errors that you may have faced if you own an HP printer. The glitch can be a result of a low connectivity speed between the computer and the printer. And there is no denying the fact that it can sometimes be frustrating, seeing the gadget throwing tantrums when indeed you need to print out urgently. Why Is My HP Printer Offline? Your printer can get offline because of multiple reasons- such as poor connectivity, outdated drivers- for example. It said certain troubleshooting steps may be implied which may help bring back the equipment from offline to the online state. Below are some of them! ¬∑ Go to settings and right-click on the printer icon to ‚ÄúUse Printer Online‚Äù. ¬∑ Further, double click the printer button, go to the ‚ÄúPrinter‚Äù menu and then click ‚ÄúCancel All Documents‚Äù. ¬∑ Post this, reboot both the printer and the computer. Try printing to see if the issue has been rectified. If not, head on to the next step which aims at re-installing the drivers. Re-Install Driver ¬∑ Move to Settings to choose your printer. ¬∑ From the ‚ÄúGeneral or Details‚Äù, search for your drivers to select it. ¬∑ After this, reinstall the latest printer drivers. ¬∑ Now, under printers in the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù option, select the previous printer name to remove it and add the new one through the ‚ÄúAdd Printer Wizard‚Äù The above were some of a few basic steps; one may try fixing the HP printer offline error. It is highly likely that if you follow these diligently, the glitches with the gadget will be a bygone. What if the issue persists? You tried implementing the steps mentioned above, however, nothing worked out. You begin to wonder: How do you get assistance in getting your printer up and working again? Will it ever work or not? If these questions are constantly troubling you, don‚Äôt worry and get connected to one of the Gadgetsick experts. They have trained professionals with years of vast experience who can assist in fixing any printer glitches. What‚Äôs more, their services are available at affordable prices that won‚Äôt strain your tight budget. Long story short: Ever if you come across any kind of HP printer snag, HP printer offline ‚Äî for example, just call on the support number (888)358‚Äì6248. The belief is that the wonderful experience that you will have after calling Gadgetsick is something that you may not have encountered anytime before with any other company. -- -- 24x7 Tech support for HP printers, computers and tablets.
