Title: Smart healthcare could be coming soon
Subtitle: Written by Marina G
Author: Marina G
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Marina G Follow -- Listen Share Smart City Technology Will Make Your Kids and Parents Healthier Smart city technology can help us to exercise more, schedule doctor appointments with an AI, and warn about infection outbreaks. In the age of active disruption, the healthcare industry seems really outdated. You can get a self-driving car, pay for stuff with contactless cards or even without them ‚Äî thanks to face recognition, learn almost any skill online, but you can‚Äôt rely on technology to save you time or effort when going to the doctor. Skipped appointments and forgotten medication pick-ups are a common problem. Instead of feeling guilty about it, I decided to explore how smart cities are already solving or can potentially solve this problem. I wish someone could fix healthcare, it‚Äôs probably the biggest market we haven‚Äôt had any impact on ‚ÄúI wish someone could fix healthcare, it‚Äôs probably the biggest market we haven‚Äôt had any impact on‚Äù, ‚Äî said Gil Penchina, who was an angel investor behind Paypal, LinkedIn, Ripple, and many other successful startups, in an interview with an amazing Youtube-blogger, Silicon Valley Girl. What has changed in the healthcare industry so far? Yet the processes of appointment scheduling, doctor visits, and regular health checkups remain extremely outdated and time-consuming. A Philadelphia-based Hahnemann Hospital has attempted to improve this. A few years ago, they ran an experiment where 350 congestive heart failure patients were encouraged to download an app that sent them reminders about follow-up appointments via texts and email messages. As a result, the readmission rate for these patients improved by 10%, which was a success. Now imagine that there is a centralized app that keeps track of all your follow-up doctor‚Äôs appointments, regular health checkups, and health test results. The app is connected to your doctor‚Äôs office, and your family doctor is able to add health recommendations or additional checkups to the list. This technology can save doctors‚Äô offices and hospitals hours of time on reminders and phone calls, and it can save you hours of time as well. Many follow-up appointments won‚Äôt be necessary as the doctor will be able to share their recommendations through the app. Let‚Äôs look at this as an example: Meet Jane, a busy mom of a 2-year old, trying to balance her career and take proper care of her child. Recently, she started experiencing frequent headaches, so she goes to the doctor and the doctor thinks it may be caused by a low hemoglobin level in her blood. So he sends Jane for a blood test. The blood test confirms light anaemia. Now, instead of booking Jane in for a follow-up appointment, the doctor uses the app to issue her a prescription. Jane sees her test results and her doctor‚Äôs conclusion immediately, so at lunch time she goes to the nearest drug store and buys the prescribed iron supplements ‚Äî all without the need to even call the doctor‚Äôs office or visit it again. Taking it to the next level, the city-wide healthcare app can get information about available appointments in hospitals and filter out the best options for you, relying on the AI algorithm. This basically eliminates the need to think about making those appointments, freeing up a lot of time and mental space in your head. Let‚Äôs go back to Jane. Now she needs to get her son in for a regular dental checkup. Overloaded with her work tasks and household chores, she has forgotten to schedule an appointment well in advance. Now her dentist is saying she is fully-booked. So Jane has two options: postpone the appointment for at least a month or look for other dentists which are available. With an app that relies on smart city technology, this process could be a lot simpler. Once the reminder is triggered, the software would automatically locate clinics close to the regular route from Jane‚Äôs home to the daycare center, ping them for available time slots around the time of Jane‚Äôs regular commute, and then deliver the best options to Jane. Instead of getting a reminder to call the doctor, Jane would get a list of the most suitable appointments pre-selected by the artificial intelligence in her app. Now she can book the most convenient one for her and her son right there on the app. Smart sensors can also be installed in the homes of people with certain health conditions to help identify unusual behavior. Jane‚Äôs husband, Rob, is worried about his older mom living alone. Like many adults, Rob doesn‚Äôt call her very often, but it doesn‚Äôt mean he doesn‚Äôt care. So one day he convinces his mom to install a smart sensor. The sensor can monitor her behavior and surrounding environment. If it detects the smell of food in the evening, it automatically reminds her to take her prescribed medication ‚Äî the one that needs to be taken at dinner time. If the sensor detects low or unusually high activity levels in the room, it will send an alarm signal to Rob‚Äôs phone and to the doctor‚Äôs office. When Rob receives this alert, he calls his mom to make sure she is OK. Soon the phone starts sending such alerts every few days. On the 10th alert the app automatically detects that such behavioral changes could be an early sign of Alzheimer‚Äôs, and advises Rob‚Äôs mom to consult a doctor. The doctor can then assess the information from the sensor, talk to the patient and make his conclusion as to whether further health inspections are needed. Luckily, Rob‚Äôs mom is fine, she just was a little stressed about her upcoming trip to her friend‚Äôs in Louisiana. But Rob can have peace of mind knowing that his mom is getting the attention and medical care she needs. On a city level, information from millions of centralized healthcare apps on citizens‚Äô phones can be used to improve city design to make citizens healthier. There is a parameter called ‚Äòneighborhood walkability‚Äô.A good neighborhood has a high level of walkability, encouraging citizens to be more physically active. Walking to a favorite restaurant, a grocery store, a playground, or a daycare center instead of taking a drive is a great way to add some exercise to a daily routine. With mass adoption of wearable devices, city architects can get very precise information about how citizens navigate through neighborhoods. Analyzing large sets of data can help get a real picture and take city design to the next level in terms of neighborhood walkability. Smart sensors can also play a great role in identifying air quality issues and taking preventive measures. One cost-effective idea is to install air quality sensors on to existing fixtures, such as street lights. The authorities in Louisville, Kentucky have taken a more interesting approach to improving citizens‚Äô health. The city was ranked the 16th most challenging city for people with asthma in the US. So they issued asthma inhalers with built-in sensors. Every time the device is used, the location was detected and stored in the database. This helped the city create a map of asthma hotspots: places where asthma incidents happened most often. By analyzing this data, the authorities realised that air quality on certain streets in the centre was the potential cause. So they added additional trees and plants to those streets. The results were worth it: the number of asthma incidents in the area has decreased by 60%. Similar technology can be used to identify other problematic areas and locations with outbreaks of viruses. Jane and her 2-year-old son plan to go to a playground in the park. She has no idea that there is a burst of gastro infection in the neighborhood. Wearables of 10 recent patients show that they have been frequently playing on the same playground. For the next 24 hours, the area will be highlighted on the map as potentially dangerous. Just before leaving the house, Jane checks the city health map on the phone and realizes she needs to change plans to ensure her child doesn‚Äôt get the virus. Data transmitted from wearable devices can also be used to more quicklyr identify the location of large accidents that could endanger a lot of people. If there is an abrupt change in the health indicators of many people, it could signal an issue and help the emergency services to react faster. Smart healthcare technology seems to offer great benefits, but those benefits come at a cost. Having data from smart wearables constantly transmitted to healthcare providers and emergency services means the complete end of privacy (although our privacy is dead anyway). Not to mention government agencies which can access information from our devices at any time ‚Äî they are powerful enough to get such information from anyone they want to, even without smart sensors. Hackers can also break into your home data sensors to assess when you leave the house and for how long, and use this information to gain access. Other dangers linked to compromised privacy may also arise. Before smart healthcare goes mainstream, we need to find a way to safely store and protect this data. A combination of blockchain and biometric protection may one day become powerful enough to do this, but for now we simply don‚Äôt have this technology ready. Gil Penchina calls healthcare one of the top three most promising startup markets. Let‚Äôs hope that he is right and wait for real disruptors in the healthcare system. For the guys that will help Jane take a break from worries about her missed doctor‚Äôs appointments and playground viruses. The guys that will help Rob make sure his mom is doing well, even though he forgot to call her on Sunday. The guys that will use smart city technology to adapt the healthcare system to our fast-paced mobile lifestyle. Hopefully it won‚Äôt take long. -- -- Explaining blockchain and crypto to ‚Äònormal people‚Äô | Fintech Writer https://www.linkedin.com/in/mgeneralova/ Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Wondering about B2B challenges and solutions?
Subtitle: Published in expostall
Author: Expo Stall
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Expo Stall Follow expostall -- Listen Share Business is difficult but B2B business is even more difficult. B2B market itself consists of a different market and the power is not in the hands of the B2B owner but in the hands of the buyer or retailer. The challenges a B2B owner faces are quite different from what a normal businessman faces. So all the people who are into any type of B2B business needs to understand all the challenges which they might face during their B2B journey. Here are a few points to consider. 1. Technology ‚Äî Boon or Bane Technology has not just created doors for development and success but has created an atmosphere of competition and stress. The people who have been able to explore it completely are striving and the progress graph is going upwards. The businessmen who are using SEO, SEM, using a website, visibility on social media and many more are going on a track which is called success. But there are many more tools which people use like Customer Relationship Management(CRM), Analytics of company and many more small tools of technology. B2B companies often find it difficult using all this technology in comparison to B2C who make every single effort to make sure that the customer comes back to them as soon as possible. 2. Diversion of Focus From Basics In B2B business what actually matters is how much you are able to earn from the sales as sometimes technology might close some gates of sales. This is a reason why till date many B2B companies are still using their golden rule of business meaning their own strategies. The basic understanding of how your marketing strategies are going to affect your sales is the first rule of business, if you are able to understand that your strategies are taking your sales graph upward then only you are going to flourish. When you deal with a buyer many times technology might not be able to help you. Also tracking the different departments of your company is important, a coordinated team can do wonders beyond imagination. 3. Right Strategy For Each Stakeholder In a B2B business buying decisions is often the most crucial decision as in this decision the number of stakeholders involved is many. As B2B business is not one way, it becomes important for the company to make itself visible differently in front of different people meaning a different image, content for influencers and different for stakeholders. With this change in role and responsibilities so many chances of error also increases. In order to tackle this situation a little smoothly, one needs to make sure that marketing and sales work hand in hand. Title: Purpose and benefit of Perimeter security system & thermal Radar system
Subtitle: Written by Derrick
Author: Derrick
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Derrick Follow -- Listen Share Perimeter security refers to natural barriers or built consolidation to either keep invaders out or to keep captives contained within the area the boundary surrounds. It ensures safeguarding of the approach ways to an industrial facility or a privately owned parcel of land and is the first line of defense for an object. Due to many restrictions, a perimeter security system can be used in combination with some other alarms & security systems. The premier Security system is effectively work in necessary to consider a large number of the details, observing from facility design, to observe from the possible attack ranges, the ways of intruding and the availability of intruding through the fencing and its designed elements and also observation of the surrounding. In most of the systems the details of the observations can only be found through the website research these observations are taken by the operations to make the safety of the periphery of a complete place or building. In the protection of a building, there are some necessary conditions that there must be a complete system, which observes automatically the surroundings with the most advanced techniques of detection. There is some kind of security systems available in the market and one of them is Hydra, which works for thermal detection and surveillance. Thermal Radar is commonly used a best in class for rotating and applies edge-based on analytic identification, classify and locate any invasion that may threaten your perimeter. Thermal Radar detection alerts generate not only to identify the intruder‚Äôs specific location but also a thermal image of the intrusion. By providing accurate detection, Thermal Radar provides many of the same specific results of traditional radar while remaining a completely passive and undetectable intrusion system. Thermal Radar can be a standalone detection outpost on an expansive border project or the centerpiece of an integrated physical security strategy at your most difficult facilities. Thermal Imaging is used for wide-area intrusion detection. The thermal imaging is a highly sensitive and advanced system, which detects the intrusion, with a small change in the climate. Thermal Imaging radar can rotate up to 360 angles. It can prevent commercial, industrial harm and it can be used for data storage in warehouses. It can remotely and passively monitor and protect your facilitates, whether it‚Äôs a large facility, single asset, onshore or offshore. Title: Meditation, Mindfulness & Rage.
Subtitle: Written by LanceFernandes
Author: LanceFernandes
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in LanceFernandes Follow -- Listen Share The millennia-old practice makes a comeback at the right time. Meditation and mindfulness have been all the rage recently. There‚Äôs a rise in the practice, and with that comes a rise in the number of apps which promise you peace and happiness. But do these apps work, or do we trick ourselves into thinking they make a difference? As you might‚Äôve guessed, it‚Äôs a complicated answer. And there‚Äôs no peace or happiness that you‚Äôll find at the end of the article ‚Äî these are only some of the views that I have. The most popular form of meditation is ‚Äúmindfulness‚Äù, or ‚ÄúVipassana‚Äù. The practice aims to train the meditator to be able to be aware of their own thoughts and emotions. We‚Äôve all got an endless stream of thoughts flowing through our minds. We‚Äôre unaware of a majority of these thoughts. The issue with these thoughts is this: a good chunk of these thoughts are negative in nature. Without knowing it, these thoughts put us in a bad mood, lowering the quality of our days. Another issue is that not being aware of our own thoughts leads to us living a significant part of our days inside of our own heads. This distracts us from being in the present and enjoying the moment. The practice of mindfulness does not aim to stop our thoughts altogether ‚Äî it aims to teach us to observe them. This puts us in control of our emotions and our reactions. This means that if we get angry, we do not stay angry ‚Äî and if we get happy, we can stay that way. Meditation is far from an easy task. Apps such as Headspace & Calm strive to make the practice easier ‚Äî but it in doing so, the apps miss out on the key essence of meditation. There is one app which I find tackles meditation head on ‚Äî and that is Sam Harris‚Äô app, Waking Up. The lessons are more difficult but definitely more rewarding. (I should mention that I am in no way affiliated with Sam Harris or the Waking Up app). There is no ‚Äúbest‚Äù meditation app ‚Äî there‚Äôs only the best for you, and that comes with trial and error. Every app has a free trial before you jump in. And it‚Äôs important to choose an app you‚Äôre more likely to stick to. Because then, you‚Äôre more likely to meditate. The purest form of meditation would be sitting down and doing nothing. No distractions, no phone, no television, no music ‚Äî only you and your thoughts. This is uncomfortable for almost everyone ‚Äî myself included, which is why using an app is easier. But the goal for us would be to one day be able to sit by ourselves in a room, and do nothing ‚Äî absolutely nothing ‚Äî and be okay with it. -- -- A collection of my thoughts, ideas and deliberations. Title: PoS Consensus Paradigm Shift? APoS better than PoS?
Subtitle: Published in MAP Protocol
Author: MarcoPolo OpenSource
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in MarcoPolo OpenSource Follow MAP Protocol -- Listen Share In the whitepaper of MarcoPolo Protocol (MAP), an improved PoS consensus called Asset PoS a.k.a APoS was proposed. In today‚Äôs article, we will have a deep dive into this APoS consensus and explain why this could be a trend in the future PoS consensus blockchain system. First, let‚Äôs have a quick cap about PoS consensus. Differ to PoW, which consumes an extreme amount of power to resolve a difficult mathematical problem. PoS is based on Staking, yes, the keyword here is staking. To simulate the stake-based Validator (in PoS, we call them validator rather than miner) selection process, the Follow-the-Satoshi (FTS) algorithm has been adopted in many PoS based block-chain networks such as Cardano, Dash, etc. The probability Œ°i that node i is selected to be the Validator in a network of N participants is where Si is the stake of participant i. This means that the more stake a node holds, the higher chance it is selected to be the Validator. And the Validator gets the coin rewards of course. See the following picture for easy understanding. Then on top of the common PoS, EOS, ‚Äúinvented‚Äù a DPoS (Delegated PoS) consensus. In the EOS ecosystem, globally there are 21 Validators or Super Nodes (they call themselves). Every participant I mean you and me normal guys, who owns EOS tokens need to stake on those Candidates who are competing for 21 Super Nodes, this process called Election, much like choose a Member of Parliament in real social life. The most powerful or popular 21 Nodes become the Super Nodes and they take in turn to validate the blocks and of course they get huge EOS coins as reward. I think this is more like a mining pool in the PoW word, only those big players get big profits. Now let‚Äôs talk about a new improved PoS, APoS, Asset-based Proof of Stake. This is a new concept from the white paper of MarcoPolo Protocol. Before we dive into what‚Äôs APoS, I think we need to understand what‚Äôs the purpose of the MarcoPolo Protocol and what issues the MarcoPolo Protocol tries to resolve. MarcoPolo Protocol aims to build a new peer to peer e-cash system, much like Bitcoin, but in a multiple coin interchangeable fashion. So basically you can think of multiple cryptocurrency trade settlement in the MarcoPolo Standard Chain. A good analogy is if we do business trade between Canda and Australia, then the settlement currency should be local currency, however, in the middle, the USD will be the exchange currency and using the SWIFT system to do the conversion. Of course, the MarcoPolo Protocol support Smart Contract and each Dapp will be in their own block-chain system. We will dig into this in future articles. So naturally it makes sense if I can use BTC to stake, or if I have ETH, then I should use ETH to stake, or in the future in MarcoPolo Protocol ecosystem, they can create their own tokens. I want to be able to use those tokens to stake. That is where the Asset comes into the picture, so in a nutshell, you can use any supported coins to stake in the MarcoPolo Protocol blockchain system. The APoS consensus is happening in following steps: For easy understanding, please refer the following diagram: In the diagram, every actor or normal Joe, can stake on their preferred Candidates by using MAP, BTC or ETH (Multi Assets), then the candidates get elected to Validator, The red-ish (stands for dishonesty node) Validator 100+ will be de-elected in the next cycle and the stakes on it will be decreased. So what are the advantages and questions with APoS? Some advantages are: Some questions are: In summary, it‚Äôs definitely a nice way to use your cold storage BTC or ETH to stake some of the latest blockchain projects and get some rewards, but how to make it fair, secure, transparent, easy-to-use still remain a question. For more information on the MarcoPolo Protocol and if you want to discuss this topic with developers from Bitcoin or Ethereum or Cosmos and engage directly with MarcoPolo Protocol, join our official technical community Discord or Riot. -- -- MAP Protocol is a Bitcoin layer-2 and peer-to-peer omnichain infrastructure built upon light clients and ZK technology, focusing on cross-chain interoperability. Title: Understanding UI (User Interface), UX (User Experience) & CX (Customer Experience) in context to Left Brain & Right Brain theory
Subtitle: Published in Digital Percept
Author: Atalbihari Baddar
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Atalbihari Baddar Follow Digital Percept -- Listen Share People new to Interaction Design often get confused with terms like UI, UX and CX. Many think it is all about ‚ÄòWeb Designing‚Äô, hence designing colourful web pages using images and fonts. This article is intended to explain these processes and their significance in application interface design. UI design focuses on visual design or skinning the wire-frames, where the creative designer plays with colours, shapes, layouts, typography and more. It is related to branding, colours, typography, iconography. The design team refers all these branding related aspects from a brand guidelines document. A digital first brand OR a brand looking at aggressive digital transformation should focus on a separate dedicated online brand guidelines document. User Interface Design is all about what the customer sees & feels while interacting with the design. From Left brain Right brain theory, UI is more Right brain, a work related to emotions, creativity, intuitiveness, imagination and free flow. User Experience Design starts with research followed by analysis and strategy. It is all about finding solutions, documentation, dealing with Information Architecture, Data, Wireframes, Prototyping, Decision making & similar logical attributes. It defines the structure of the product, funnels, scenarios, data flow & development plan for development team to use while defining the development sprints. User Experience is all about how the customer thinks & acts to complete the goal or tasks while using the application. From Left brain Right brain theory perspective, UX is more Left brain, a work related to Logic, Reason, structure, linear and functionality Customer Experience in digital context is everything the user uses and experiences during interacting with brand‚Äôs digital assets. It may start with a digital communication in form of a CTA (Call to action) on a mailer or digital advertise or a post on social media. It could be a task initiated on a self serving portal or a interactive funnel designed to take some action like purchase or booking. It could be as simple as raising a service request or submitting a complaint or locating a toll free contact number! How pleasing and easy the interaction with the digital asset happens defines the quality of customer experience. Effectively UI + UX + Data + Advertising + Branding + Sales process + Business strategy + Pricing + After sales service + Support and other things result in effective CX (Customer Experience). A good Customer Experience is a result of balance of Creativity (Right Brain) and Logic (Left brain) applied during application design. The balanced approach results in appealing and effective customer experience which results in acquisition, retention and revenue generation. In a SMART application definition, A stands for Attractive & Accessible which is nothing but building a balanced user interface and experience. Watch this video related to the blog here: Understanding UI (User Interface), UX (User Experience) & CX (Customer Experience) from Atalbihari Baddar By, Atalbihari Baddar -- -- All about Digital Strategy, Trends, Technology, Gadgets and related ecosystem Passionate about Digital Strategy, Digital Transformation, Websites, User Interaction Design, Customer experience design, Digital Experiences, Websites Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: How to Check If a File Exists Without Exceptions in Python
Subtitle: Better Programming
Author: Jonathan Hsu
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Home Newsletter About  Advice for programmers.  Member-only story Jonathan Hsu Follow Better Programming -- 2 Share When performing actions contingent on successful execution, variations of try/except statements are used to capture exceptions and respond accordingly. The basic premise here is leaping before looking, knowing that you have plans in place for errant actions. But what if you want to look before you leap? Specifically when working with files? All of our solutions will use the os library and use the isfile() method, which returns True or False. The remainder is dictated by where the file to be checked exists relative to the executing file. Asking yourself the following questions will ensure a thorough search. To check for a file that exists within the same directory as the executing file, simply pass the file name to the method as a string. If the file you are checking for is in a subdirectory of the executing file, then pass the relative path to the method. If the file is in a completely different directory or you don‚Äôt want to be restricted to a relative path, pass the absolute path to the method. -- -- 2 Advice for programmers. Title: Artificial Intelligence is Revolutionizing Healthcare- and this is why
Subtitle: Published in MyTake
Author: Grace Byers
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Grace Byers Follow MyTake -- Listen Share Artificial intelligence is making waves in the medical industry, especially in the media. From bionic arms and robots performing detailed surgeries, it is hard to ignore. According to research conducted by HIMSS Media, 63% of research participants believe that ‚Äú AI and machine learning are already delivering value in specialty care including radiology, pathology and pharma.‚Äù This information is promising as it shows that the majority of people feel as if artificial intelligence and machine learning are making a positive impact in healthcare. This article focuses on why artificial intelligence is revolutionizing healthcare, real-life use cases of the technology being used and the ethics surrounding implementing this kind of technology into the medical industry. The ways in which artificial intelligence is transforming healthcare goes beyond what you see in the media. We have seen Tilly Lockey, the first teenager in the UK with bionic arms. Open Bionics created these arms, the world‚Äôs first medically approved 3D printed bionic arms. However, there is much more technology being developed than this. These new types of technologies not only can be used to change patients lives, but also change the work lives of doctors and nurses by creating more efficiency and organization. AI can be used to create personalized treatment plans as well as better organized patient routes. This new technology can also be used to speed up processes such as discovering candidates for clinical drug trials. As well as this, artificial intelligence is being used in predicting diagnoses that require early intervention. This will improve the lives of patients and their families if they can use technology to detect illnesses prior to onset. There are many new companies driving the development of artificial intelligence in healthcare. I am going to discuss three companies at the forefront of this phenomenon, these are Nuance, AIVaid, and Prognos. Nuance is a multinational computer software technology corporation based in the United States. It is a company that uses artificial intelligence in many areas, such as communication and healthcare. Nuance uses their artificially intelligent technology in many sections, such as; documentation capture solutions, clinical and revenue integrity solutions, quality management solutions, optimization and consulting services, diagnostic solutions, and ambulatory solutions. Through using artificial intelligence to tackle all of these areas, it allows for transformations in both the lives of patients and staff. Their AI-powered solutions allow for 45% less time spent on documentation, this time saved can be used to care for and treat patients. AIVaid is a free application that uses machine learning and an inference engine( applies logical rules to the knowledge base to gather new information) to allow users, both patients and doctors, to ask medical questions to reveal possible conditions. The information used to develop this application is collected by the company Infermedica. This company collects, analyzes and organizes data and feeds it into the technology. This in turn allows the technology to learn and progress further. The last piece of their technology is the API which enables the user interface. Now that we have covered the technology, let‚Äôs discuss the benefits of using a tool like AIVaid. The first advantage would of course be cost as it is free. It saves time as you don‚Äôt have to travel, wait or attend meetings. The app is, as expected, 24/7, meaning you don‚Äôt have to be restricted by times of business. As well as this you also get instant, accurate reports. Another element of this application that is beneficial is trust. As it is a private and secure app, people can trust the app with their private data. Prognos is an artificial intelligence software company that use artificial intelligence to successfully diagnose patients in order to accelerate the treatment process. Prognos‚Äô technology is as advanced as it is because it has access to more than 20 billion medical records. In fact, the Prognos Registry is the largest source of clinical diagnostics information covering 50 disease areas, and 200 million patients. The ethics of using technology in industries, especially in healthcare and medicine, is often at the forefront of the conversation. We can‚Äôt afford to take things lightly as it may be a literal matter of life or death. There are many questions being asked, for example; who is responsible for the actions of AI machines? Will use of AI lead to an absence of a doctor-patient relationship? What about hacking? The ethics of data is a prominent issue at the moment and there have been many companies that have abused the use of artificial intelligence in technology for their own gain. In terms of healthcare and medicine, genetic testing companies such as 23andMe are selling the data they collect and analyze to biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies. This means that your genetic information will no longer be private information. This year, 23andMe signed a 4-year, $300 million deal with pharma giant GlaxoSmithKline. What is the purpose of this deal you may ask? Well, to develop new drugs is currently at the centre of their focus. However, there are organizations who use patient data for good and are transparent about how they use it. Project Fizzyo is a company that is collecting data from Cystic Fibrosis patients. The data is transferred directly to the clinicians and researchers caring for them. They use electronically chipped ACT (airway clearance technique) devices and wearable activity trackers to do so. They use this data to try and develop new treatments as well as make the current treatments more fun through gaming. To conclude, artificial intelligence will be used in the future to make the lives of both physicians and patients easier. As Eric Topol, MD, director and founder of Scripps Research Translational Institute has said: ‚ÄúBy augmenting human performance, AI has the potential to markedly improve productivity, efficiency, workflow, accuracy and speed, both for [physicians] and for patients ‚Ä¶ What I‚Äôm most excited about is using the future to bring back the past: to restore the care in healthcare.‚Äù *All views and opinions are mine and not of Oracle.* -- -- Smart Insight Communities Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Computer Files Are Going Extinct
Subtitle: OneZero
Author: Simon Pitt
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Home Newsletter About  OneZero is a former publication from Medium about the impact of technology on people and the‚Ä¶  Member-only story Simon Pitt Follow OneZero -- 57 Share I love files. I love renaming them, moving them, sorting them, changing how they‚Äôre displayed in a folder, backing them up, uploading them to the internet, restoring them, copying them, and hey, even defragging them. As a metaphor for a way of storing a piece of information, I think they‚Äôre great. I like the file as a unit of work. If I need to write an article, it goes in a file. If I need to produce an image, it‚Äôs in a file. Files are skeuomorphic. That‚Äôs a fancy word that just means they‚Äôre a digital concept that mirrors a physical item. A Word document, for example, is like a piece of paper, sitting on your desk(top). A JPEG is like a painting, and so on. They each have a little icon that looks like the physical thing they represent. A pile of paper, a picture frame, a manila folder. It‚Äôs kind of charming really. One thing I like about files is there‚Äôs a consistent way of interacting with them, no matter what‚Äôs inside. Those things I mentioned above ‚Äî copying, sorting, defragging ‚Äî I can do those to any file. It could be an image, part of a game, or a list of my favorite utensils. Defragmenter doesn‚Äôt care. It doesn‚Äôt judge the contents. -- -- 57 OneZero is a former publication from Medium about the impact of technology on people and the future. Currently inactive and not taking submissions. Media techie, software person, and web-stuff doer. Head of Corporate Digital at BBC, but views my own. More at pittster.co.uk Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: How Do We Design Electrical Systems For Offices?
Subtitle: Written by Good Ship
Author: Good Ship
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Good Ship Follow -- Listen Share As a commercial electrician, we carry out projects regularly in a variety of offices. Whether we are turning an office into creating state-of-the-art wiring designs that include data cabling, lighting, energy and alarm systems, the designs we produce are critical to the success of the entire project. Therefore, in this publication, we think we would share with you our overall design process, so you can see how much effort and dedication are devoted to each one. Click here: Domestic Commercial Electrician Aylesbury Before the electrical design process can begin, we must ensure that what was requested works within the construction plans of the architect, the builder or the owner. These plans detail the information that the local inspection authority needs to know to approve the plans, as well as specific electrical designs and documentation that ensures that these designs will adhere to the required building regulations. We will determine if the electrical designs are feasible, we will suggest how they can be improved and then we will send the plans to the owner to send them to the local authority. The scope of the design depends on what the office requires. For example, if you require a new electrical system, we will determine the best way to incorporate all new electrical wiring into this system. At this stage, we also ensure that new systems can cope with additional loads that will be expected from them. A design plan will include several parts: General electrical requirements, such as electrical outlets found throughout the office, are used for computers. Specialized electrical requirements, for equipment that may need separate electrical circuits, such as microwaves and vending machines. ¬∑ Lighting systems, including accessories and their controls. ¬∑ Electrical distribution systems, such as the switchboard. When each part of the design plan has been determined, we design each part according to industry standards to ensure safety and performance. These standards include BS 7671: 2018, which refers to electrical installations, including protection against electric shock, voltage disturbances and thermal effects. With steps 1‚Äì3 complete, we create the plan using plans or a CAD tool (computer-aided design), which allows us to visualize the electrical circuits of the office. Each device is referenced by several symbols to ensure that everyone involved understands the plan. Then we present our plan to the architect or builder, who, as mentioned above, will transmit it to the local authority. It requires a lot of work and experience, but it is always worth it. Title: Ecosystem Maturity Framework
Subtitle: Evolution One
Author: Eugene Sidorin
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Home About  To help Artificial Intelligence break free of geographical, cultural and linguistic boundaries, we‚Ä¶  Eugene Sidorin Follow Evolution One -- 1 Listen Share This post is co-authored by Alex Stern & Eugene Sidorin. While Artificial Intelligence industry is undergoing a rapid development today, it also remains a disorderly and complex field where value creation still poses a significant challenge for both executives and investors. In general, sustained progress in an emerging field can be made viable only by establishing a strong and diverse ecosystem of players that are motivated to continue to push forward and deliver value to their partners and customers even during the periods of cooldowns. To quote Ron Adner of Tuck School of Business, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre only as good as your ecosystem‚Äù (HBR, 2016). Over the years, a number of different instruments have been developed to frame the thinking and help identify the existing gaps and investment opportunities in a particular industry, ranging from Porter‚Äôs five forces to Gartner‚Äôs hype cycle for emerging industries. However, the ever-accelerating pace of the world today forces much faster business decision making, which in turn creates a need among business leaders, entrepreneurs, and investors for a set of tools capable of delivering actionable insights. To address this need, we‚Äôve developed a framework allowing to evaluate the level of ecosystem maturity of any emerging technology field and helping to identify key growth catalysts and blockers. Conceptually, any technology space can be visualized as a series of ‚Äúbuilding blocks‚Äù: it begins with the areas that are farthest from the end customers, and then continues to the areas that can be regarded as downstream, until we get to products and services that are being directly purchased by the end consumers (end products, or implemented solutions): Across all stages, there are 3 broad categories of commercial players involved: foundational product companies, specialized product players, and ‚Äúimplementers‚Äù: The level of maturity of each ‚Äúbuilding block‚Äù influences the overall level of maturity of the ecosystem, while its ability to progress towards maturity is defined by a combination of two indicators: the alignment of expectations across stages and the availability of external funding at each stage: Across all stages, there are 3 broad categories of commercial players involved: foundational product companies, specialized product players, and ‚Äúimplementers‚Äù: The level of maturity of each ‚Äúbuilding block‚Äù influences the overall level of maturity of the ecosystem, while its ability to progress towards maturity is defined by a combination of two indicators: the alignment of expectations across stages and the availability of external funding at each stage: For business executives looking to leverage AI technologies in their current businesses or build AI-infused products, it is crucial today to focus on the areas that represent the most substantial blockers on the path of overall ecosystem maturity, even if those areas don‚Äôt always appear to be the most attractive ones. Moreover, as it is the investors who support the formation of the ecosystem with their money until it could allow for sustainable business models to emerge, it is in their interest to incentivize the management to prioritize the opportunities that might bring the ecosystem to maturity faster. Title: How the Limor Social Audio App Works
Subtitle: Limor is the next evolution of social media into voice, and the next evolution of podcasting into social. With Limor, we have taken the best aspects of social media apps, and traditional podcasting and combined them together to form the new genre of ‚Äúsocial audio‚Äù.
Author: Limor
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Limor Follow -- Listen Share What is social audio?Social audio is the next wave of social media, content creation and interaction whose foundations are built on voice . Voice and audio have grown so much over the last few years, both in terms of the volume of content being created and consumed, and the advances in voice technology by companies in an attempt to dominate this emerging market. Limor, fortunately, foresaw this rise in the popularity of audio and traditional podcasting and began the process of getting the Limor concept developed and off the ground as far back as 2014 when CEO Shane Monahan first came up with the seed of the idea. This has put Limor in the very strong position as the ‚Äúfirst mover‚Äù. As it stands at the beginning of 2019, Limor has a fully launched app, a loyal user base, exciting content creators, and is in talks with a massive network of individuals, organizations and brands to join the Limor conspiracy ahead of a hard marketing drive in 2019. This networks includes professional sportspeople, movie stars, various media organizations and everything in between. Limor makes creating content easier than it‚Äôs ever been before with regards to audio and podcasting. What Instagram has done for photography, Limor has now done for audio. With the app installed, you can instantly record short social audio or full length traditional podcasts using just your phone, and from there, you have the ability to publish this content straight onto the Limor platform creating a following (listeners) in the process. Once published, anyone on the Limor app will be able to listen, like and comment on your material and also recast it to their own followers, thereby growing your following very quickly. The ability for people to leave voice comments on your cast is ideal for sparking instant real conversations. This ability for voice interaction is great for users to get in depth feedback on their content via voice from their listeners. It was essential when developing Limor that we ensured it was as easy as possible for people to navigate through and understand quickly. That is why by taking the best aspects of already existing traditional social media platforms, we have been able to create a new genre of social media within a new app, but in a way that everyone will feel accustomed to as soon as they sign up. After downloading the app for free, you will create your profile in a similar way to Instagram or Twitter, and after that it‚Äôs up to you what you do on your profile. If you just want to consume content then you can go straight to our discovery section and start listening / following other users, or if you want to build your own following just hit record, and publish your material for others to find. The video at the beginning of this article will give you a good insight into how to do all this. After recording your social audio or a traditional podcast, should you require it, you can use the built in editing function of Limor. This feature saves people time and money as you no longer need to go out and buy either a desktop or laptop powerful enough to run editing software, or purchase the software itself which can be very expensive. Limor currently offers both it‚Äôs platform, and recording / editing functions completely free of charge. If you are looking to start building your online content via voice then Limor is certainly the app for you. Visit our other social media platforms for more information and videos about the Limor conspiracy and if you still have any questions as to how everything works you can always get in touch with us through the Limor direct messaging! www.limor.ie -- -- Limor is a new social audio platform that makes the process of podcasting production and distribution easy, instant and interactive sparking real conversation Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Help a Loved One Avoid the Trash of Things
Subtitle: Written by MicheletheTrainer
Author: MicheletheTrainer
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in MicheletheTrainer Follow -- Listen Share by Michele the Trainer The internet is a fascinating tool but like with most beautiful things, humans have a way of trashing it up. We have all these methods of communication but are we really communicating? As a writer I love email. I love word processing programs. I love connecting with brilliant fascinating people around the globe. I am also still in love with postal mail and letter writing. Everyday my tech experience improves because I have cleaned it up and allowed in some fantastic content from extraordinary creators. I‚Äôm excited to see art, and read content and share emails with loved ones and answer questions and more. But this is not the case for most people. Most people are drowning in crap. We used to help people open doors and cross the street, and all that is still wonderful but wouldn‚Äôt it also be helpful if we helped a loved one: ¬∑ Unsubscribe to Junk Mail ¬∑ Manage their Inbox ¬∑ Learn to avoid Robot Calls If they learn how to use their phone in an emergency, it may also save lives. The TOT; Trash of Things is so overwhelming that folks are taking to social media for communication, while anyone who watches the news knows it‚Äôs not private or secure and cannot summon help for a person in an emergency. We‚Äôve all seen people take emergency medical issues to social media; scary on multiple levels. Bad bad bad and dangerous. Further, what of the beauty of writing a letter and receiving it, without drowning in a zillion emails per day from any corporate retail marketing department. Managing the Inbox: We could explain the difference between Opt-In and Opt-Out Around 2013 some email programs starting filing away email which was creepy because it was as if the email providers were reading our emails for us. Why how else could they file them? (Don‚Äôt fret I‚Äôm tech saavy enough to understand how). I learned about this filing function from a call from a dear friend. I found out then that my closest friends were not receiving my emails because my MicheleTheTrainer domain was being automatically filed for them into a Marketing, Promotional or even worse Junk folder. How lame. I personally write my emails and curate the content. I am not a robot. Seth Godin has written on this specific issue for years, but here‚Äôs a explanatory post from 2018, which is five years after I first noticed: https://seths.blog/2018/01/an-open-note-to-google/ If someone clearly Opts-In, they should get your emails. If I Opt-In to my local university or the botanical garden, I want their emails. We‚Äôve all Opt‚Äôed into something that we‚Äôve backed out of too due to inbox overload. If we don‚Äôt help people understand how to Opt-out, they will become spam infested and not visit their inbox. As a writer, this is a lost channel of communication. For the inbox user, it‚Äôs a lost opportunity to enhance their life by receiving remarkable content. Most folks today, however, just let their inbox become so unmanageable that they do not use it anymore. Like an ocean full of trash it‚Äôs become unusable. Just like using the phone is still very important today. Calling is the next best thing to talking in person. Yes I know about video calls but if someone can‚Äôt avoid robot scam calls or clean their inbox, they might not understand video calls either. Help them. In today‚Äôs trying times, the phone is also bringing a new level of robot calls, and criminal scams. I‚Äôve heard some outrageous bullshit. It‚Äôs important that everyone knows how to avoid this. Language exists for a reason. We have all these wonderful tools to communicate but if they are not managed, we go back to images like a caveman and cave paintings. As an artist and SCUBA diver I understand the power of visual arts. Visuals are also great communication tools, but they are absolutely not the only way to get information. Help someone else a couple times a week understand how to use their phone and inbox. It‚Äôs like teaching someone how to load a dishwasher or use the washing machine. These are tools that can improve daily life, if used correctly. The internet is amazing and there is some top content out there, but most folks are just wading in spammy bullshit. Save some lives. Help folks cross the street towards a better wired experience. ‚Äî Thanks for your time and please visit my blog at EngineeringWellness.com for humans and look for me at OceanProtectionLeagueGallery for the humans who want to improve the ocean. If you‚Äôd like to get my emails, email me at Coaching@MicheleTheTrainer.com and I‚Äôll personally add you, but please don‚Äôt lose me in a folder! ;) -- -- Author, Project Manager, Speaker, Wellness Expert, Artist, Singer/Songwriter & Ocean LOVER Coaching@MicheleTheTrainer.com https://linktr.ee/michelethetrainer Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Micro Arcade Is a Series of Tiny Handhelds That Run Just a Single Game Each
Subtitle: Written by Cameron Coward
Author: Cameron Coward
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Cameron Coward Follow -- 1 Listen Share A few years ago, the Arduino-based Arduboy 8-bit miniature handheld video game console launched. It was very basic, but packed a lot of charm into its compact body. Later, the creator released the Tetris MicroCard, which was similar but only ran Tetris ‚Äî and, surprisingly, costs more than the Arduboy. Now, thanks to a licensing deal with Super Impulse, an entire range of Micro Arcade handhelds is going to be launched soon. Each Micro Arcade handheld game system is absolutely tiny ‚Äî about the size of a credit card. But, they‚Äôre capable of running complete games on an little full-color LCD screen. Each Micro Arcade console is built on the same tech as the Tetris MicroCard and has physical buttons for gameplay. However, they‚Äôre not programmable like the ArduBoy is. You just get the one game that‚Äôs burned into the hardware. That makes the Micro Arcade essentially a modern version of the classic Nintendo Game & Watch handhelds from the ‚Äô80s. Micro Arcade appears to be launching with six games: Space Invaders, Pac-man, Galaga, Frogger, Rally X, and an Atari model that presumably contains a few individual games. Each Micro Arcade will cost between $20 and $25, which is a little hard to swallow when you can play those games for free on your smartphone. But, if the idea of an adorable dedicated handheld appeals to you, these look really well made. -- -- 1 Author, writer, maker, and a former mechanical designer. www.cameroncoward.com @cameron_coward Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Personal data migration: revolutionizing customer data
Subtitle: Written by Gad Zehavi
Author: Gad Zehavi
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Gad Zehavi Follow -- Listen Share They say the first cut is the deepest. While that might very well be true, according to millions of online grocery shoppers around the world, it is certain that the first shop is the hardest. Learning your way around the site, finding which section the product you are looking for is hidden in, trying to identify the correct size bottle, or read the ingredients of a new product ‚Äî all these things take time. This is what chases away many potential shoppers. But regular online grocery users know that once you have invested the time on that first shop, the next shop goes much faster. Most websites save your grocery list, so all you have to do is choose from the list all the things you bought last time, spend a few minutes adding other products, and check out. This is great when a person regularly shops online at the same retailer. Over time, all the products they buy weekly or monthly appear on their favorites list and the weekly grocery shop takes up to 15 minutes online instead of an hour in store. But what happens when a different online supermarket starts to deliver to your area? Their prices are better, their website is easy to navigate, but you just can‚Äôt face doing that first shop again. Consolid, a young startup based in Israel, has set out to change that. Consolid enables any user to move their favorites between retailer online sites. That means you, as a shopper, can go to the new online grocery store, click ‚ÄúImport Favorites‚Äù and get all your purchase history and your lists to the new site in a matter of seconds. No need to spend all that time and effort on doing a ‚Äúnew shop‚Äù. Import Favorites, introduced in the UK by mySupermarket, has already become market standard in the UK (the country with the highest share of online grocery shopping ‚Äî 7.2% share according to The Grocer) after it has been adopted by all major retailers, providing key value to both the retailer and the end user. The advantages to the customer is that it saves time (meaning they can check out faster), the selection is relevant and personalized, and they can try new supermarkets without the fear of having to commit to a new online grocery site that they may not like and without redoing the dreaded ‚Äúnew shop‚Äù. What is more, Consolid is a ground-breaking platform in that it provides customers with means to control their personal data, something that has been singled out as a key goal in the progress of the World Wide Web by no other than its inventor Sir Tim Berners-Lee in his new Solid initiative. The advantages for the retailers can be broken down to 3 key areas: >> Higher conversion through faster route to checkout and personalized experience Except for the obvious advantage of providing customers with a fast route to checkout, Consolid allows for a personal experience, even when trying a new store. eCommerce sites display recommendations, special offers and codes based on data about each customer‚Äôs previous purchases. Using Consolid enables the software to send notifications about products that are relevant to the customer ‚Äî a person who has diapers and formula on their list will receive a pop up about baby shampoo, a person who buys dry dog food each week will receive a code for ‚Äúbuy 3 get 1 free‚Äù on cans of dog food. This means that retailers can target new customers effectively from the very first time they shop at your site. The amount of data available about each customer through Consolid allows the retailer to build an enriched profile that gives them information about the preferred time of day that this customer shops, brands they like, if they respond well to offers, eating preferences such as organic, and many other variables. All this data allows the store to build a personalized shopping experience from the very first shop. And of course, if a customer has a good first experience, they are likely to return. >> Insights into competitor data, allowing for better market positioning Consolid gives grocery companies a unique insight into their competition. By allowing customers to import their personal data from a competing retailer, grocers can gain valuable insights into shopper habits and shopping patterns of users in competing retailers, allowing them to better analyze the competitive landscape and form better strategies leading to smarter business decisions. >> The ability to promote private label products As part of the matching process between different retailer‚Äôs products, Consolid provides retailers with the unique opportunity to promote their private label products when a branded replacement is not available or less suitable. Consolid enables users to fill the mental gap between brick-and-mortar and online stores and to hold accounts at multiple stores. Research shows that most people tend to shop in different brick-and-mortar supermarkets depending on what they are buying ‚Äî maybe there is a more expensive place closer to home where they shop in an emergency, and a cheaper place where they go for bulk products. Online shopping is no different. If one site has fast delivery service, but another has cheaper products, there is no reason for a customer not to shop in both places ‚Äî except that it is a pain in the neck! But with the ability to import lists between retailers, customers have the flexibility to choose where to shop and are more likely to do more of their grocery shopping online. Consolid can work with all categories of online retail, however we have chosen to begin with grocery since these shops take the longest and shoppers tend to buy the same items regularly ‚Äî meaning that Consolid can have an instant impact on customer satisfaction which will show in an increase of completed baskets. Visit www.consolid.io for more information. Gad Zehavi is the founder and CEO of Consolid. -- -- Entrepreneur and a Product person, but first and foremost a creator. Title: Hotel Technology Results in Competitive Advantage & Seamless Guest Experiences. An Insightful Conversation With Mohammad Shoaib Ziaee, Director Information Technology at Advanced Hospitality Technologies inc.
Subtitle: Written by Wajid Hussain
Author: Wajid Hussain
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Wajid Hussain Follow -- Listen Share In our latest influencer spotlight interviews we sat down with industry legend Mohammad Shoaib Ziaee, Director of Information Technology at Advanced Hospitality Technologies inc. Mohammad has been a lifelong technology enthusiast, starting out in the technology management industry as far back as 1996. His passion for progress, innovation, and creating technology marvels has made him one of the top most hospitality technology consultants in the US. As a young network & systems engineer Mohammed grew in ranks from site engineer, project manager, to maestro hotel technology consultant. He is a certified HFTP (Hospitality Financial and Technology Professionals) consultant. Mohammed is also a career coach and source of inspiration for his executive team. He claims himself that his pursuit of perfection keeps him going to do better with each asset. Technology at hotels according to him should make time for more precious & cozy moments, it should leave a memory that you remember where ever you go. Mohammad loves to read and study about new technologies. He is also a frequent traveler with quite a travel manifest tracing from North America across Asia and Europe. Mohammad also enjoys discovering new cuisines, although he longs for his favorites from home every day. Advanced Hospitality: How important do you think technology is for hotels? Mohammad: Like any other industry technology plays a major role in making hospitality business easier. It‚Äôs not even limited to a handful of tech solutions. There are diverse applications of tech including project management, cybersecurity solutions, mobility tools, ERP & CMS software, and various others. Technology makes hospitality functions simpler, secure, and faster, making service delivery better than being delivered by humans alone. Advanced Hospitality: What are some of the advantages you have observed integrating technology in hotels? Mohammad: Over 25 years of implementing tech solutions and upgrading technology infrastructure, I have noticed countless benefits ranging from financial feasibility, operational efficiency, enhanced service quality, to more sustainable business operations across different properties. The emerging trend of big data & IoT has also intensified the applications of information technology for intelligent business decision making & strategy. Cutting edge cyber security solutions have also helped better data management and data storage at hotels. We are also working relentlessly to radically improve POS payment system security. Increasing hacks and data breaches across hospitality demand more rigorous monitoring and defense tools. We are therefore innovating the payment security process with the latest practices, tools, and better management principles. [‚Ä¶Continue Reading‚Ä¶] -- -- Organizer Of #Magento Meetup Dubai, Manager Digital Marketing at Advanced Hospitality Technologies Inc. Title: Genetic Coding, What the Future Has In Store for Us.
Subtitle: Written by Gevorg Manoukian
Author: Gevorg Manoukian
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Gevorg Manoukian Follow -- Listen Share Biology is about more than the physical bodies in which we live. Although on a metric level, biology is numbers and codes for how each atom in our bodies cluster together, we are more than just our genetic code. Our bodies belong to more than just us. Never have we ever been able to alter our biological makeup into other forms of variations. The rapid advancements in our technologies convince individuals that there will soon be various forms of genetic alterations. This brings forth the question in many people‚Äôs minds, will these types of inventions harm or benefit our human race? Many forms of research have and are being done to alter such changes to our genetic makeup. Gregory Stock, a writer and author of ‚ÄúRedesigning Humans choosing our genes, changing our future‚Äù claims that already ‚Äúresearchers have done early procedures on nonhuman primates‚Äù. Conducting experimental genetic research on other forms of life leaves us to question, when will they start to conduct experimental researches on human life? But the modification to our biological makeup is far more closely than many realize. We have started to come to a point in society where such advancements in technologies can potentially harm us rather than being beneficial. However, such genetic alterations are been in use for reversing potential health concerns within babies in the embryonic stage. Such new forms of technologies advancement are coming to play every year. On the other hand, surgical processes including ethnic plastic surgery or ethnic modification have been at work within our generation. The genetic alteration in order to improve one‚Äôs appearance has played a vast interest in today‚Äôs society. Gregory Stock responds to the outbreak of surgical changes to our appearance by proclaiming that technological advancements one day is able to reshape our genetic coding into more physical appealing ways, many individuals will take part. The status of money and competition amongst one another has been an ongoing setback in our society. The idea of altering one‚Äôs appearance to look more pleasing has changed the future of technological advancements, and what it could have potentially been. The possibility of uncertainty is high within new forms of technology. The idea of genetic enhancement on children has forever been in the minds of many physicians. However, Leon Kass, an American physician, scientist, educator, and a bioethicist at the University of Chicago, has no little to no doubt in the failing of such forms of advancements. Kass rather worries about treating every human life at any stage. ‚ÄúThere is something deeply repugnant and fundamentally transgressive about such a utilitarian treatment of prospective human life,‚Äù he writes. It is difficult to conclude that such a form of genetic alteration can bring upon beneficial and intended results. Yet the extinction and disasters to our human race will not be because of our failures but because of our successes. -- -- Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams

Title: Popcorn Instead of C.H.I.P.s?
Subtitle: A ‚ÄúFinal‚Äù Limited Edition GR8-Based C.H.I.P. Compatible Board
Author: Alasdair Allan
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Alasdair Allan Follow -- 1 Listen Share The final demise of Next Thing Co. left a good number of C.H.I.P. owners really rather annoyed. Predictably perhaps, that meant some of them tried to build a replacement. In the year since the company went under we‚Äôve seen at least one straight copy built around the same GR8 as the original C.H.I.P. Pro. briefly for sale on Amazon. However now it looks like the company that produced it, called Source Parts, is back with something that isn‚Äôt quite a clone. Called the Kettlepop, the new board is built around the GR8, but there have been some significant changes. The Kettlepop is based on the 1GHz-clocked Cortex-A8 GR8 System-in-Package, with 256MB RAM, and between 8GB and 128GB eMMC, and offers onboard Wi-Fi and Bluetooth support. While the board is both pin and software compatible with the original C.H.I.P. Pro board, it‚Äôs not going to be around for long as the manufacturer has the last remaining stock of the GR8 available, as they say, ‚Äú‚Ä¶last year, after Next Thing Co. was liquidated, I was able to obtain 662 GR8 System-in-Packages which happened to be the last stock available on Earth.‚Äù Initially anticipating making a direct copy of the C.H.I.P Pro, changes were made to the open sourced design of the board due to the compromises inherent in the original design, there to save pennies, and keep the cost of the original board down as far as possible. ‚ÄúThe memory chosen for C.H.I.P Pro was 512MB Toshiba NAND Flash Memory because it was about a dollar cheaper than it‚Äôs more reliable counterpart eMMC Memory when you buy direct from the manufacturer. Unfortunately, without an initial order of thousands of pieces one has to resort to the open market to source this component. I found that the cost of this component on the market was higher than 8GB eMMC direct from the manufacturer Longsys‚Ä¶‚Äù The Kettlepop joins the other C.H.I.P derived board produced by Source Parts, the Popcorn Computer, based around the Allwinner R8, which is pin-to-pin compatible to the original C.H.I.P. rather than the C.H.I.P. Pro. Although still I‚Äôm not entirely sure why this new board exists, other than because they could build it, because it really doesn‚Äôt have a future. Source Parts is currently offering ‚Äú‚Ä¶500 units of Kettlepop for $19,500 USD at a price of $39 each.‚Äù But once they‚Äôre gone, they‚Äôre gone. There really isn‚Äôt a future for this GR8 design, so if you‚Äôre looking to replace your C.H.I.P you might want to look at a Beagle-ish copy that, while it shares the C.H.I.P form factor, has been built around the Octavo Systems OSD3358 better known as the ‚ÄúBeagleBone on a chip.‚Äù -- -- 1 Scientist, Author, Hacker, Maker, and Journalist. Title: 4 Things that I have learnt from waitressing in New York City for almost a decade.
Subtitle: Published in BiologiqueLife
Author: Hali Tsotetsi
Article: Sign up Sign in Sign up Sign in Hali Tsotetsi Follow BiologiqueLife -- Listen Share When I moved to New York City, I was nineteen. Although the almost ten years that I lived there passed by so quickly, I learnt many valuable lessons. Most of them I learnt while I was waitressing tables on-and-off in the midst of receiving my tertiary education. One of my first memories was working at a well-known caf√© in the Lower East Side and I asked a famous actress what her daughter‚Äôs name is, only to be met with a nasty look and assumption that I should‚Äôve known her name. I laughed it off but this taught me a lesson that people of a certain stature usually expect to be treated a certain way. Here are four other things that I learnt while I was a waitress living in The Big Apple: I have made most of my adulthood friends from different restaurants that I have worked at, as well as romantic partners. To this day, one of my dearest friends is in his seventies and someone that I met at a restaurant that I worked at in S.O.H.O. I am so grateful for the experience of working at restaurants because it taught me that we are more alike than not. And, when we box ourselves into categories like race, income brackets and religious views, we only stop ourselves from accepting the highest form of love: love from anyone. 2. Respect is not about a bank account. I used to work at a famous restaurant in TriBeCa, we would have a well-known person in almost everyday. To be honest, sometimes I dreaded going in to work because we were treated by some of our authority and clientele like garbage on the floor. Sometimes it would upset me and hurt my feelings but I am grateful because I learnt one of the best lessons ever, respecting others is not determined by how much money the other person has in their bank account. Until someone proves otherwise, they deserve my respect. It took me going through that experience to remember and truly understand that. 3. Happiness is not dependent on ‚Äòwho you are‚Äô or how much money you have. I saw firsthand some of the wealthiest people in America with the saddest faces that I have ever seen. We have been sold this idea that money can buy everything. Yes, money is a tool that can connect you to a higher purpose and accessibility but if the reason why you have it is to bring you something that you can get without money, you have lost the plot. Money is like energy, it can be negative or positive in your life but it depends on your mindset and your intention behind having it. 4. Not everyone has to like me. When I was younger, I had this idea that everyone had to like me because if they didn‚Äôt, I had probably done something to them or wasn‚Äôt enough.This theory used to exhaust me and I allowed people to treat me with disrespect just so that they would stay in my life- making me feel better about myself. When a Manger or Customer treated me unkindly, I would take it personally and hold on to it for days and months. I thought that if I could control how they saw me, it would empower me; only to learn that it does the opposite. Ultimately, people treat me the way that they want to. All that I can do is be the best person that I am able to, show up, be kind and give my all. How people choose to treat me is their choice. My power lies in understanding that I can only control myself and freeing myself from other people‚Äôs expectations of me. -- -- A clean mind, a clean body and a clean planet. Hali is a certified yoga teacher, certified HealthCoach and certified skin specialist ‚ù§Ô∏è Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Terms Text to speech Teams
